Question 1 (Single answer)
You are building an ML model to detect anomalies in real-time sensor data. You will use Pub/Sub to handle incoming requests. You want to store the results for analytics and visualization. How should you configure the pipeline?

1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán b·∫•t th∆∞·ªùng trong d·ªØ li·ªáu c·∫£m bi·∫øn th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Pub/Sub ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·∫øn v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ k·∫øt qu·∫£ ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† tr·ª±c quan h√≥a. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt c·∫•u h√¨nh pipeline ph√π h·ª£p t·ª´ c√°c l·ª±a ch·ªçn c√≥ s·∫µn.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: ph√°t hi·ªán b·∫•t th∆∞·ªùng, d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Pub/Sub, l∆∞u tr·ªØ k·∫øt qu·∫£ cho ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† tr·ª±c quan h√≥a.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Dataflow c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, AI Platform ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh ML, BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: DataProc kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, AutoML c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng cho ML nh∆∞ng Cloud Bigtable kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªët nh·∫•t cho ph√¢n t√≠ch.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: BigQuery kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, AutoML c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng cho ML nh∆∞ng Cloud Functions kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªët nh·∫•t cho ph√¢n t√≠ch.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: BigQuery kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, AI Platform c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng cho ML nh∆∞ng Cloud Storage kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªët nh·∫•t cho ph√¢n t√≠ch.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
L·ª±a ch·ªçn A c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c d·ªãch v·ª• ph√π h·ª£p cho t·ª´ng b∆∞·ªõc trong pipeline: Dataflow cho x·ª≠ l√Ω th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, AI Platform cho ML, v√† BigQuery cho l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† A: 1 = Dataflow, 2 = AI Platform, 3 = BigQuery.
Question 1 of 294
Question 2 (Single answer)
Your organization wants to make its internal shuttle service route more efficient. The shuttles currently stop at all pick-up points across the city every 30 minutes between 7 am and 10 am. The development team has already built an application on Google Kubernetes Engine that requires users to confirm their presence and shuttle station one day in advance. What approach should you take?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi:
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m ra ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu qu·∫£ c·ªßa d·ªãch v·ª• xe ƒë∆∞a ƒë√≥n n·ªôi b·ªô b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ·ª©ng d·ª•ng ƒë√£ c√≥ tr√™n Google Kubernetes Engine. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • Xe ƒë∆∞a ƒë√≥n hi·ªán t·∫°i d·ª´ng ·ªü t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c ƒëi·ªÉm ƒë√≥n m·ªói 30 ph√∫t.
    • Ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng c·∫ßn x√°c nh·∫≠n s·ª± c√≥ m·∫∑t v√† tr·∫°m xe m·ªôt ng√†y tr∆∞·ªõc.
    • ·ª®ng d·ª•ng ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c x√¢y d·ª±ng tr√™n Google Kubernetes Engine.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªìi quy ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng h√†nh kh√°ch t·∫°i m·ªói tr·∫°m. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc xe nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒë·ªÉ quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c√≥ ƒë√≥n kh√°ch t·∫°i m·ªói tr·∫°m hay kh√¥ng. Tuy nhi√™n, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh t·ªïng th·ªÉ.
    • C: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh l·ªô tr√¨nh t·ªëi ∆∞u l√† l·ªô tr√¨nh ng·∫Øn nh·∫•t qua c√°c tr·∫°m c√≥ x√°c nh·∫≠n s·ª± c√≥ m·∫∑t, c√≥ t√≠nh ƒë·∫øn gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ª©c ch·ª©a. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªçc tƒÉng c∆∞·ªùng v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i c√¢y ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n s·ª± c√≥ m·∫∑t c·ªßa h√†nh kh√°ch. Ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt t·ªëi ∆∞u h∆°n ph∆∞∆°ng √°n C.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh t·ªïng th·ªÉ.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh v√† s·ª©c ch·ª©a.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C v√¨ n√≥ tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªô tr√¨nh d·ª±a tr√™n x√°c nh·∫≠n s·ª± c√≥ m·∫∑t c·ªßa h√†nh kh√°ch v√† gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ª©c ch·ª©a.
Question 2 of 294
Question 3 (Single answer)
You were asked to investigate failures of a production line component based on sensor readings. After receiving the dataset, you discover that less than of the readings are positive examples representing failure incidents. You have tried to train several classification models, but none of them converge. How should you resolve the class imbalance problem?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp trong d·ªØ li·ªáu c·∫£m bi·∫øn, v·ªõi ch·ªâ m·ªôt s·ªë √≠t v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh (s·ª± c·ªë h·ªèng h√≥c). ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: V·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ch√≠nh l√† m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp, v·ªõi √≠t v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh. C√°c m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒë√£ th·ª≠ kh√¥ng h·ªôi t·ª•, cho th·∫•y c·∫ßn ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh d·ªØ li·ªáu ho·∫∑c ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: T·∫°o ra 10% v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh t·ª´ ph√¢n ph·ªëi l·ªõp c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt ƒë∆∞·ª£c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng m√† c√≤n c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m sai l·ªách d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m·∫°ng n∆°-ron t√≠ch ch·∫≠p v·ªõi max pooling v√† softmax kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp.
  • C: Downsample d·ªØ li·ªáu v·ªõi upweighting ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o m·∫´u c√≥ 10% v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp.
  • D: Lo·∫°i b·ªè v√≠ d·ª• √¢m t√≠nh cho ƒë·∫øn khi s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng v√≠ d·ª• d∆∞∆°ng v√† √¢m b·∫±ng nhau c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn m·∫•t th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ƒë·ªÅ xu·∫•t m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p x·ª≠ l√Ω m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp ph·ªï bi·∫øn v√† h·ª£p l√Ω.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 3 of 294
Question 4 (Single answer)
You want to rebuild your ML pipeline for structured data on Google Cloud. You are using PySpark to conduct data transformations at scale, but your pipelines are taking over 12 hours to run. To speed up development and pipeline run time, you want to use a serverless tool and SQL syntax. You have already moved your raw data into Cloud Storage. How should you build the pipeline on Google Cloud while meeting the speed and processing requirements?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng l·∫°i pipeline ML cho d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ c·∫•u tr√∫c tr√™n Google Cloud, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng c·ª• serverless v√† c√∫ ph√°p SQL ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† th·ªùi gian ch·∫°y pipeline. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng c·ª• serverless. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√∫ ph√°p SQL. - D·ªØ li·ªáu th√¥ ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c chuy·ªÉn v√†o Cloud Storage. - TƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† th·ªùi gian ch·∫°y pipeline.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Data Fusion l√† c√¥ng c·ª• c√≥ giao di·ªán GUI nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ho√†n to√†n serverless v√† kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng SQL. - B: Dataproc kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† serverless v√† SparkSQL kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† SQL thu·∫ßn t√∫y. - C: Cloud SQL kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† serverless v√† vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng federated queries c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho t·ªëc ƒë·ªô. - D: BigQuery l√† c√¥ng c·ª• serverless v√† h·ªó tr·ª£ SQL, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng SQL v√† kh√¥ng ho√†n to√†n serverless. - B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do kh√¥ng serverless. - C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do kh√¥ng serverless v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u. - D: Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi t·∫•t c·∫£ y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 4 of 294
Question 5 (Single answer)
You manage a team of data scientists who use a cloud-based backend system to submit training jobs. This system has become very difficult to administer, and you want to use a managed service instead. The data scientists you work with use many different frameworks, including Keras, PyTorch, theano, Scikit-learn, and custom libraries. What should you do?

Question 5 of 294
Question 6 (Single answer)
You work for an online retail company that is creating a visual search engine. You have set up an end-to-end ML pipeline on Google Cloud to classify whether an image contains your company's product. Expecting the release of new products in the near future, you configured a retraining functionality in the pipeline so that new data can be fed into your ML models. You also want to use AI Platform's continuous evaluation service to ensure that the models have high accuracy on your test dataset. What should you do?

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

Question 6 of 294
Question 7 (Single answer)
You need to build classification workflows over several structured datasets currently stored in BigQuery. Because you will be performing the classification several times, you want to complete the following steps without writing code: exploratory data analysis, feature selection, model building, training, and hyperparameter tuning and serving. 2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: kh√¥ng vi·∫øt m√£, th·ª±c hi·ªán ph√¢n lo·∫°i nhi·ªÅu l·∫ßn, v√† c√°c b∆∞·ªõc t·ª´ ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·∫øn tri·ªÉn khai.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B: BigQuery ML c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh∆∞ng y√™u c·∫ßu vi·∫øt m√£ SQL v√† kh√¥ng bao g·ªìm t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c b∆∞·ªõc nh∆∞ ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë v√† tri·ªÉn khai.
  • C: AI Platform Notebooks y√™u c·∫ßu vi·∫øt m√£ Python, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng vi·∫øt m√£.
  • D: AI Platform y√™u c·∫ßu vi·∫øt m√£ ƒë·ªÉ c·∫•u h√¨nh v√† ch·∫°y c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng vi·∫øt m√£.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n A c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn vi·∫øt m√£.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A: Configure AutoML Tables to perform the classification task.
Question 7 of 294
Question 8 (Single answer)
You work for a public transportation company and need to build a model to estimate delay times for multiple transportation routes. Predictions are served directly to users in an app in real time. Because different seasons and population increases impact the data relevance, you will retrain the model every month. You want to follow Google-recommended best practices. How should
you configure the end-to-end architecture of the predictive model?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ ∆∞·ªõc t√≠nh th·ªùi gian tr·ªÖ cho c√°c tuy·∫øn ƒë∆∞·ªùng giao th√¥ng c√¥ng c·ªông v√† tri·ªÉn khai d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c ti·∫øp cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng trong th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. M√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i h√†ng th√°ng do s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu theo m√πa v√† s·ª± gia tƒÉng d√¢n s·ªë. B·∫°n c·∫ßn l√†m theo c√°c th·ª±c h√†nh t·ªët nh·∫•t ƒë∆∞·ª£c Google khuy·∫øn ngh·ªã. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p c·∫•u h√¨nh ki·∫øn tr√∫c end-to-end cho m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: m√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, c·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i h√†ng th√°ng, v√† c·∫ßn tu√¢n theo c√°c th·ª±c h√†nh t·ªët nh·∫•t c·ªßa Google.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Kubeflow Pipelines l√† m·ªôt c√¥ng c·ª• m·∫°nh m·∫Ω cho vi·ªác qu·∫£n l√Ω c√°c workflow ph·ª©c t·∫°p t·ª´ hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë·∫øn tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a v√† l·ªãch tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i h√†ng th√°ng.
  • B: BigQuery ML c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω workflow ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
  • C: Cloud Functions v√† Cloud Scheduler c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán c√¥ng vi·ªác nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u cho qu·∫£n l√Ω workflow ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c nh·∫Øc ƒë·∫øn nh∆∞ th·ª±c h√†nh t·ªët nh·∫•t c·ªßa Google.
  • D: Cloud Composer c√≥ th·ªÉ qu·∫£n l√Ω workflow nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Cao - Kubeflow Pipelines l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë∆∞·ª£c khuy·∫øn ngh·ªã cho qu·∫£n l√Ω workflow ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a.
  • B: Th·∫•p - Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
  • C: Trung b√¨nh - C√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v√† kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† th·ª±c h√†nh t·ªët nh·∫•t.
  • D: Trung b√¨nh - C√≥ th·ªÉ qu·∫£n l√Ω workflow nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 8 of 294
Question 9 (Single answer)
You are developing ML models with AI Platform for image segmentation on CT scans. You frequently update your model architectures based on the newest available research papers, and have to rerun training on the same dataset to benchmark their performance. You want to minimize computation costs and manual intervention while having version control for your code. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n cho c√¢u h·ªèi
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t tri·ªÉn c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh ML v·ªõi AI Platform cho vi·ªác ph√¢n ƒëo·∫°n h√¨nh ·∫£nh tr√™n CT scans. Y√™u c·∫ßu l√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠ t√≠nh to√°n v√† can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi c√≥ ki·ªÉm so√°t phi√™n b·∫£n cho m√£ ngu·ªìn. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng

C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n ki·∫øn tr√∫c m√¥ h√¨nh, ch·∫°y l·∫°i hu·∫•n luy·ªán tr√™n c√πng t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu, gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠ v√† can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng, v√† ki·ªÉm so√°t phi√™n b·∫£n m√£ ngu·ªìn.

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
  • A: Cloud Functions c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a m·ªôt s·ªë t√°c v·ª• nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p ki·ªÉm so√°t phi√™n b·∫£n m√£ ngu·ªìn.
  • B: gcloud command-line tool y√™u c·∫ßu can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng m·ªói khi c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√£ ngu·ªìn.
  • C: Cloud Build k·∫øt h·ª£p v·ªõi Cloud Source Repositories c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông k√≠ch ho·∫°t hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i khi c√≥ m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªõi, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi cung c·∫•p ki·ªÉm so√°t phi√™n b·∫£n.
  • D: Cloud Composer c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a quy tr√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ki·ªÉm so√°t phi√™n b·∫£n m√£ ngu·ªìn.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a, ki·ªÉm so√°t phi√™n b·∫£n, v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi

ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Build k·∫øt h·ª£p v·ªõi Cloud Source Repositories ƒë·ªÉ k√≠ch ho·∫°t hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i khi c√≥ m√£ ngu·ªìn m·ªõi ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫©y l√™n kho l∆∞u tr·ªØ.

Question 9 of 294
Question 10 (Single answer)
Your team needs to build a model that predicts whether images contain a driver's license, passport, or credit card. The data engineering team already built the pipeline and generated a dataset composed of 10,000 images with driver's licenses, 1,000 images with passports, and 1,000 images with credit cards. You now have to train a model with the following label map: [`Àúdrivers_license', `Àúpassport', `Àúcredit_card']. Which loss function should you use?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn h√†m m·∫•t m√°t (loss function) ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh v·ªõi ba nh√£n: gi·∫•y ph√©p l√°i xe, h·ªô chi·∫øu, v√† th·∫ª t√≠n d·ª•ng. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh th√†nh ba lo·∫°i: driver's license, passport, credit card.
    • D·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ ba nh√£n, do ƒë√≥ ƒë√¢y l√† b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒëa l·ªõp (multi-class classification).
    • C√°c nh√£n ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√£ h√≥a d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng m·ªôt danh s√°ch c√°c nh√£n (label map).
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • Categorical hinge: Th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng cho c√°c b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒëa l·ªõp nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·ªï bi·∫øn nh∆∞ categorical cross-entropy.
    • Binary cross-entropy: D√πng cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi b√†i to√°n c√≥ nhi·ªÅu h∆°n hai nh√£n.
    • Categorical cross-entropy: Ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒëa l·ªõp khi c√°c nh√£n ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√£ h√≥a d·∫°ng one-hot.
    • Sparse categorical cross-entropy: C≈©ng d√πng cho ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒëa l·ªõp nh∆∞ng khi nh√£n kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√£ h√≥a one-hot m√† l√† c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • Categorical hinge: Kh√¥ng ph·ªï bi·∫øn, kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • Binary cross-entropy: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p, kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng r·∫•t th·∫•p.
    • Categorical cross-entropy: Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t, kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
    • Sparse categorical cross-entropy: C√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë√∫ng n·∫øu nh√£n kh√¥ng one-hot, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C - Categorical cross-entropy.
Question 10 of 294
Question 11 (Single answer)
You are designing an ML recommendation model for shoppers on your company's ecommerce website. You will use Recommendations AI to build, test, and deploy your system. How should you develop recommendations that increase revenue while following best practices?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt k·∫ø m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh g·ª£i √Ω ML cho ng∆∞·ªùi mua s·∫Øm tr√™n trang web th∆∞∆°ng m·∫°i ƒëi·ªán t·ª≠ c·ªßa c√¥ng ty, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Recommendations AI ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng, ki·ªÉm tra v√† tri·ªÉn khai h·ªá th·ªëng. 2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh g·ª£i √Ω ML - Recommendations AI - TƒÉng doanh thu - Th·ª±c h√†nh t·ªët nh·∫•t
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: TƒÉng t·ª∑ l·ªá nh·∫•p chu·ªôt c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn tƒÉng doanh thu. - B: TƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc gi·ªè h√†ng c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp tƒÉng doanh thu. - C: Nh·∫≠p s·ª± ki·ªán ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng v√† danh m·ª•c s·∫£n ph·∫©m l√† c·∫ßn thi·∫øt nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác tƒÉng doanh thu. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng gi√° tr·ªã t·∫°m th·ªùi c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng d·ªØ li·ªáu cho m√¥ h√¨nh.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p - B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao - C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p - D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p

Question 11 of 294
Question 12 (Single answer)
You are designing an architecture with a serverless ML system to enrich customer support tickets with informative metadata before they are routed to a support agent. You need a set of models to predict ticket priority, predict ticket resolution time, and perform sentiment analysis to help agents make strategic decisions when they process support requests. Tickets are not expected to have any domain-specific terms or jargon. The proposed architecture has the following flow:
Which endpoints should the Enrichment Cloud Functions call?
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh c√°c endpoints m√† c√°c Enrichment Cloud Functions n√™n g·ªçi trong m·ªôt h·ªá th·ªëng ML kh√¥ng m√°y ch·ªß ƒë·ªÉ l√†m gi√†u th√¥ng tin cho c√°c phi·∫øu h·ªó tr·ª£ kh√°ch h√†ng. C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points quan tr·ªçng
C√°c key points quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë·ªô ∆∞u ti√™n c·ªßa phi·∫øu, d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian gi·∫£i quy·∫øt phi·∫øu, v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c. C√°c phi·∫øu kh√¥ng c√≥ thu·∫≠t ng·ªØ chuy√™n ng√†nh ho·∫∑c bi·ªát ng·ªØ.
B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë·ªô ∆∞u ti√™n v√† th·ªùi gian gi·∫£i quy·∫øt, AutoML Vision cho ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ AutoML Vision kh√¥ng d√πng cho ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë·ªô ∆∞u ti√™n v√† th·ªùi gian gi·∫£i quy·∫øt, AutoML Natural Language cho ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ AutoML Natural Language kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p trong y√™u c·∫ßu.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë·ªô ∆∞u ti√™n v√† th·ªùi gian gi·∫£i quy·∫øt, Cloud Natural Language API cho ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c. Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ Cloud Natural Language API c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Natural Language API cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë·ªô ∆∞u ti√™n, AI Platform cho th·ªùi gian gi·∫£i quy·∫øt, Cloud Vision API cho ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ Cloud Vision API kh√¥ng d√πng cho ph√¢n t√≠ch c·∫£m x√∫c.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n
L·ª±a ch·ªçn C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë√∫ng d·ªãch v·ª• cho t·ª´ng nhi·ªám v·ª• ƒë∆∞·ª£c y√™u c·∫ßu trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† C: 1 = AI Platform, 2 = AI Platform, 3 = Cloud Natural Language API.
Question 12 of 294
Question 13 (Single answer)
You have trained a deep neural network model on Google Cloud. The model has low loss on the training data, but is performing worse on the validation data. You want the model to be resilient to overfitting. Which strategy should you use when retraining the model?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÉ l√†m cho m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng b·ªã overfitting khi hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: M√¥ h√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i c√≥ ƒë·ªô m·∫•t m√°t th·∫•p tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán nh∆∞ng ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông k√©m tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu x√°c th·ª±c, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y cho th·∫•y m√¥ h√¨nh ƒëang b·ªã overfitting. C·∫ßn t√¨m c√°ch l√†m cho m√¥ h√¨nh ch·ªëng l·∫°i overfitting.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng dropout v√† gi·∫£m learning rate c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m overfitting, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t·ªëi ∆∞u.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng L2 regularization v√† gi·∫£m learning rate c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m overfitting, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t·ªëi ∆∞u.
    • C: Ch·∫°y m·ªôt job tuning hyperparameter tr√™n AI Platform ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a c√°c tham s·ªë L2 regularization v√† dropout l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n to√†n di·ªán h∆°n ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m ra c·∫•u h√¨nh t·ªët nh·∫•t ch·ªëng overfitting.
    • D: T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a learning rate v√† tƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng neuron c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ overfitting.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, v√¨ ch·ªâ √°p d·ª•ng m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ƒë∆°n l·∫ª.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, v√¨ ch·ªâ √°p d·ª•ng m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ƒë∆°n l·∫ª.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao, v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a to√†n di·ªán.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ overfitting.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C, v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a to√†n di·ªán ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m ra c·∫•u h√¨nh t·ªët nh·∫•t ch·ªëng overfitting.
Question 13 of 294
Question 14 (Single answer)
You built and manage a production system that is responsible for predicting sales numbers. Model accuracy is crucial, because the production model is required to keep up with market changes. Since being deployed to production, the model hasn't changed; however the accuracy of the model has steadily deteriorated. What issue is most likely causing the steady decline in model accuracy?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n doanh s·ªë ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai v√† kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi k·ªÉ t·ª´ ƒë√≥.

    • ƒê·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh r·∫•t quan tr·ªçng v√¨ c·∫ßn theo k·ªãp v·ªõi s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi c·ªßa th·ªã tr∆∞·ªùng.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • C. Too few layers in the model for capturing information: S·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ªõp trong m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn kh·∫£ nƒÉng h·ªçc c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± suy gi·∫£m d·∫ßn d·∫ßn n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi.
    • D. Incorrect data split ratio during model training, evaluation, validation, and test: T·ª∑ l·ªá chia d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c ban ƒë·∫ßu, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± suy gi·∫£m d·∫ßn d·∫ßn.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

Question 14 of 294
Question 15 (Single answer)

Question 15 of 294
Question 16 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a large grocery retailer with stores in multiple regions. You have been asked to create an inventory prediction model. Your model's features include region, location, historical demand, and seasonal popularity. You want the algorithm to learn from new inventory data on a daily basis. 3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B. Reinforcement Learning: H·ªçc tƒÉng c∆∞·ªùng kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng c√≥ y·∫øu t·ªë t∆∞∆°ng t√°c v√† ph·∫£n h·ªìi li√™n t·ª•c.
  • C. Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN): Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ RNN c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu tu·∫ßn t·ª± v√† c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi h√†ng ng√†y.

4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu tu·∫ßn t·ª± v√† c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t h√†ng ng√†y.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C. Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN).
Question 16 of 294
Question 17 (Single answer)
You are building a real-time prediction engine that streams files which may contain Personally Identifiable Information (PII) to Google Cloud. You want to use the Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) API to scan the files. How should you ensure that the PII is not accessible by unauthorized individuals?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

M·ª•c ti√™u l√† ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng PII kh√¥ng th·ªÉ truy c·∫≠p b·ªüi nh·ªØng ng∆∞·ªùi kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√©p.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- X·ª≠ l√Ω th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. - B·∫£o v·ªá th√¥ng tin nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng c√° nh√¢n (PII). - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng API DLP ƒë·ªÉ qu√©t d·ªØ li·ªáu. - NgƒÉn ch·∫∑n truy c·∫≠p tr√°i ph√©p v√†o PII.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Qu√©t ƒë·ªãnh k·ª≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu trong BigQuery c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o x·ª≠ l√Ω th·ªùi gian th·ª±c v√† b·∫£o v·ªá ngay l·∫≠p t·ª©c PII. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ A, vi·ªác qu√©t d·ªØ li·ªáu trong BigQuery trong khi ghi c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o b·∫£o v·ªá ngay l·∫≠p t·ª©c. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Ch·ªâ c√≥ hai bucket (Sensitive v√† Non-sensitive) c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu ch∆∞a ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph√¢n lo·∫°i ban ƒë·∫ßu. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ba bucket (Quarantine, Sensitive, Non-sensitive) cho ph√©p c√°ch ly d·ªØ li·ªáu ban ƒë·∫ßu v√† ph√¢n lo·∫°i tr∆∞·ªõc khi quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh di chuy·ªÉn, ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o b·∫£o v·ªá t·ªët h∆°n cho PII.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ cung c·∫•p m·ªôt c∆° ch·∫ø c√°ch ly v√† ph√¢n lo·∫°i d·ªØ li·ªáu tr∆∞·ªõc khi quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh x·ª≠ l√Ω, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫£o v·ªá PII.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:

Question 17 of 294
Question 18 (Single answer)
You work for a large hotel chain and have been asked to assist the marketing team in gathering predictions for a targeted marketing strategy. You need to make predictions about user lifetime value (LTV) over the next 20 days so that marketing can be adjusted accordingly. The customer dataset is in BigQuery, and you are preparing the tabular data for training with AutoML Tables. This data has a time signal that is spread across multiple columns. How should you ensure that AutoML fits the best model to your data?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

D·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian tr·∫£i r·ªông tr√™n nhi·ªÅu c·ªôt. B·∫°n c·∫ßn ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o AutoML ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa b·∫°n. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

  • D·ª± ƒëo√°n gi√° tr·ªã v√≤ng ƒë·ªùi kh√°ch h√†ng (LTV).
  • D·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian tr·∫£i r·ªông tr√™n nhi·ªÅu c·ªôt.
  • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML Tables.
  • C·∫ßn ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o m√¥ h√¨nh ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu.

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • A: K·∫øt h·ª£p th·ªß c√¥ng c√°c c·ªôt c√≥ t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian th√†nh m·ªôt m·∫£ng v√† ƒë·ªÉ AutoML t·ª± di·ªÖn gi·∫£i. Tuy nhi√™n, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t ƒëi √Ω nghƒ©a th·ªùi gian c·ªßa d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  • B: G·ª≠i d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ b·∫•t k·ª≥ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi th·ªß c√¥ng n√†o v√† ƒë·ªÉ AutoML x·ª≠ l√Ω. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian.
  • C: G·ª≠i d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi th·ªß c√¥ng v√† ch·ªâ ƒë·ªãnh m·ªôt c·ªôt th√≠ch h·ª£p l√†m c·ªôt th·ªùi gian. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ch√≠nh x√°c n·∫øu t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian n·∫±m ·ªü nhi·ªÅu c·ªôt.
  • D: G·ª≠i d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi th·ªß c√¥ng v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c c·ªôt c√≥ t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ chia d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªß c√¥ng. ƒê·∫£m b·∫£o d·ªØ li·ªáu trong t·∫≠p x√°c th·ª±c v√† ki·ªÉm tra l√† t·ª´ 30 ng√†y sau d·ªØ li·ªáu trong t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n d·ª±a tr√™n xu h∆∞·ªõng th·ªùi gian.

4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

  • A: Th·∫•p, v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t √Ω nghƒ©a th·ªùi gian.
  • B: Trung b√¨nh, v√¨ kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian.
  • C: Trung b√¨nh, v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ch√≠nh x√°c n·∫øu t√≠n hi·ªáu th·ªùi gian n·∫±m ·ªü nhi·ªÅu c·ªôt.
  • D: Cao, v√¨ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n d·ª±a tr√™n xu h∆∞·ªõng th·ªùi gian.

5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:

L·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng l√† D, v√¨ n√≥ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n d·ª±a tr√™n xu h∆∞·ªõng th·ªùi gian b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ c√°c kho·∫£ng th·ªùi gian kh√°c nhau m·ªôt c√°ch h·ª£p l√Ω.

Question 18 of 294
Question 19 (Single answer)
You have written unit tests for a Kubeflow Pipeline that require custom libraries. You want to automate the execution of unit tests with each new push to your development branch in Cloud Source Repositories. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n

Question 19 of 294
Question 20 (Single answer)
You are training an LSTM-based model on AI Platform to summarize text using the following job submission script: gcloud ai- platform jobs submit training $JOB_NAME \ --package-path $TRAINER_PACKAGE_PATH \ --module-name $MAIN_TRAINER_MODULE \ --job-dir $JOB_DIR \ --region $REGION \ --scale-tier basic \ -- \ --epochs 20 \ --batch_size=32 \ --learning_rate=0.001 \ You want to ensure that training time is minimized without significantly compromising the accuracy of your model. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh LSTM tr√™n AI Platform m√† kh√¥ng l√†m gi·∫£m ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

    • C√°c tham s·ªë hi·ªán t·∫°i: epochs = 20, batch_size = 32, learning_rate = 0.001, scale-tier = basic.
    • M·ª•c ti√™u: Gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√† kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng nhi·ªÅu ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.

    • B: Thay ƒë·ªïi scale-tier c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n, gi√∫p gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√† kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.
    • C: TƒÉng batch size c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng h·ªôi t·ª• c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
    • D: Thay ƒë·ªïi learning rate c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªôi t·ª• v√† ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c, kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán.

    • B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ tƒÉng t√†i nguy√™n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian m√† kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.

Question 20 of 294
Question 21 (Single answer)
You have deployed multiple versions of an image classification model on AI Platform. You want to monitor the performance of the model versions over time. How should you perform this comparison?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n so s√°nh hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa c√°c phi√™n b·∫£n m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i ·∫£nh ƒë√£ tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n AI Platform theo th·ªùi gian. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c t·ª´ kh√≥a quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm "multiple versions", "image classification model", "monitor the performance", v√† "over time". ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y cho th·∫•y c·∫ßn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p so s√°nh hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh theo th·ªùi gian.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: So s√°nh hi·ªáu su·∫•t m·∫•t m√°t tr√™n t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu gi·ªØ l·∫°i. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph·∫£n √°nh ch√≠nh x√°c hi·ªáu su·∫•t theo th·ªùi gian.
  • B: So s√°nh hi·ªáu su·∫•t m·∫•t m√°t tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu x√°c th·ª±c. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ A, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t theo th·ªùi gian.
  • C: So s√°nh ƒë∆∞·ªùng cong ROC b·∫±ng c√¥ng c·ª• What-If. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ h·ªØu √≠ch nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch t·ªët nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t theo th·ªùi gian.
  • D: So s√°nh ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c trung b√¨nh (mean average precision) qua c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh b·∫±ng t√≠nh nƒÉng ƒê√°nh gi√° Li√™n t·ª•c (Continuous Evaluation). ƒê√¢y l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh theo th·ªùi gian.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng t√≠nh nƒÉng ƒê√°nh gi√° Li√™n t·ª•c ƒë·ªÉ theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh theo th·ªùi gian, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 21 of 294
Question 22 (Single answer)
You trained a text classification model. You have the following SignatureDefs:
You started a TensorFlow-serving component server and tried to send an HTTP request to get a prediction using: headers = {"content-type": "application/json"} json_response = requests.post('http: //localhost:8501/v1/models/text_model:predict', data=data, headers=headers) What is the correct way to write the predict request?

2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow-serving v√† y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa d·ªØ li·ªáu JSON ƒë·ªÉ g·ª≠i y√™u c·∫ßu d·ª± ƒëo√°n. 3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng 'signature_name' l√† 'serving_default' v√† 'instances' c√≥ c·∫•u tr√∫c ph√π h·ª£p.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: L·ª±a ch·ªçn D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë√∫ng y√™u c·∫ßu v·ªÅ 'signature_name' v√† c·∫•u tr√∫c 'instances'.

Question 22 of 294
Question 23 (Single answer)
Your organization's call center has asked you to develop a model that analyzes customer sentiments in each call. The call center receives over one million calls daily, and data is stored in Cloud Storage. The data collected must not leave the region in which the call originated, and no Personally Identifiable Information (PII) can be stored or analyzed. The data science team has a third-party tool for visualization and access which requires a SQL ANSI-2011 compliant interface. You need to select components for data processing and for analytics. How should the data pipeline be designed?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt cho c√¢u h·ªèi 23

1. Ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n cho c√¢u h·ªèi:

ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√†: A

2. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt k·∫ø m·ªôt pipeline x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch cho trung t√¢m cu·ªôc g·ªçi c·ªßa t·ªï ch·ª©c. C√°c y√™u c·∫ßu c·ª• th·ªÉ bao g·ªìm:

  • D·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c r·ªùi kh·ªèi khu v·ª±c n∆°i cu·ªôc g·ªçi ph√°t sinh.
  • Kh√¥ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ ho·∫∑c ph√¢n t√≠ch th√¥ng tin nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng c√° nh√¢n (PII).
  • C·∫ßn c√≥ giao di·ªán tu√¢n th·ªß SQL ANSI-2011 ƒë·ªÉ t√≠ch h·ª£p v·ªõi c√¥ng c·ª• c·ªßa b√™n th·ª© ba.

S·ªë l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng theo ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: 1

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

  • Kh·ªëi l∆∞·ª£ng d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn (h∆°n m·ªôt tri·ªáu cu·ªôc g·ªçi m·ªói ng√†y).
  • Y√™u c·∫ßu tu√¢n th·ªß quy ƒë·ªãnh v·ªÅ d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng r·ªùi kh·ªèi khu v·ª±c.
  • Kh√¥ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ ho·∫∑c ph√¢n t√≠ch PII.
  • Y√™u c·∫ßu giao di·ªán SQL ANSI-2011.

4. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c l·ª±a ch·ªçn v·ªõi ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

  • L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: 1 = Dataflow, 2 = BigQuery
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ph√π h·ª£p: Dataflow c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët v·ªõi BigQuery, m·ªôt d·ªãch v·ª• ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu m·∫°nh m·∫Ω v√† tu√¢n th·ªß SQL ANSI-2011.
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ch∆∞a ph√π h·ª£p: Kh√¥ng c√≥.
  • L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: 1 = Pub/Sub, 2 = Datastore
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ph√π h·ª£p: Pub/Sub c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ch∆∞a ph√π h·ª£p: Datastore kh√¥ng h·ªó tr·ª£ SQL ANSI-2011 v√† kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
  • L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: 1 = Dataflow, 2 = Cloud SQL
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ph√π h·ª£p: Dataflow c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ch∆∞a ph√π h·ª£p: Cloud SQL c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß m·∫°nh ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω kh·ªëi l∆∞·ª£ng d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn nh∆∞ BigQuery.
  • L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: 1 = Cloud Function, 2 = Cloud SQL
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ph√π h·ª£p: Cloud Function c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω s·ª± ki·ªán.
    • ƒêi·ªÉm ch∆∞a ph√π h·ª£p: Cloud SQL kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† kh√¥ng m·∫°nh m·∫Ω nh∆∞ BigQuery.

5. Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√°c thu·∫≠t ng·ªØ Machine Learning quan tr·ªçng trong c√¢u h·ªèi v√† c√°c l·ª±a ch·ªçn:

  • Dataflow: D·ªãch v·ª• x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu theo lu·ªìng v√† theo l√¥, c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông cao.
  • BigQuery: D·ªãch v·ª• kho d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√¢n t√≠ch l·ªõn, h·ªó tr·ª£ SQL ANSI-2011.
  • Pub/Sub: D·ªãch v·ª• nh·∫Øn tin theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, d√πng ƒë·ªÉ truy·ªÅn t·∫£i d·ªØ li·ªáu gi·ªØa c√°c d·ªãch v·ª•.
  • Datastore: C∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu NoSQL, kh√¥ng h·ªó tr·ª£ SQL ANSI-2011.
  • Cloud SQL: D·ªãch v·ª• c∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu quan h·ªá, h·ªó tr·ª£ SQL nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng m·∫°nh m·∫Ω nh∆∞ BigQuery cho ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
  • Cloud Function: D·ªãch v·ª• th·ª±c thi m√£ theo s·ª± ki·ªán, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
Question 23 of 294
Question 24 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a global shoe store. You manage the ML models for the company's website. You are asked to build a model that will recommend new products to the user based on their purchase behavior and similarity with other users. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ g·ª£i √Ω s·∫£n ph·∫©m m·ªõi cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng d·ª±a tr√™n h√†nh vi mua h√†ng v√† s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng v·ªõi ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng kh√°c. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm "g·ª£i √Ω s·∫£n ph·∫©m m·ªõi", "h√†nh vi mua h√†ng", v√† "s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng v·ªõi ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng kh√°c". ƒê√¢y l√† c√°c y·∫øu t·ªë th∆∞·ªùng li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn h·ªá th·ªëng g·ª£i √Ω (recommendation system).
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: M√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i (classification model) kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ n√≥ th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n lo·∫°i d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o c√°c nh√≥m c·ª• th·ªÉ, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i ƒë·ªÉ g·ª£i √Ω s·∫£n ph·∫©m.
  • B: M√¥ h√¨nh l·ªçc d·ª±a tr√™n ki·∫øn th·ª©c (knowledge-based filtering) kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ n√≥ th∆∞·ªùng d·ª±a v√†o th√¥ng tin tƒ©nh v√† kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng gi·ªØa ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng.
  • C: M√¥ h√¨nh l·ªçc c·ªông t√°c (collaborative-based filtering) ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng gi·ªØa ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng ƒë·ªÉ g·ª£i √Ω s·∫£n ph·∫©m.
  • D: M√¥ h√¨nh h·ªìi quy (regression model) kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ n√≥ th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c d√πng ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n gi√° tr·ªã s·ªë li√™n t·ª•c, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i ƒë·ªÉ g·ª£i √Ω s·∫£n ph·∫©m.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa b√†i to√°n g·ª£i √Ω s·∫£n ph·∫©m d·ª±a tr√™n s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng gi·ªØa ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng.

Question 24 of 294
Question 25 (Single answer)
You work for a social media company. You need to detect whether posted images contain cars. Each training example is a member of exactly one class. You have trained an object detection neural network and deployed the model version to AI Platform Prediction for evaluation. Before deployment, you created an evaluation job and attached it to the AI Platform Prediction model version. You notice that the precision is lower than your business requirements allow. Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh ng∆∞·ª°ng softmax c·ªßa l·ªõp cu·ªëi c√πng c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c (precision) khi ph√°t hi·ªán h√¨nh ·∫£nh c√≥ ch·ª©a √¥ t√¥. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • ƒê·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c (precision) l√† t·ª∑ l·ªá gi·ªØa s·ªë d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë√∫ng l√† d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh tr√™n t·ªïng s·ªë d·ª± ƒëo√°n l√† d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh.

    • C: TƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh gi·∫£ s·∫Ω gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.
    • D: Gi·∫£m s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng √¢m t√≠nh gi·∫£ kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.

Question 25 of 294
Question 26 (Single answer)

Question 26 of 294
Question 27 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a regulated insurance company. You are asked to develop an insurance approval model that accepts or rejects insurance applications from potential customers. What factors should you consider before building the model?

Question 27 of 294
Question 28 (Multiple answers)
You are training a Resnet model on AI Platform using TPUs to visually categorize types of defects in automobile engines. You capture the training profile using the Cloud TPU profiler plugin and observe that it is highly input-bound. You want to reduce the bottleneck and speed up your model training process. Which modifications should you make to the tf.data dataset? (Choose two.)
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn hai ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m n√∫t th·∫Øt v√† tƒÉng t·ªëc qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh Resnet tr√™n AI Platform s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPUs. C·ª• th·ªÉ, b·∫°n c·∫ßn th·ª±c hi·ªán c√°c thay ƒë·ªïi tr√™n t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu tf.data ƒë·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t.

    • B: Gi·∫£m gi√° tr·ªã c·ªßa tham s·ªë repeat c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác gi·∫£m n√∫t th·∫Øt ƒë·∫ßu v√†o.
    • C: TƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc b·ªô ƒë·ªám cho t√πy ch·ªçn shuttle c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u nh·∫•t cho v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ input-bound.
    • D: Thi·∫øt l·∫≠p t√πy ch·ªçn prefetch b·∫±ng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch hu·∫•n luy·ªán c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p t·∫£i tr∆∞·ªõc d·ªØ li·ªáu, gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian ch·ªù ƒë·ª£i gi·ªØa c√°c batch.
    • E: Gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m ch·∫≠m qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán thay v√¨ tƒÉng t·ªëc.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    • D: C√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ gi√∫p gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian ch·ªù ƒë·ª£i gi·ªØa c√°c batch.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: C√°c ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A v√† D.
Question 28 of 294
Question 29 (Single answer)
You have trained a model on a dataset that required computationally expensive preprocessing operations. You need to execute the same preprocessing at prediction time. You deployed the model on AI Platform for high-throughput online prediction. Which architecture should you use?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1.   3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

Question 29 of 294
Question 30 (Single answer)
Your team trained and tested a DNN regression model with good results. Six months after deployment, the model is performing poorly due to a change in the distribution of the input data. How should you address the input differences in production?

Question 30 of 294
Question 31 (Single answer)
You need to train a computer vision model that predicts the type of government ID present in a given image using a GPU- powered virtual machine on Compute Engine. You use the following parameters: ‚úë Optimizer: SGD ‚úë Image shape = 224÷≥‚Äî224 ‚úë Batch size = 64 ‚úë Epochs = 10 ‚úë Verbose =2 During training you encounter the following error: ResourceExhaustedError: Out Of Memory (OOM) when allocating tensor. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i quy·∫øt c√¢u h·ªèi:
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch gi·∫£i quy·∫øt l·ªói ResourceExhaustedError: Out Of Memory (OOM) khi hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh th·ªã gi√°c m√°y t√≠nh tr√™n m√°y ·∫£o s·ª≠ d·ª•ng GPU. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points:
    • L·ªói g·∫∑p ph·∫£i l√† Out Of Memory (OOM), ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y th∆∞·ªùng x·∫£y ra khi b·ªô nh·ªõ GPU kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu.
    • C√°c tham s·ªë hi·ªán t·∫°i: Optimizer: SGD, Image shape = 224√ó224, Batch size = 64, Epochs = 10, Verbose = 2.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A. Change the optimizer: Thay ƒë·ªïi optimizer c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªôi t·ª• c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ OOM.
    • B. Reduce the batch size: Gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch s·∫Ω gi·∫£m l∆∞·ª£ng d·ªØ li·ªáu c·∫ßn x·ª≠ l√Ω c√πng l√∫c, do ƒë√≥ gi·∫£m y√™u c·∫ßu b·ªô nh·ªõ, l√† c√°ch ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt l·ªói OOM.
    • C. Change the learning rate: Thay ƒë·ªïi learning rate kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn l∆∞·ª£ng b·ªô nh·ªõ c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
    • D. Reduce the image shape: Gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc ·∫£nh c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m y√™u c·∫ßu b·ªô nh·ªõ, nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
    • B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√† l√† c√°ch gi·∫£i quy·∫øt ph·ªï bi·∫øn cho l·ªói OOM.
    • C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
    • D: C√≥ th·ªÉ ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B. Reduce the batch size.
Question 31 of 294
Question 32 (Single answer)
You developed an ML model with AI Platform, and you want to move it to production. You serve a few thousand queries per second and are experiencing latency issues. Incoming requests are served by a load balancer that distributes them across multiple Kubeflow CPU-only pods running on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). Your goal is to improve the serving latency without changing the underlying infrastructure. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

    • H·ªá th·ªëng hi·ªán t·∫°i s·ª≠ d·ª•ng load balancer v√† nhi·ªÅu pod Kubeflow ch·ªâ c√≥ CPU tr√™n GKE.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • B: Chuy·ªÉn sang phi√™n b·∫£n tensorflow-model-server-universal kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o c·∫£i thi·ªán ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ v√¨ kh√¥ng c√≥ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a c·ª• th·ªÉ cho CPU.
    • C: TƒÉng max_enqueued_batches c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ do tƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng batch ch·ªù x·ª≠ l√Ω.
    • D: Bi√™n d·ªãch l·∫°i TensorFlow Serving v·ªõi t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a cho CPU c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√† kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi c∆° s·ªü h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng th·∫•p do c√≥ th·ªÉ g√¢y ra v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ kh√°c.

    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng cao do t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a CPU c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√† kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi c∆° s·ªü h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 32 of 294
Question 33 (Single answer)
You have a demand forecasting pipeline in production that uses Dataflow to preprocess raw data prior to model training and prediction. During preprocessing, you employ Z-score normalization on data stored in BigQuery and write it back to BigQuery. New training data is added every week. You want to make the process more efficient by minimizing computation time and manual intervention. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch l√†m cho qu√° tr√¨nh d·ª± b√°o nhu c·∫ßu hi·ªáu qu·∫£ h∆°n b·∫±ng c√°ch gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian t√≠nh to√°n v√† can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng. C√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - Qu√° tr√¨nh d·ª± b√°o nhu c·∫ßu ƒëang s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng chu·∫©n h√≥a Z-score tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery. - D·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán m·ªõi ƒë∆∞·ª£c th√™m v√†o h√†ng tu·∫ßn. - M·ª•c ti√™u l√† gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian t√≠nh to√°n v√† can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Google Kubernetes Engine ƒë·ªÉ chu·∫©n h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng gi·∫£m ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ªùi gian t√≠nh to√°n v√† can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng v√¨ c·∫ßn thi·∫øt l·∫≠p v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω c·ª•m Kubernetes. - B: D·ªãch thu·∫≠t thu·∫≠t to√°n chu·∫©n h√≥a sang SQL ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng v·ªõi BigQuery c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian t√≠nh to√°n v√¨ BigQuery c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω truy v·∫•n SQL nhanh ch√≥ng v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng normalizer_fn trong TensorFlow's Feature Column API kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian t√≠nh to√°n trong BigQuery. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Apache Spark v·ªõi Dataproc c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Th·∫•p - B: Cao - C: Th·∫•p - D: Trung b√¨nh
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B, v√¨ d·ªãch thu·∫≠t thu·∫≠t to√°n chu·∫©n h√≥a sang SQL cho ph√©p t·∫≠n d·ª•ng kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω m·∫°nh m·∫Ω c·ªßa BigQuery, gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian t√≠nh to√°n v√† can thi·ªáp th·ªß c√¥ng.
Question 33 of 294
Question 34 (Single answer)
You need to design a customized deep neural network in Keras that will predict customer purchases based on their purchase history. You want to explore model performance using multiple model architectures, store training data, and be able to compare the evaluation metrics in the same dashboard. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt k·∫ø m·ªôt m·∫°ng n∆°-ron s√¢u t√πy ch·ªânh trong Keras ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n vi·ªác mua h√†ng c·ªßa kh√°ch h√†ng d·ª±a tr√™n l·ªãch s·ª≠ mua h√†ng c·ªßa h·ªç. B·∫°n c·∫ßn kh√°m ph√° hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng nhi·ªÅu ki·∫øn tr√∫c m√¥ h√¨nh, l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ so s√°nh c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë√°nh gi√° tr√™n c√πng m·ªôt b·∫£ng ƒëi·ªÅu khi·ªÉn. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

Question 34 of 294
Question 35 (Single answer)
You are developing a Kubeflow pipeline on Google Kubernetes Engine. The first step in the pipeline is to issue a query against BigQuery. You plan to use the results of that query as the input to the next step in your pipeline. You want to achieve this in the easiest way possible. What should you do?

Question 35 of 294
Question 36 (Single answer)
You are building a model to predict daily temperatures. You split the data randomly and then transformed the training and test datasets. Temperature data for model training is uploaded hourly. During testing, your model performed with accuracy; however, after deploying to production, the model's accuracy dropped to. How can you make your production model more accurate?

Question 36 of 294
Question 37 (Single answer)
You are developing models to classify customer support emails. You created models with TensorFlow Estimators using small datasets on your on-premises system, but you now need to train the models using large datasets to ensure high performance. You will port your models to Google Cloud and want to minimize code refactoring and infrastructure overhead for easier migration from on-prem to cloud. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh t·ª´ h·ªá th·ªëng t·∫°i ch·ªó l√™n Google Cloud nh·∫±m hu·∫•n luy·ªán v·ªõi t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu vi·ªác vi·∫øt l·∫°i m√£ v√† chi ph√≠ h·∫° t·∫ßng. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow Estimators, hu·∫•n luy·ªán v·ªõi t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu vi·ªác vi·∫øt l·∫°i m√£ (code refactoring), v√† gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ h·∫° t·∫ßng (infrastructure overhead).
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform cho hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n l√† ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ AI Platform h·ªó tr·ª£ TensorFlow Estimators v√† gi√∫p gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu vi·ªác vi·∫øt l·∫°i m√£ khi chuy·ªÉn t·ª´ on-prem l√™n cloud.
  • B: T·∫°o cluster tr√™n Dataproc kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho TensorFlow Estimators v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu c√¥ng vi·ªác c·∫•u h√¨nh h∆°n.
  • C: T·∫°o Managed Instance Group v·ªõi autoscaling kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ML v·ªõi TensorFlow.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Kubeflow Pipelines tr√™n GKE c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu vi·ªác vi·∫øt l·∫°i m√£.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho TensorFlow Estimators.

  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu vi·ªác vi·∫øt l·∫°i m√£.

Question 37 of 294
Question 38 (Single answer)
You have trained a text classification model in TensorFlow using AI Platform. You want to use the trained model for batch predictions on text data stored in BigQuery while minimizing computational overhead. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. Ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A: "Export the model to BigQuery ML".
  2. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu vƒÉn b·∫£n l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠ t√≠nh to√°n. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: "text classification model", "batch predictions", "text data stored in BigQuery", v√† "minimizing computational overhead".
  4. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c l·ª±a ch·ªçn v·ªõi ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • A: Export the model to BigQuery ML: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ BigQuery ML cho ph√©p th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c ti·∫øp tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu trong BigQuery m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn di chuy·ªÉn d·ªØ li·ªáu, gi√∫p gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ t√≠nh to√°n.
    • B: Deploy and version the model on AI Platform: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ vi·ªác tri·ªÉn khai v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω phi√™n b·∫£n tr√™n AI Platform c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu BigQuery.
    • C: Use Dataflow with the SavedModel to read the data from BigQuery: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Dataflow c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† t·ªën k√©m h∆°n so v·ªõi vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c ti·∫øp.
    • D: Submit a batch prediction job on AI Platform that points to the model location in Cloud Storage: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ vi·ªác n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu di chuy·ªÉn d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† tƒÉng chi ph√≠ t√≠nh to√°n.
  5. Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√°c thu·∫≠t ng·ªØ Machine Learning quan tr·ªçng trong c√¢u h·ªèi v√† c√°c l·ª±a ch·ªçn:
    • Text classification model: M√¥ h√¨nh h·ªçc m√°y ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n lo·∫°i vƒÉn b·∫£n v√†o c√°c danh m·ª•c kh√°c nhau.
    • Batch predictions: Th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr√™n m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn trong m·ªôt l·∫ßn x·ª≠ l√Ω.
    • BigQuery ML: D·ªãch v·ª• c·ªßa Google Cloud cho ph√©p x√¢y d·ª±ng v√† tri·ªÉn khai c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªçc m√°y tr·ª±c ti·∫øp tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu trong BigQuery.
    • AI Platform: N·ªÅn t·∫£ng c·ªßa Google Cloud cho ph√©p x√¢y d·ª±ng, tri·ªÉn khai v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªçc m√°y.
    • Dataflow: D·ªãch v·ª• x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu theo lu·ªìng v√† theo l√¥ c·ªßa Google Cloud.
Question 38 of 294
Question 39 (Single answer)
You work with a data engineering team that has developed a pipeline to clean your dataset and save it in a Cloud Storage bucket. You have created an ML model and want to use the data to refresh your model as soon as new data is available. As part of your CI/CD workflow, you want to automatically run a Kubeflow Pipelines training job on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE). How should you architect this workflow?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt k·∫ø m·ªôt workflow ƒë·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông ch·∫°y m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán Kubeflow Pipelines tr√™n Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) khi c√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi trong Cloud Storage. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - D·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong Cloud Storage. - C·∫ßn t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a vi·ªác kh·ªüi ch·∫°y c√¥ng vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán khi c√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Kubeflow Pipelines v√† GKE. - T√≠ch h·ª£p v√†o quy tr√¨nh CI/CD.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† sau ƒë√≥ kh·ªüi ch·∫°y c√¥ng vi·ªác tr√™n GKE. Kh√¥ng c√≥ c∆° ch·∫ø t·ª± ƒë·ªông ph√°t hi·ªán d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng App Engine ƒë·ªÉ li√™n t·ª•c ki·ªÉm tra Cloud Storage. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Storage trigger v√† Pub/Sub ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi v√† kh·ªüi ch·∫°y c√¥ng vi·ªác tr√™n GKE. ƒê√¢y l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ª± ƒë·ªông v√† ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Scheduler ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra ƒë·ªãnh k·ª≥. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng ph·∫£n ·ª©ng ngay l·∫≠p t·ª©c khi c√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, thi·∫øu c∆° ch·∫ø t·ª± ƒë·ªông ph√°t hi·ªán d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi. - B: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a. - C: ƒê√∫ng, c√≥ c∆° ch·∫ø t·ª± ƒë·ªông v√† ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu. - D: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, kh√¥ng ph·∫£n ·ª©ng ngay l·∫≠p t·ª©c khi c√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi.

Question 39 of 294
Question 40 (Multiple answers)
You have a functioning end-to-end ML pipeline that involves tuning the hyperparameters of your ML model using AI Platform, and then using the best-tuned parameters for training. Hypertuning is taking longer than expected and is delaying the downstream processes. You want to speed up the tuning job without significantly compromising its effectiveness. Which actions should you take? (Choose two.)
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn hai h√†nh ƒë·ªông ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc qu√° tr√¨nh tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë (hypertuning) m√† kh√¥ng l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu qu·∫£ ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: qu√° tr√¨nh hypertuning ƒëang m·∫•t nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian h∆°n d·ª± ki·∫øn v√† c·∫ßn tƒÉng t·ªëc m√† kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng l·ªõn ƒë·∫øn hi·ªáu qu·∫£.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Gi·∫£m s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám song song c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m ch·∫≠m qu√° tr√¨nh h∆°n n·ªØa, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
  • B: Gi·∫£m ph·∫°m vi gi√° tr·ªã d·∫•u ph·∫©y ƒë·ªông c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m gi·∫£m t√≠nh hi·ªáu qu·∫£ c·ªßa vi·ªác t√¨m ki·∫øm si√™u tham s·ªë t·ªëi ∆∞u.
  • C: Thi·∫øt l·∫≠p tham s·ªë d·ª´ng s·ªõm (early stopping) gi√∫p k·∫øt th√∫c c√°c th·ª≠ nghi·ªám kh√¥ng hi·ªáu qu·∫£ s·ªõm h∆°n, ti·∫øt ki·ªám th·ªùi gian.
  • D: Thay ƒë·ªïi thu·∫≠t to√°n t√¨m ki·∫øm t·ª´ Bayesian sang t√¨m ki·∫øm ng·∫´u nhi√™n c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu qu·∫£ c·ªßa vi·ªác t√¨m ki·∫øm.
  • E: Gi·∫£m s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám t·ªëi ƒëa trong c√°c giai ƒëo·∫°n hu·∫•n luy·ªán ti·∫øp theo gi√∫p gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian t·ªïng th·ªÉ c·ªßa qu√° tr√¨nh.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: C v√† E l√† c√°c l·ª±a ch·ªçn c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ ch√∫ng gi√∫p tƒÉng t·ªëc qu√° tr√¨nh m√† kh√¥ng l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu qu·∫£ ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ.

Question 40 of 294
Question 41 (Single answer)
Your team is building an application for a global bank that will be used by millions of customers. You built a forecasting model that predicts customers' account balances 3 days in the future. Your team will use the results in a new feature that will notify users when their account balance is likely to drop below $25. How should you serve your predictions?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn c√°ch ph·ª•c v·ª• d·ª± ƒëo√°n t·ª´ m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± b√°o s·ªë d∆∞ t√†i kho·∫£n c·ªßa kh√°ch h√†ng trong 3 ng√†y t·ªõi. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.

  • Th√¥ng b√°o cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng khi s·ªë d∆∞ t√†i kho·∫£n c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng gi·∫£m xu·ªëng d∆∞·ªõi $25.

  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Pub/Sub v√† App Engine. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ A, nh∆∞ng App Engine c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt cho vi·ªác ch·ªâ g·ª≠i th√¥ng b√°o.

  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Firebase v√† g·ª≠i th√¥ng b√°o khi d·ª± b√°o c·ªßa t·ª´ng ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng d∆∞·ªõi $25. Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu th√¥ng b√°o c√° nh√¢n h√≥a.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do App Engine c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.

Question 41 of 294
Question 42 (Single answer)
You work for an advertising company and want to understand the effectiveness of your company's latest advertising campaign. You have streamed 500 MB of campaign data into BigQuery. You want to query the table, and then manipulate the results of that query with a pandas dataframe in an AI Platform notebook. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

B·∫°n ƒë√£ truy·ªÅn 500 MB d·ªØ li·ªáu chi·∫øn d·ªãch v√†o BigQuery v√† mu·ªën truy v·∫•n b·∫£ng, sau ƒë√≥ x·ª≠ l√Ω k·∫øt qu·∫£ truy v·∫•n ƒë√≥ v·ªõi m·ªôt dataframe pandas trong notebook AI Platform.
    • S·ªë l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng: 1
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • Truy v·∫•n d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ BigQuery.

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery cell magic c·ªßa AI Platform Notebooks ƒë·ªÉ truy v·∫•n d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† n·∫°p k·∫øt qu·∫£ d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng pandas dataframe. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£ nh·∫•t.
    • B: Xu·∫•t b·∫£ng d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng t·ªáp CSV t·ª´ BigQuery sang Google Drive v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Google Drive API ƒë·ªÉ n·∫°p t·ªáp v√†o notebook. C√°ch n√†y ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
    • C: T·∫£i b·∫£ng t·ª´ BigQuery d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng t·ªáp CSV c·ª•c b·ªô v√† t·∫£i l√™n notebook AI Platform. S·ª≠ d·ª•ng pandas.read_csv ƒë·ªÉ n·∫°p t·ªáp d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng pandas dataframe. C√°ch n√†y kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ y√™u c·∫ßu t·∫£i xu·ªëng v√† t·∫£i l√™n th·ªß c√¥ng.
    • D: T·ª´ m·ªôt √¥ bash trong notebook AI Platform, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng l·ªánh bq extract ƒë·ªÉ xu·∫•t b·∫£ng d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng t·ªáp CSV v√†o Cloud Storage, sau ƒë√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng gsutil cp ƒë·ªÉ sao ch√©p d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o notebook. S·ª≠ d·ª•ng pandas.read_csv ƒë·ªÉ n·∫°p t·ªáp d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng pandas dataframe. C√°ch n√†y ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Cao
    • B: Th·∫•p

    • ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√†: A
Question 42 of 294
Question 43 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a global car manufacture. You need to build an ML model to predict car sales in different cities around the world. Which features or feature crosses should you use to train city-specific relationships between car type and number of sales?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn ra c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ho·∫∑c k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng (feature crosses) ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ML d·ª± ƒëo√°n m·ªëi quan h·ªá c·ª• th·ªÉ theo t·ª´ng th√†nh ph·ªë gi·ªØa lo·∫°i xe v√† s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng b√°n ra. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i nh·∫•n m·∫°nh v√†o vi·ªác x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªëi quan h·ªá c·ª• th·ªÉ theo t·ª´ng th√†nh ph·ªë gi·ªØa lo·∫°i xe v√† s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng b√°n ra. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y g·ª£i √Ω r·∫±ng c·∫ßn c√≥ s·ª± k·∫øt h·ª£p gi·ªØa v·ªã tr√≠ ƒë·ªãa l√Ω (latitude, longitude) v√† lo·∫°i xe (car type).
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ri√™ng l·∫ª: binned latitude, binned longitude, v√† one-hot encoded car type. C√°ch n√†y kh√¥ng t·∫°o ra m·ªëi quan h·ªá c·ª• th·ªÉ gi·ªØa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng.
  • B: M·ªôt ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng l√† t√≠ch t·ª´ng ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ gi·ªØa latitude, longitude, v√† car type. C√°ch n√†y kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng binned latitude v√† binned longitude, c√≥ th·ªÉ g√¢y ra v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ v·ªÅ ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.
  • C: M·ªôt ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng l√† t√≠ch t·ª´ng ph·∫ßn t·ª≠ gi·ªØa binned latitude, binned longitude, v√† one-hot encoded car type. C√°ch n√†y t·∫°o ra m·ªëi quan h·ªá c·ª• th·ªÉ gi·ªØa v·ªã tr√≠ ƒë·ªãa l√Ω v√† lo·∫°i xe, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
  • D: Hai k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng: m·ªôt gi·ªØa binned latitude v√† one-hot encoded car type, v√† m·ªôt gi·ªØa binned longitude v√† one-hot encoded car type. C√°ch n√†y c≈©ng t·∫°o ra m·ªëi quan h·ªá c·ª• th·ªÉ, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u b·∫±ng c√°ch k·∫øt h·ª£p c·∫£ binned latitude v√† binned longitude c√πng l√∫c.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ t·∫°o ra m·ªëi quan h·ªá c·ª• th·ªÉ gi·ªØa v·ªã tr√≠ ƒë·ªãa l√Ω v√† lo·∫°i xe, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 43 of 294
Question 44 (Single answer)
You work for a large technology company that wants to modernize their contact center. You have been asked to develop a solution to classify incoming calls by product so that requests can be more quickly routed to the correct support team. You have already transcribed the calls using the Speech-to-Text API. You want to minimize data preprocessing and development time. How should you build the model?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n lo·∫°i c√°c cu·ªôc g·ªçi ƒë·∫øn theo s·∫£n ph·∫©m nh·∫±m t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a vi·ªác chuy·ªÉn ti·∫øp y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·∫øn ƒë√∫ng ƒë·ªôi h·ªó tr·ª£. 3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform Training v·ªõi c√°c thu·∫≠t to√°n c√≥ s·∫µn c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML Natural Language ƒë·ªÉ tr√≠ch xu·∫•t c√°c th·ª±c th·ªÉ t√πy ch·ªânh cho ph√¢n lo·∫°i c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a nhi·ªÅu b∆∞·ªõc v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu th·ªùi gian ph√°t tri·ªÉn. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Natural Language API c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß m·∫°nh ƒë·ªÉ tr√≠ch xu·∫•t c√°c th·ª±c th·ªÉ t√πy ch·ªânh cho ph√¢n lo·∫°i ph·ª©c t·∫°p. - D: X√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh t√πy ch·ªânh t·ª´ ƒë·∫ßu c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu.

Question 44 of 294
Question 45 (Single answer)
You are training a TensorFlow model on a structured dataset with 100 billion records stored in several CSV files. You need to improve the input/output execution performance. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t th·ª±c thi ƒë·∫ßu v√†o/ƒë·∫ßu ra khi hu·∫•n luy·ªán m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow tr√™n m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ c·∫•u tr√∫c v·ªõi 100 t·ª∑ b·∫£n ghi ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong nhi·ªÅu t·ªáp CSV. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: T·∫£i d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o BigQuery v√† ƒë·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ BigQuery. BigQuery l√† m·ªôt d·ªãch v·ª• kho d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√¢n t√≠ch m·∫°nh m·∫Ω, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn trong qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow.
    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: T·∫£i d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o Cloud Bigtable v√† ƒë·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ Bigtable.     • L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi c√°c t·ªáp CSV th√†nh c√°c m·∫£nh TFRecords v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu trong Cloud Storage. TFRecords l√† ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·ªã ph√¢n ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a cho TensorFlow, gi√∫p c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t I/O.
    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi c√°c t·ªáp CSV th√†nh c√°c m·∫£nh TFRecords v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu trong HDFS. M·∫∑c d√π HDFS c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, nh∆∞ng Cloud Storage th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ∆∞u ti√™n h∆°n trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng GCP.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: L·ª±a ch·ªçn C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ TFRecords l√† ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho TensorFlow v√† Cloud Storage l√† d·ªãch v·ª• l∆∞u tr·ªØ ph√π h·ª£p trong GCP.

Question 45 of 294
Question 46 (Single answer)

Question 46 of 294
Question 47 (Single answer)
You recently joined an enterprise-scale company that has thousands of datasets. You know that there are accurate descriptions for each table in BigQuery, and you are searching for the proper BigQuery table to use for a model you are building on AI Platform. C√°ch n√†y kh√¥ng gi√∫p t√¨m ki·∫øm d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† ch·ªâ qu·∫£n l√Ω th√¥ng tin ƒë√£ c√≥. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Duy tr√¨ m·ªôt b·∫£ng tra c·ª©u trong BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ √°nh x·∫° m√¥ t·∫£ b·∫£ng v·ªõi ID b·∫£ng. C√°ch n√†y kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√¥ t·∫£ b·∫£ng v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v·ªõi s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng b·∫£ng l·ªõn.

Question 47 of 294
Question 48 (Single answer)
You started working on a classification problem with time series data and achieved an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC ROC) value of for training data after just a few experiments. You haven't explored using any sophisticated algorithms or spent any time on hyperparameter tuning. What should your next step be to identify and fix the problem?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh b∆∞·ªõc ti·∫øp theo ƒë·ªÉ nh·∫≠n di·ªán v√† s·ª≠a l·ªói trong m·ªôt b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói th·ªùi gian. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • V·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ph√¢n lo·∫°i v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói th·ªùi gian.
    • ƒê√£ ƒë·∫°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c gi√° tr·ªã AUC ROC cho d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán sau v√†i th·ª≠ nghi·ªám.
    • Ch∆∞a s·ª≠ d·ª•ng thu·∫≠t to√°n ph·ª©c t·∫°p hay tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p c·ªßa thu·∫≠t to√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt khi ch∆∞a x√°c ƒë·ªãnh r√µ v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng cross-validation l·ªìng nhau c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p ph√°t hi·ªán v√† x·ª≠ l√Ω v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ r√≤ r·ªâ d·ªØ li·ªáu, ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt b∆∞·ªõc h·ª£p l√Ω khi ch∆∞a tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë.
    • C: Lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c√≥ t∆∞∆°ng quan cao v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã m·ª•c ti√™u c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m r√≤ r·ªâ d·ªØ li·ªáu, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√∫c n√†o c≈©ng l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u.
    • D: Tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m gi√° tr·ªã AUC ROC kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† m·ªôt m·ª•c ti√™u h·ª£p l√Ω, v√¨ AUC ROC c√†ng cao c√†ng t·ªët.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Th·∫•p
    • B: Cao
    • C: Trung b√¨nh
    • D: Th·∫•p
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 48 of 294
Question 49 (Single answer)
You work for an online travel agency that also sells advertising placements on its website to other companies. You have been asked to predict the most relevant web banner that a user should see next. Security is important to your company. The model latency requirements are 300ms@p99, the inventory is thousands of web banners, and your exploratory analysis has shown that
navigation context is a good predictor. You want to Implement the simplest solution. How should you configure the prediction pipeline?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n c·∫•u h√¨nh m·ªôt pipeline d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉn th·ªã banner web ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i nh·∫•n m·∫°nh y√™u c·∫ßu v·ªÅ b·∫£o m·∫≠t, ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh l√† 300ms@p99, v√† c√≥ h√†ng ng√†n banner web. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c≈©ng ch·ªâ ra r·∫±ng ng·ªØ c·∫£nh ƒëi·ªÅu h∆∞·ªõng l√† m·ªôt y·∫øu t·ªë d·ª± ƒëo√°n t·ªët. 2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - ƒê·ªô tr·ªÖ m√¥ h√¨nh: 300ms@p99 - S·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng banner: h√†ng ng√†n - Ng·ªØ c·∫£nh ƒëi·ªÅu h∆∞·ªõng l√† y·∫øu t·ªë d·ª± ƒëo√°n t·ªët - Y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n

Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Ch·ªâ tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh tr√™n AI Platform Prediction, kh√¥ng c√≥ c∆° ch·∫ø x·ª≠ l√Ω ng·ªØ c·∫£nh ƒëi·ªÅu h∆∞·ªõng. - B: Th√™m gateway tr√™n App Engine nh∆∞ng v·∫´n thi·∫øu c∆° ch·∫ø x·ª≠ l√Ω ng·ªØ c·∫£nh ƒëi·ªÅu h∆∞·ªõng. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Bigtable ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·ªçc v√† ghi ng·ªØ c·∫£nh ƒëi·ªÅu h∆∞·ªõng, tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh tr√™n AI Platform Prediction. ƒê√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu v·ªÅ ng·ªØ c·∫£nh ƒëi·ªÅu h∆∞·ªõng v√† ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Memorystore v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh tr√™n Google Kubernetes Engine, c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.

Question 49 of 294
Question 50 (Single answer)
Your team is building a convolutional neural network (CNN)-based architecture from scratch. The preliminary experiments running on your on-premises CPU-only infrastructure were encouraging, but have slow convergence. You have been asked to speed up model training to reduce time-to-market. You want to experiment with virtual machines (VMs) on Google Cloud to leverage more powerful hardware. Your code does not include any manual device placement and has not been wrapped in Estimator model-level abstraction. Which environment should you train your model on?

X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh CNN nh·∫±m tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô hu·∫•n luy·ªán, v·ªõi ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán m√£ ngu·ªìn hi·ªán t·∫°i kh√¥ng c√≥ ƒë·∫∑t thi·∫øt b·ªã th·ªß c√¥ng v√† ch∆∞a ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë√≥ng g√≥i trong Estimator. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh CNN c·∫ßn tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô hu·∫•n luy·ªán. - M√£ ngu·ªìn kh√¥ng c√≥ ƒë·∫∑t thi·∫øt b·ªã th·ªß c√¥ng. - M√£ ngu·ªìn ch∆∞a ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë√≥ng g√≥i trong Estimator. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng h·∫° t·∫ßng Google Cloud.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU y√™u c·∫ßu m√£ ngu·ªìn c·∫ßn c√≥ s·ª± ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh ƒë·ªÉ t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªëi ƒëa kh·∫£ nƒÉng c·ªßa TPU, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi m√£ ngu·ªìn hi·ªán t·∫°i. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng 8 GPUs c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô hu·∫•n luy·ªán nh∆∞ng y√™u c·∫ßu c√†i ƒë·∫∑t th·ªß c√¥ng ph·ª©c t·∫°p. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Deep Learning VM v·ªõi GPU v√† c√°c th∆∞ vi·ªán ƒë√£ c√†i ƒë·∫∑t s·∫µn, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh m√£ ngu·ªìn nhi·ªÅu. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng CPU m·∫°nh h∆°n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u b·∫±ng GPU cho m√¥ h√¨nh CNN.

Question 50 of 294
Question 51 (Single answer)
You work on a growing team of more than 50 data scientists who all use AI Platform. You are designing a strategy to organize your jobs, models, and versions in a clean and scalable way. Which strategy should you choose?

Question 51 of 294
Question 52 (Single answer)
You are training a deep learning model for semantic image segmentation with reduced training time. While using a Deep Learning VM Image, you receive the following error: The resource 'projects/deeplearning-platforn/zones/europe-west4- c/acceleratorTypes/nvidia-tesla-k80' was not found.
