Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°p √°n: - ƒê√°p √°n A: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác ki·ªÉm tra h·∫°n ng·∫°ch GPU, nh∆∞ng l·ªói kh√¥ng li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn h·∫°n ng·∫°ch m√† l√† s·ª± t·ªìn t·∫°i c·ªßa t√†i nguy√™n. - ƒê√°p √°n B: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o GPU c·∫ßn thi·∫øt c√≥ s·∫µn trong v√πng ƒë√£ ch·ªçn, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi l·ªói kh√¥ng t√¨m th·∫•y t√†i nguy√™n. - ƒê√°p √°n C: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn h·∫°n ng·∫°ch GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ b·ªã thu h·ªìi, kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn l·ªói. - ƒê√°p √°n D: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn b·ªô nh·ªõ GPU, kh√¥ng li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn l·ªói kh√¥ng t√¨m th·∫•y t√†i nguy√™n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - ƒê√°p √°n A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - ƒê√°p √°n B: Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t v·ªõi l·ªói ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√¥ t·∫£. - ƒê√°p √°n C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - ƒê√°p √°n D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.

Question 52 of 294
Question 53 (Single answer)
Your team is working on an NLP research project to predict political affiliation of authors based on articles they have written. You have a large training dataset that is structured like this:
You followed the standard-- data distribution across the training, testing, and evaluation subsets. How should you distribute the training examples across the train-test-eval subsets while maintaining the 80-10-10 proportion?

1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ph√¢n ph·ªëi d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán theo t·ª∑ l·ªá 80-10-10 cho c√°c t·∫≠p train-test-eval trong m·ªôt d·ª± √°n nghi√™n c·ª©u NLP nh·∫±m d·ª± ƒëo√°n khuynh h∆∞·ªõng ch√≠nh tr·ªã c·ªßa t√°c gi·∫£ d·ª±a tr√™n c√°c b√†i vi·∫øt c·ªßa h·ªç. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph√¢n ph·ªëi d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√π h·ª£p.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: D·ª± √°n li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn NLP v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n khuynh h∆∞·ªõng ch√≠nh tr·ªã c·ªßa t√°c gi·∫£, do ƒë√≥ c·∫ßn ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa m·ªôt t√°c gi·∫£ kh√¥ng b·ªã ph√¢n t√°n gi·ªØa c√°c t·∫≠p train, test v√† eval ƒë·ªÉ tr√°nh r√≤ r·ªâ th√¥ng tin. 3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • C: Ph√¢n ph·ªëi ng·∫´u nhi√™n c√°c c√¢u c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t ng·ªØ c·∫£nh v√† g√¢y r√≤ r·ªâ th√¥ng tin gi·ªØa c√°c t·∫≠p.
  • D: Ph√¢n ph·ªëi c√°c ƒëo·∫°n vƒÉn c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác c√°c ƒëo·∫°n vƒÉn c·ªßa c√πng m·ªôt t√°c gi·∫£ xu·∫•t hi·ªán ·ªü nhi·ªÅu t·∫≠p, g√¢y r√≤ r·ªâ th√¥ng tin.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n B c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa m·ªôt t√°c gi·∫£ kh√¥ng b·ªã ph√¢n t√°n gi·ªØa c√°c t·∫≠p, tr√°nh r√≤ r·ªâ th√¥ng tin.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 53 of 294
Question 54 (Single answer)
Your team has been tasked with creating an ML solution in Google Cloud to classify support requests for one of your platforms. You analyzed the requirements and decided to use TensorFlow to build the classifier so that you have full control of the model's code, serving, and deployment. You will use Kubeflow pipelines for the ML platform. To save time, you want to build on existing resources and use managed services instead of building a completely new model. How should you build the classifier?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p ML tr√™n Google Cloud ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n lo·∫°i c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu h·ªó tr·ª£. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow ƒë·ªÉ c√≥ to√†n quy·ªÅn ki·ªÉm so√°t m√£ ngu·ªìn, tri·ªÉn khai v√† ph·ª•c v·ª• m√¥ h√¨nh. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Kubeflow pipelines cho n·ªÅn t·∫£ng ML. - T·∫≠n d·ª•ng c√°c t√†i nguy√™n c√≥ s·∫µn v√† d·ªãch v·ª• qu·∫£n l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ ti·∫øt ki·ªám th·ªùi gian thay v√¨ x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi ho√†n to√†n.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Natural Language API kh√¥ng cho ph√©p ki·ªÉm so√°t m√£ ngu·ªìn v√† tri·ªÉn khai nh∆∞ y√™u c·∫ßu. - B: AutoML Natural Language l√† m·ªôt d·ªãch v·ª• qu·∫£n l√Ω, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng cho ph√©p ki·ªÉm so√°t m√£ ngu·ªìn v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i vƒÉn b·∫£n c√≥ s·∫µn tr√™n AI Platform ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán transfer learning cho ph√©p t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t√†i nguy√™n c√≥ s·∫µn v√† v·∫´n c√≥ th·ªÉ ki·ªÉm so√°t m√£ ngu·ªìn. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ s·∫µn m√† kh√¥ng th·ª±c hi·ªán transfer learning kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c kh·∫£ nƒÉng t√πy ch·ªânh m√¥ h√¨nh theo y√™u c·∫ßu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - C: Ph√π h·ª£p. - D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i vƒÉn b·∫£n c√≥ s·∫µn tr√™n AI Platform ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán transfer learning.
Question 54 of 294
Question 55 (Single answer)
You recently joined a machine learning team that will soon release a new project. As a lead on the project, you are asked to determine the production readiness of the ML components. The team has already tested features and data, model development, and infrastructure. Which additional readiness check should you recommend to the team?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • B: Tinh ch·ªânh t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c si√™u tham s·ªë l√† m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa ph√°t tri·ªÉn m√¥ h√¨nh, ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c ki·ªÉm tra.

    • D: Ghi l·∫°i k·ª≥ v·ªçng v·ªÅ t√≠nh nƒÉng trong schema l√† m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa ki·ªÉm tra t√≠nh nƒÉng v√† d·ªØ li·ªáu, ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c hi·ªán.

Question 55 of 294
Question 56 (Single answer)
You work for a credit card company and have been asked to create a custom fraud detection model based on historical data using AutoML Tables. You need to prioritize detection of fraudulent transactions while minimizing false positives. Which optimization objective should you use when training the model?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ª•c ti√™u t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a khi hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n, ∆∞u ti√™n ph√°t hi·ªán giao d·ªãch gian l·∫≠n v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh gi·∫£. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n, gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh gi·∫£, v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML Tables.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Log loss l√† th∆∞·ªõc ƒëo t·ªïng qu√°t cho ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n v√† d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh gi·∫£.
  • B: T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a Precision t·∫°i Recall 0.50 c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ ∆∞u ti√™n ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n.
  • C: AUC PR t·∫≠p trung v√†o c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa Precision v√† Recall, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh gi·∫£.
  • D: AUC ROC l√† th∆∞·ªõc ƒëo t·ªïng qu√°t cho ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng c·ª• th·ªÉ cho b√†i to√°n c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa Precision v√† Recall.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a AUC PR, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 56 of 294
Question 57 (Single answer)
Your company manages a video sharing website where users can watch and upload videos. You need to create an ML model to predict which newly uploaded videos will be the most popular so that those videos can be prioritized on your company's website. Which result should you use to determine whether the model is successful?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ti√™u ch√≠ n√†o n√™n ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± th√†nh c√¥ng c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ML trong vi·ªác d·ª± ƒëo√°n video m·ªõi t·∫£i l√™n s·∫Ω tr·ªü n√™n ph·ªï bi·∫øn nh·∫•t. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ch√≠nh x√°c nh·∫•t.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: Key points quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: "predict which newly uploaded videos will be the most popular" v√† "prioritized on your company's website". ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y cho th·∫•y m√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn d·ª± ƒëo√°n ch√≠nh x√°c video n√†o s·∫Ω ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ ∆∞u ti√™n hi·ªÉn th·ªã.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • B: Ti√™u ch√≠ d·ª±a tr√™n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£t nh·∫•p chu·ªôt c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph·∫£n √°nh ch√≠nh x√°c s·ª± ph·ªï bi·∫øn th·ª±c s·ª± c·ªßa video, v√¨ clickbait c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫°o ra nhi·ªÅu l∆∞·ª£t nh·∫•p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o th·ªùi gian xem l√¢u d√†i.
    • C: Ti√™u ch√≠ d·ª±a tr√™n th·ªùi gian xem trong 30 ng√†y l√† m·ªôt ch·ªâ s·ªë t·ªët ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph·ªï bi·∫øn th·ª±c s·ª± c·ªßa video, v√¨ n√≥ ph·∫£n √°nh s·ª± quan t√¢m v√† t∆∞∆°ng t√°c c·ªßa ng∆∞·ªùi xem.
    • D: H·ªá s·ªë t∆∞∆°ng quan Pearson b·∫±ng 0 cho th·∫•y kh√¥ng c√≥ m·ªëi quan h·ªá tuy·∫øn t√≠nh gi·ªØa s·ªë l∆∞·ª£t xem sau 7 v√† 30 ng√†y, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† m·ªôt ti√™u ch√≠ t·ªët ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± th√†nh c√¥ng c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng th·ªùi gian xem ƒë·ªÉ ƒëo l∆∞·ªùng s·ª± ph·ªï bi·∫øn, m·ªôt ch·ªâ s·ªë h·ª£p l√Ω v√† c√≥ √Ω nghƒ©a.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 57 of 294
Question 58 (Single answer)
You are working on a Neural Network-based project. The dataset provided to you has columns with different ranges. While preparing the data for model training, you discover that gradient optimization is having difficulty moving weights to a good solution. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m gi·∫£i ph√°p cho v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a gradient g·∫∑p kh√≥ khƒÉn trong vi·ªác ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh tr·ªçng s·ªë ƒë·∫øn m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªët. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng x√¢y d·ª±ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë·ªÉ k·∫øt h·ª£p c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng m·∫°nh nh·∫•t - Kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a gradient.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng k·ªπ thu·∫≠t bi·∫øn ƒë·ªïi bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn (chu·∫©n h√≥a) - Gi√∫p ƒë∆∞a c√°c c·ªôt d·ªØ li·ªáu v·ªÅ c√πng m·ªôt kho·∫£ng gi√° tr·ªã, h·ªó tr·ª£ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a gradient.
    • C: C·∫£i thi·ªán b∆∞·ªõc l√†m s·∫°ch d·ªØ li·ªáu b·∫±ng c√°ch lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu - Kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ gradient.
    • D: Thay ƒë·ªïi b∆∞·ªõc ph√¢n chia ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc t·∫≠p ki·ªÉm tra v√† tƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán - Kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a gradient.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    • B: Cao
    • C: Th·∫•p
    • D: Th·∫•p
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B, v√¨ chu·∫©n h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu gi√∫p ƒë∆∞a c√°c c·ªôt v·ªÅ c√πng m·ªôt kho·∫£ng gi√° tr·ªã, h·ªó tr·ª£ qu√° tr√¨nh t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a gradient.
Question 58 of 294
Question 59 (Single answer)
Your data science team needs to rapidly experiment with various features, model architectures, and hyperparameters. They need to track the accuracy metrics for various experiments and use an API to query the metrics over time. What should they use to track and report their experiments while minimizing manual effort?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë·ªÉ theo d√µi v√† b√°o c√°o c√°c th√≠ nghi·ªám c·ªßa nh√≥m khoa h·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu v·ªõi √≠t n·ªó l·ª±c th·ªß c√¥ng nh·∫•t. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: "rapidly experiment", "track the accuracy metrics", "use an API to query the metrics", v√† "minimizing manual effort".
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Kubeflow Pipelines l√† m·ªôt c√¥ng c·ª• m·∫°nh m·∫Ω cho vi·ªác qu·∫£n l√Ω v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a c√°c th√≠ nghi·ªám ML, cho ph√©p xu·∫•t file metrics v√† truy v·∫•n k·∫øt qu·∫£ qua API, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu "minimizing manual effort".
  • B: AI Platform Training v√† BigQuery c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ƒë∆∞·ª£c nh∆∞ng y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu b∆∞·ªõc th·ªß c√¥ng h∆°n ƒë·ªÉ xu·∫•t v√† truy v·∫•n metrics.
  • C: AI Platform Training v√† Cloud Monitoring kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác theo d√µi metrics c·ªßa c√°c th√≠ nghi·ªám ML.
  • D: AI Platform Notebooks v√† Google Sheets kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√¥ng c·ª• chuy√™n d·ª•ng cho vi·ªác theo d√µi v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a c√°c th√≠ nghi·ªám ML, y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu thao t√°c th·ªß c√¥ng.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao do ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu thao t√°c th·ªß c√¥ng h∆°n.

Question 59 of 294
Question 60 (Single answer)
You work for a bank and are building a random forest model for fraud detection. You have a dataset that includes transactions, of which are identified as fraudulent. Which data transformation strategy would likely improve the performance of your classifier?

  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

    • D: One-hot encoding l√† c·∫ßn thi·∫øt cho c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng d·ªØ li·ªáu.

Question 60 of 294
Question 61 (Single answer)

Question 61 of 294
Question 62 (Single answer)

Question 62 of 294
Question 63 (Single answer)

Question 63 of 294
Question 64 (Single answer)
You recently designed and built a custom neural network that uses critical dependencies specific to your organization‚Äôs framework. You need to train the model using a managed training service on Google Cloud. However, the ML framework and related dependencies are not supported by AI Platform Training.     • S·ªë l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng: 1
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

    • M√¥ h√¨nh v√† d·ªØ li·ªáu qu√° l·ªõn ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω tr√™n m·ªôt m√°y ƒë∆°n l·∫ª.
    • C·∫•u tr√∫c ph√¢n ph·ªëi g·ªìm scheduler, workers, v√† servers.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ s·∫µn kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ph·ª• thu·ªôc kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c h·ªó tr·ª£.
    • B: Kh√¥ng ho√†n to√†n ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ch·ªâ x√¢y d·ª±ng container t√πy ch·ªânh kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ph√¢n ph·ªëi.
    • C: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ x√¢y d·ª±ng c√°c container t√πy ch·ªânh ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y c√°c c√¥ng vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n ph·ªëi s·∫Ω gi·∫£i quy·∫øt c·∫£ v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√† ph√¢n ph·ªëi.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ vi·ªác c·∫•u h√¨nh l·∫°i code c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng kh·∫£ thi v√† kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ph√¢n ph·ªëi.

Question 64 of 294
Question 65 (Single answer)
While monitoring your model training‚Äôs GPU utilization, you discover that you have a native synchronous implementation. The training data is split into multiple files. You want to reduce the execution time of your input pipeline. What should you do?

Question 66 (Single answer)

Question 67 of 294
Question 68 (Single answer)

Question 68 of 294
Question 69 (Single answer)
You need to build an ML model for a social media application to predict whether a user‚Äôs submitted profile photo meets the requirements. The application will inform the user if the picture meets the requirements. How should you build a model to ensure that the application does not falsely accept a non-compliant picture?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ML cho ·ª©ng d·ª•ng m·∫°ng x√£ h·ªôi ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n xem ·∫£nh ƒë·∫°i di·ªán c·ªßa ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng c√≥ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu hay kh√¥ng. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o ·ª©ng d·ª•ng kh√¥ng ch·∫•p nh·∫≠n nh·∫ßm ·∫£nh kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

Key points quan tr·ªçng: "kh√¥ng ch·∫•p nh·∫≠n nh·∫ßm ·∫£nh kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu". ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ nghƒ©a l√† c·∫ßn t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu false positives (d∆∞∆°ng t√≠nh gi·∫£).

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi

  • A: T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a recall ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu false negatives. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ y√™u c·∫ßu l√† gi·∫£m false positives.
  • B: T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a F1 score ƒë·ªÉ c√¢n b·∫±ng ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa false positives v√† false negatives. Ph√π h·ª£p h∆°n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho false positives.
  • C: X√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh t√πy ch·ªânh v·ªõi nhi·ªÅu v√≠ d·ª• ·∫£nh ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu. Kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ false positives.
  • D: X√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh t√πy ch·ªânh v·ªõi nhi·ªÅu v√≠ d·ª• ·∫£nh kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu. C√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m false positives b·∫±ng c√°ch h·ªçc nhi·ªÅu h∆°n t·ª´ c√°c v√≠ d·ª• kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu.

B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

ƒê√°p √°n D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ t·∫≠p trung v√†o vi·ªác gi·∫£m false positives b·∫±ng c√°ch cung c·∫•p nhi·ªÅu v√≠ d·ª• kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu h∆°n.

B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi

ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.

Question 69 of 294
Question 70 (Single answer)
You lead a data science team at a large international corporation. Most of the models your team trains are large-scale models using high-level TensorFlow APIs on AI Platform with GPUs. Your team usually takes a few weeks or months to iterate on a new version of a model. You were recently asked to review your team‚Äôs spending. How should you reduce your Google Cloud compute costs without impacting the model‚Äôs performance?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ t√≠nh to√°n tr√™n Google Cloud m√† kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - ƒê·ªôi ng≈© khoa h·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒëang s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow API cao c·∫•p tr√™n AI Platform v·ªõi GPU. - Th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh k√©o d√†i v√†i tu·∫ßn ho·∫∑c th√°ng. - Y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ m√† kh√¥ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn hi·ªáu su·∫•t.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform v·ªõi c√°c job hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n v√† checkpoint c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p qu·∫£n l√Ω qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán t·ªët h∆°n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt gi·∫£m chi ph√≠.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Platform v·ªõi c√°c job hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ checkpoint c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn m·∫•t m√°t d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán n·∫øu c√≥ s·ª± c·ªë, kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t.
  • C: Di chuy·ªÉn sang Kuberflow tr√™n Google Kubernetes Engine v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng preemptible VMs v·ªõi checkpoint c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ nh·ªù v√†o gi√° r·∫ª c·ªßa preemptible VMs, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi checkpoint gi√∫p b·∫£o to√†n ti·∫øn tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
  • D: Di chuy·ªÉn sang Kuberflow v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng preemptible VMs m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ checkpoint c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ nh∆∞ng r·ªßi ro m·∫•t m√°t d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán cao.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o gi·∫£m chi ph√≠.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ v√† b·∫£o to√†n hi·ªáu su·∫•t.

5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 70 of 294
Question 71 (Single answer)
You need to train a regression model based on a dataset containing 50,000 records that is stored in BigQuery. The data includes a total of 20 categorical and numerical features with a target variable that can include negative values. You need to minimize effort and training time while maximizing model performance. What approach should you take to train this regression model?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªìi quy d·ª±a tr√™n t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ 50,000 b·∫£n ghi l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c v√† th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán trong khi t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√°c key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn (50,000 b·∫£n ghi), l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery, bao g·ªìm c·∫£ gi√° tr·ªã √¢m trong bi·∫øn m·ª•c ti√™u, v√† y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c v√† th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: T·∫°o m√¥ h√¨nh DNN t√πy ch·ªânh v·ªõi TensorFlow c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu c√¥ng s·ª©c v√† th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a v√† tri·ªÉn khai, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BQML XGBoost regression l√† m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªët v√¨ BQML t√≠ch h·ª£p s·∫µn trong BigQuery, d·ªÖ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c v√† th·ªùi gian.
  • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML Tables kh√¥ng c√≥ d·ª´ng s·ªõm c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán d√†i h∆°n, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a th·ªùi gian.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML Tables v·ªõi RMSLE c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p n·∫øu bi·∫øn m·ª•c ti√™u c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã √¢m, v√¨ RMSLE kh√¥ng x·ª≠ l√Ω t·ªët gi√° tr·ªã √¢m.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n B c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng t·ªët nh·∫•t c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.

Question 71 of 294
Question 72 (Single answer)
You are building a linear model with over 100 input features, all with values between ‚Äì1 and 1. You suspect that many features are non-informative. You want to remove the non-informative features from your model while keeping the informative ones in their original form. Which technique should you use?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m m·ªôt k·ªπ thu·∫≠t ƒë·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng mang th√¥ng tin trong m√¥ h√¨nh tuy·∫øn t√≠nh v·ªõi h∆°n 100 ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë·∫ßu v√†o, trong khi v·∫´n gi·ªØ nguy√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng mang th√¥ng tin. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ch√≠nh x√°c.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- M√¥ h√¨nh tuy·∫øn t√≠nh v·ªõi h∆°n 100 ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë·∫ßu v√†o.
- C√°c gi√° tr·ªã ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng n·∫±m trong kho·∫£ng t·ª´ -1 ƒë·∫øn 1.
- Nghi ng·ªù nhi·ªÅu ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng mang th√¥ng tin.
- Mu·ªën lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng mang th√¥ng tin nh∆∞ng gi·ªØ nguy√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng mang th√¥ng tin.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: PCA l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi·∫£m chi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·ªØ nguy√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng g·ªëc.
- B: L1 regularization c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m h·ªá s·ªë c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng mang th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ 0, gi·ªØ nguy√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng mang th√¥ng tin.
- C: Shapley values d√πng ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng sau khi x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i ƒë·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng.
- D: Iterative dropout l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p th·ª≠ nghi·ªám lo·∫°i b·ªè t·ª´ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·ªØ nguy√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng mang th√¥ng tin.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng gi·ªØ nguy√™n ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng g·ªëc.
- B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ L1 regularization c√≥ th·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng mang th√¥ng tin.
- C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ch·ªâ ƒë√°nh gi√° sau khi x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh.
- D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·ªØ nguy√™n ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng mang th√¥ng tin.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng L1 regularization ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m h·ªá s·ªë c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng mang th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ 0.
Question 72 of 294
Question 73 (Single answer)
You work for a global footwear retailer and need to predict when an item will be out of stock based on historical inventory data Customer behavior is highly dynamic since footwear demand is influenced by many different factors. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch h·ª£p l√Ω v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£ nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán vi·ªác x√°c th·ª±c m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n khi n√†o m·ªôt m·∫∑t h√†ng s·∫Ω h·∫øt h√†ng d·ª±a tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠, v·ªõi m·ª•c ti√™u theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr√™n c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ tr∆∞·ªõc khi ƒë∆∞a v√†o s·∫£n xu·∫•t. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • D·ª± ƒëo√°n khi n√†o m·∫∑t h√†ng s·∫Ω h·∫øt h√†ng d·ª±a tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠.

    • Theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr√™n c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ tr∆∞·ªõc khi ƒë∆∞a v√†o s·∫£n xu·∫•t.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng c·ª• TFX ModelValidator ƒë·ªÉ ch·ªâ ƒë·ªãnh c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë hi·ªáu su·∫•t cho s·ª± s·∫µn s√†ng s·∫£n xu·∫•t. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n h·ª£p l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√°p ·ª©ng c√°c ti√™u chu·∫©n tr∆∞·ªõc khi tri·ªÉn khai.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng k-fold cross-validation ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o m√¥ h√¨nh s·∫µn s√†ng cho s·∫£n xu·∫•t. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr√™n c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng tu·∫ßn cu·ªëi c√πng c√≥ li√™n quan c·ªßa d·ªØ li·ªáu l√†m t·∫≠p x√°c th·ª±c. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph·∫£n √°nh ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr√™n c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng to√†n b·ªô t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† coi AUC ROC l√† ch·ªâ s·ªë ch√≠nh. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    • B: Trung b√¨nh - Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªët nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫Øm v√†o c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
    • C: Th·∫•p - Kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr√™n c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
    • D: Th·∫•p - Kh√¥ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o c√°c t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ª• th·ªÉ.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: L·ª±a ch·ªçn A l√† c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng nh·∫•t.
Question 73 of 294
Question 74 (Single answer)
You have deployed a model on Vertex AI for real-time inference. During an online prediction request, you get an ‚ÄúOut of Memory‚Äù error. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m gi·∫£i ph√°p khi g·∫∑p l·ªói "Out of Memory" trong qu√° tr√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c tr√™n Vertex AI. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points: Key points ·ªü ƒë√¢y l√† "Out of Memory" v√† "real-time inference". L·ªói "Out of Memory" th∆∞·ªùng x·∫£y ra khi t√†i nguy√™n b·ªô nh·ªõ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω y√™u c·∫ßu hi·ªán t·∫°i.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô d·ª± ƒëo√°n theo l√¥ thay v√¨ ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m t·∫£i b·ªô nh·ªõ nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
    • B: G·ª≠i l·∫°i y√™u c·∫ßu v·ªõi m·ªôt l√¥ nh·ªè h∆°n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m t·∫£i b·ªô nh·ªõ v√† v·∫´n gi·ªØ ƒë∆∞·ª£c t√≠nh th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng base64 ƒë·ªÉ m√£ h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ b·ªô nh·ªõ.
    • D: TƒÉng h·∫°n m·ª©c cho s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng y√™u c·∫ßu d·ª± ƒëo√°n kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ b·ªô nh·ªõ.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n B c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ "Out of Memory" b·∫±ng c√°ch gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc l√¥ d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B: "Send the request again with a smaller batch of instances."
Question 74 of 294
Question 75 (Single answer)
You work at a subscription-based company. You have trained an ensemble of trees and neural networks to predict customer churn, which is the likelihood that customers will not renew their yearly subscription. The average prediction is a churn rate, but for a particular customer the model predicts that they are likely to churn. The customer has a product usage history of, is located in New York City, and became a customer in 1997. You need to explain the difference between the actual prediction, a churn rate, and the average prediction. You want to use Vertex Explainable AI. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£i th√≠ch s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát gi·ªØa d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ª±c t·∫ø (t·ª∑ l·ªá churn) v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n trung b√¨nh cho m·ªôt kh√°ch h√†ng c·ª• th·ªÉ. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex Explainable AI ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i nh·∫•n m·∫°nh v√†o vi·ªác gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n churn cho m·ªôt kh√°ch h√†ng c·ª• th·ªÉ v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex Explainable AI. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y g·ª£i √Ω r·∫±ng c·∫ßn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√≥ th·ªÉ √°p d·ª•ng cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n ri√™ng l·∫ª.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Train local surrogate models c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√° nh√¢n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† m·ªôt ph·∫ßn c·ªßa Vertex Explainable AI.
  • B: Sampled Shapley explanations l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p trong Vertex Explainable AI ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√° nh√¢n.
  • C: Integrated gradients c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi·∫£i th√≠ch nh∆∞ng th∆∞·ªùng √°p d·ª•ng cho m√¥ h√¨nh neural networks v√† kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ensemble models.
  • D: ƒêo l∆∞·ªùng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng c·ªßa t·ª´ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi·∫£i th√≠ch trong Vertex Explainable AI.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: L·ª±a ch·ªçn B c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Sampled Shapley explanations, m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn trong Vertex Explainable AI ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√° nh√¢n.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 75 of 294
Question 76 (Single answer)
You are working on a classification problem with time series data. After conducting just a few experiments using random cross- validation, you achieved an Area Under the Receiver Operating Characteristic Curve (AUC ROC) value of on the training data. You haven‚Äôt explored using any sophisticated algorithms or spent any time on hyperparameter tuning. What should your next step be to identify and fix the problem?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh b∆∞·ªõc ti·∫øp theo ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh v√† kh·∫Øc ph·ª•c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ trong m·ªôt b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói th·ªùi gian, sau khi ƒë·∫°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c gi√° tr·ªã AUC ROC tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√† ch∆∞a s·ª≠ d·ª•ng thu·∫≠t to√°n ph·ª©c t·∫°p hay tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • B√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói th·ªùi gian.
    • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng random cross-validation v√† ƒë·∫°t AUC ROC tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
    • Ch∆∞a s·ª≠ d·ª•ng thu·∫≠t to√°n ph·ª©c t·∫°p hay tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng k-fold cross-validation, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói th·ªùi gian v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng r√≤ r·ªâ d·ªØ li·ªáu.
    • B: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng nested cross-validation ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ r√≤ r·ªâ d·ªØ li·ªáu, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói th·ªùi gian.
    • C: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c√≥ t∆∞∆°ng quan cao v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã m·ª•c ti√™u, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ r√≤ r·ªâ d·ªØ li·ªáu trong b·ªëi c·∫£nh chu·ªói th·ªùi gian.
    • D: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác tinh ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m gi√° tr·ªã AUC ROC, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ m·ª•c ti√™u l√† tƒÉng AUC ROC v√† kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ r√≤ r·ªâ d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 76 of 294
Question 77 (Single answer)
You need to execute a batch prediction on 100 million records in a BigQuery table with a custom TensorFlow DNN regressor model, and then store the predicted results in a BigQuery table. You want to minimize the effort required to build this inference pipeline. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t tr√™n 100 tri·ªáu b·∫£n ghi trong b·∫£ng BigQuery b·∫±ng m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow DNN regressor t√πy ch·ªânh, v√† l∆∞u k·∫øt qu·∫£ d·ª± ƒëo√°n v√†o b·∫£ng BigQuery. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu c√¥ng s·ª©c c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng pipeline suy lu·∫≠n n√†y. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:

    • Th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t tr√™n 100 tri·ªáu b·∫£n ghi.

    • C: T·∫°o pipeline Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu sang TFRecords, ch·∫°y suy lu·∫≠n h√†ng lo·∫°t tr√™n Vertex AI Prediction v√† ghi k·∫øt qu·∫£ v√†o BigQuery. C√°ch n√†y ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu c√¥ng ƒëo·∫°n.
    • D: T·∫£i m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow SavedModel trong pipeline Dataflow, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery I/O connector v·ªõi h√†m t√πy ch·ªânh ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán suy lu·∫≠n trong pipeline v√† ghi k·∫øt qu·∫£ v√†o BigQuery. C√°ch n√†y c≈©ng ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu c√¥ng ƒëo·∫°n.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

Question 77 of 294
Question 78 (Single answer)
You are creating a deep neural network classification model using a dataset with categorical input values. Certain columns have a cardinality greater than 10,000 unique values. How should you encode these categorical values as input into the model?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch m√£ h√≥a c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ƒë·∫ßu v√†o d·∫°ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i (categorical) cho m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i m·∫°ng n∆°-ron s√¢u, v·ªõi m·ªôt s·ªë c·ªôt c√≥ ƒë·ªô phong ph√∫ (cardinality) l·ªõn h∆°n 10,000 gi√° tr·ªã duy nh·∫•t. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p m√£ h√≥a ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t t·ª´ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√† 'deep neural network classification model', 'categorical input values', v√† 'cardinality greater than 10,000 unique values'.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi m·ªói gi√° tr·ªã ph√¢n lo·∫°i th√†nh m·ªôt gi√° tr·ªã s·ªë nguy√™n c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng gi·ªØ ƒë∆∞·ª£c th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ m·ªëi quan h·ªá gi·ªØa c√°c gi√° tr·ªã ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ g√¢y ra v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ v·ªÅ th·ª© t·ª± gi·∫£.
    • B: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu chu·ªói ph√¢n lo·∫°i th√†nh c√°c one-hot hash buckets l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√¢n lo·∫°i c√≥ ƒë·ªô phong ph√∫ cao, gi√∫p gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc kh√¥ng gian v√† tr√°nh v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ v·ªÅ th·ª© t·ª± gi·∫£.
    • C: √Ånh x·∫° c√°c bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i th√†nh m·ªôt vector c√°c gi√° tr·ªã boolean c√≥ th·ªÉ t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ one-hot encoding, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v·ªõi ƒë·ªô phong ph√∫ cao.
    • D: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi m·ªói gi√° tr·ªã ph√¢n lo·∫°i th√†nh m·ªôt chu·ªói m√£ h√≥a ƒë·ªô d√†i ch·∫°y kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn cho d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√¢n lo·∫°i trong h·ªçc m√°y.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
    • B: Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t.
    • C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 78 of 294
Question 79 (Single answer)
You need to train a natural language model to perform text classification on product descriptions that contain millions of examples and 100,000 unique words. You want to preprocess the words individually so that they can be fed into a recurrent neural network. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω t·ª´ ng·ªØ ƒë·ªÉ ƒë∆∞a v√†o m√¥ h√¨nh m·∫°ng n∆°-ron h·ªìi quy (RNN) cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i vƒÉn b·∫£n. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: "train a natural language model", "text classification", "millions of examples", "100,000 unique words", "preprocess the words individually", v√† "recurrent neural network". Nh·ªØng ƒëi·ªÉm n√†y g·ª£i √Ω r·∫±ng b·∫°n c·∫ßn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p x·ª≠ l√Ω t·ª´ ng·ªØ hi·ªáu qu·∫£ cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi RNN.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng word embeddings t·ª´ m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán tr∆∞·ªõc l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£ cho x·ª≠ l√Ω ng√¥n ng·ªØ t·ª± nhi√™n, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát khi c√≥ nhi·ªÅu t·ª´ v√† d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.

Question 79 of 294
Question 80 (Single answer)

Question 81 of 294
Question 82 (Single answer)

Question 83 (Single answer)

Question 83 of 294
Question 84 (Single answer)
Your company manages an application that aggregates news articles from many different online sources and sends them to users. You need to build a recommendation model that will suggest articles to readers that are similar to the articles they are currently reading. Which approach should you use?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh g·ª£i √Ω b√†i b√°o cho ng∆∞·ªùi ƒë·ªçc d·ª±a tr√™n c√°c b√†i b√°o m√† h·ªç ƒëang ƒë·ªçc. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng nh·∫•t.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i nh·∫•n m·∫°nh v√†o vi·ªác g·ª£i √Ω c√°c b√†i b√°o t∆∞∆°ng t·ª± v·ªõi b√†i b√°o hi·ªán t·∫°i m√† ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng ƒëang ƒë·ªçc. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y g·ª£i √Ω r·∫±ng c·∫ßn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ƒëo l∆∞·ªùng s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng gi·ªØa c√°c b√†i b√°o.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: H·ªá th·ªëng l·ªçc c·ªông t√°c d·ª±a tr√™n h√†nh vi qu√° kh·ª© c·ªßa ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng, kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng n·ªôi dung b√†i b√°o hi·ªán t·∫°i.
- B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng word2vec ƒë·ªÉ m√£ h√≥a b√†i b√°o th√†nh vector v√† x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª±a tr√™n s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng vector l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n h·ª£p l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m ki·∫øm s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng gi·ªØa c√°c b√†i b√°o.
- C: M√¥ h√¨nh h·ªìi quy logistic cho t·ª´ng ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n b√†i b√°o c√≥ n√™n ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ª£i √Ω kh√¥ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng n·ªôi dung.
- D: Ph√¢n lo·∫°i b√†i b√°o th√†nh c√°c danh m·ª•c d·ª±a tr√™n SVM kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ g·ª£i √Ω b√†i b√°o t∆∞∆°ng t·ª±.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n B c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng vector ƒë·ªÉ ƒëo l∆∞·ªùng s·ª± t∆∞∆°ng ƒë·ªìng gi·ªØa c√°c b√†i b√°o, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.

Question 84 of 294
Question 85 (Single answer)
You work for a large social network service provider whose users post articles and discuss news. Millions of comments are posted online each day, and more than 200 human moderators constantly review comments and flag those that are inappropriate. Your team is building an ML model to help human moderators check content on the platform. The model scores each comment and flags suspicious comments to be reviewed by a human.     • D: ƒê√°nh gi√° ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c v√† ƒë·ªô nh·∫°y d·ª±a tr√™n m·∫´u tin nh·∫Øn b·ªã m√¥ h√¨nh g·∫Øn c·ªù, ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ gi√°m s√°t hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh trong vi·ªác ph√°t hi·ªán n·ªôi dung kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.

Question 85 of 294
Question 86 (Single answer)
You are a lead ML engineer at a retail company. You want to track and manage ML metadata in a centralized way so that your team can have reproducible experiments by generating artifacts. Which management solution should you recommend to your team?

Question 86 of 294
Question 87 (Single answer)

Question 87 of 294
Question 88 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a bank. You have developed a binary classification model using AutoML Tables to predict whether a customer will make loan payments on time. The output is used to approve or reject loan requests. One customer‚Äôs loan request has been rejected by your model, and the bank‚Äôs risks department is asking you to provide the reasons that contributed to the model‚Äôs decision. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n cung c·∫•p l√Ω do m√† m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ t·ª´ ch·ªëi y√™u c·∫ßu vay c·ªßa m·ªôt kh√°ch h√†ng. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt b√†i to√°n v·ªÅ gi·∫£i th√≠ch quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh (model interpretability). ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng t∆∞∆°ng quan v·ªõi gi√° tr·ªã m·ª•c ti√™u trong trang t√≥m t·∫Øt d·ªØ li·ªáu. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin c·ª• th·ªÉ cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ph·∫ßn trƒÉm t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng trong trang ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y cung c·∫•p c√°i nh√¨n t·ªïng quan nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch cho t·ª´ng quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ª• th·ªÉ.
    • D: Thay ƒë·ªïi c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë·ªôc l·∫≠p ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ng∆∞·ª°ng cho t·ª´ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng thay ƒë·ªïi ph√¢n lo·∫°i. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i th√≠ch quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Cao - Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i th√≠ch quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh cho t·ª´ng tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p c·ª• th·ªÉ.
    • B: Th·∫•p - Kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin c·ª• th·ªÉ cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
    • C: Trung b√¨nh - Cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin t·ªïng quan nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng c·ª• th·ªÉ cho t·ª´ng tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p.
    • D: Th·∫•p - Ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i th√≠ch quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c·ª•c b·ªô t·ª´ c√°c d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
Question 88 of 294
Question 89 (Single answer)
You work for a magazine distributor and need to build a model that predicts which customers will renew their subscriptions for the upcoming year. Using your company‚Äôs historical data as your training set, you created a TensorFlow model and deployed it to AI Platform. You need to determine which customer attribute has the most predictive power for each prediction served by the model. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh thu·ªôc t√≠nh kh√°ch h√†ng n√†o c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph·ª•c v·ª• b·ªüi m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n AI Platform. - C·∫ßn x√°c ƒë·ªãnh thu·ªôc t√≠nh kh√°ch h√†ng c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠ c·ªßa c√¥ng ty l√†m t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Lasso regression c√≥ th·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng m·∫°nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ƒë∆∞·ª£c thu·ªôc t√≠nh c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n. - B: T√≠nh h·ªá s·ªë t∆∞∆°ng quan Pearson kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp cho bi·∫øt thu·ªôc t√≠nh n√†o c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t. - C: AI Explanations v·ªõi ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p Shapley cung c·∫•p s·ª± ƒë√≥ng g√≥p c·ªßa t·ª´ng thu·ªôc t√≠nh cho m·ªói d·ª± ƒëo√°n, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu. - D: What-If tool cho ph√©p th·ª≠ nghi·ªám lo·∫°i b·ªè t·ª´ng thu·ªôc t√≠nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp x√°c ƒë·ªãnh thu·ªôc t√≠nh c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Th·∫•p - B: Th·∫•p - C: Cao - D: Trung b√¨nh
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C. S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AI Explanations tr√™n AI Platform v·ªõi ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p Shapley ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh thu·ªôc t√≠nh c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t.
Question 89 of 294
Question 90 (Single answer)
You are working on a binary classification ML algorithm that detects whether an image of a classified scanned document contains a company‚Äôs logo. In the dataset, of examples don‚Äôt have the logo, so the dataset is very skewed. Which metrics would give you the most confidence in your model?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn ra metric ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n, trong ƒë√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách (skewed) v·ªõi nhi·ªÅu v√≠ d·ª• kh√¥ng c√≥ logo. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- B√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n (binary classification).
- D·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách (skewed), nhi·ªÅu v√≠ d·ª• kh√¥ng c√≥ logo.
- C·∫ßn metric ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh t·ªët nh·∫•t trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p n√†y.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: F-score v·ªõi recall ƒë∆∞·ª£c ∆∞u ti√™n h∆°n precision. Trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách, recall quan tr·ªçng ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o kh√¥ng b·ªè s√≥t c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p c√≥ logo.
- B: RMS (Root Mean Square) kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n.
- C: F1 score l√† trung b√¨nh ƒëi·ªÅu h√≤a c·ªßa precision v√† recall, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ∆∞u ti√™n recall.
- D: F-score v·ªõi precision ƒë∆∞·ª£c ∆∞u ti√™n h∆°n recall, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p khi c·∫ßn ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o ph√°t hi·ªán ƒë·ªß c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p c√≥ logo.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Cao, v√¨ ∆∞u ti√™n recall trong d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách.
- B: Th·∫•p, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n.
- C: Trung b√¨nh, kh√¥ng ∆∞u ti√™n recall.
- D: Th·∫•p, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p khi c·∫ßn ∆∞u ti√™n recall.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A: F-score where recall is weighed more than precision.
Question 90 of 294
Question 91 (Single answer)
You work on the data science team for a multinational beverage company. You need to develop an ML model to predict the company‚Äôs profitability for a new line of naturally flavored bottled waters in different locations. You are provided with historical data that includes product types, product sales volumes, expenses, and profits for all regions. What should you use as the input and output for your model?
C Other
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ƒë·∫ßu v√†o (input) v√† ƒë·∫ßu ra (output) ph√π h·ª£p cho m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ML d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n c·ªßa c√¥ng ty ƒë·ªëi v·ªõi m·ªôt d√≤ng s·∫£n ph·∫©m m·ªõi. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M·ª•c ti√™u l√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n (profitability). - D·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠ bao g·ªìm lo·∫°i s·∫£n ph·∫©m, kh·ªëi l∆∞·ª£ng b√°n h√†ng, chi ph√≠ v√† l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n. - ƒê·∫ßu v√†o c√≥ th·ªÉ bao g·ªìm lo·∫°i s·∫£n ph·∫©m v√† v·ªã tr√≠ ƒë·ªãa l√Ω (latitude, longitude).
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng vƒ© ƒë·ªô, kinh ƒë·ªô v√† lo·∫°i s·∫£n ph·∫©m l√†m ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng; l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n l√†m ƒë·∫ßu ra. Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi m·ª•c ti√™u d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng vƒ© ƒë·ªô, kinh ƒë·ªô v√† lo·∫°i s·∫£n ph·∫©m l√†m ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng; doanh thu v√† chi ph√≠ l√†m ƒë·∫ßu ra. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ƒë·∫ßu ra kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng lo·∫°i s·∫£n ph·∫©m v√† k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c·ªßa vƒ© ƒë·ªô v·ªõi kinh ƒë·ªô, sau ƒë√≥ ph√¢n lo·∫°i, l√†m ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng; l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n l√†m ƒë·∫ßu ra. Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi m·ª•c ti√™u d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng lo·∫°i s·∫£n ph·∫©m v√† k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c·ªßa vƒ© ƒë·ªô v·ªõi kinh ƒë·ªô, sau ƒë√≥ ph√¢n lo·∫°i, l√†m ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng; doanh thu v√† chi ph√≠ l√†m ƒë·∫ßu ra. 4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: C√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng. - B: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng v√¨ ƒë·∫ßu ra kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n. - C: ƒê√∫ng v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng k·∫øt h·ª£p ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v√† ƒë·∫ßu ra l√† l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n. - D: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng v√¨ ƒë·∫ßu ra kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª£i nhu·∫≠n.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 91 of 294
Question 92 (Single answer)
You work as an ML engineer at a social media company, and you are developing a visual filter for users‚Äô profile photos. This requires you to train an ML model to detect bounding boxes around human faces. You want to use this filter in your company‚Äôs iOS-based mobile phone application. You want to minimize code development and want the model to be optimized for inference on mobile phones. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ph√°t tri·ªÉn m·ªôt b·ªô l·ªçc h√¨nh ·∫£nh ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán khu√¥n m·∫∑t ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng tr√™n ·ª©ng d·ª•ng di ƒë·ªông iOS, v·ªõi m·ª•c ti√™u t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a cho vi·ªác suy lu·∫≠n tr√™n ƒëi·ªán tho·∫°i di ƒë·ªông v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ph√°t tri·ªÉn m√£ ngu·ªìn. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t t·ª´ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn c√≥ s·∫µn.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: (1) ph√°t tri·ªÉn b·ªô l·ªçc h√¨nh ·∫£nh cho ·ª©ng d·ª•ng iOS, (2) t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a cho suy lu·∫≠n tr√™n ƒëi·ªán tho·∫°i di ƒë·ªông, (3) gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ph√°t tri·ªÉn m√£ ngu·ªìn.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML Vision v·ªõi t√πy ch·ªçn "export for Core ML" l√† ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ Core ML l√† framework c·ªßa Apple d√†nh cho iOS, gi√∫p t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a m√¥ h√¨nh cho thi·∫øt b·ªã di ƒë·ªông iOS.
  • B: "export for Coral" kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ Coral l√† d√†nh cho thi·∫øt b·ªã Edge TPU, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i cho iOS.
  • C: "export for TensorFlow.js" kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ TensorFlow.js ch·ªß y·∫øu d√πng cho ·ª©ng d·ª•ng web, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho iOS.
  • D: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow sang TensorFlow Lite c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√π h·ª£p cho Android h∆°n l√† iOS.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Cao, v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
  • B: Th·∫•p, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi n·ªÅn t·∫£ng iOS.
  • C: Th·∫•p, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ·ª©ng d·ª•ng di ƒë·ªông iOS.
  • D: Trung b√¨nh, c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u nh∆∞ Core ML cho iOS.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 92 of 294
Question 93 (Single answer)
You have been asked to build a model using a dataset that is stored in a medium-sized (~10 GB) BigQuery table. You need to quickly determine whether this data is suitable for model development. You want to create a one-time report that includes both informative visualizations of data distributions and more sophisticated statistical analyses to share with other ML engineers on your team. You require maximum flexibility to create your report. What should you do?
A B Other
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt b√°o c√°o m·ªôt l·∫ßn ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh t√≠nh ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa d·ªØ li·ªáu cho ph√°t tri·ªÉn m√¥ h√¨nh. B√°o c√°o c·∫ßn bao g·ªìm c·∫£ tr·ª±c quan h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi y√™u c·∫ßu s·ª± linh ho·∫°t t·ªëi ƒëa trong vi·ªác t·∫°o b√°o c√°o. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ BigQuery (~10 GB), b√°o c√°o m·ªôt l·∫ßn, tr·ª±c quan h√≥a v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™, chia s·∫ª v·ªõi nh√≥m k·ªπ s∆∞ ML, v√† y√™u c·∫ßu s·ª± linh ho·∫°t t·ªëi ƒëa.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Vertex AI Workbench user-managed notebooks cung c·∫•p m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng linh ho·∫°t cho vi·ªác ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu, tr·ª±c quan h√≥a v√† t·∫°o b√°o c√°o ph·ª©c t·∫°p, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
  • B: Google Data Studio ch·ªß y·∫øu d√πng ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o b√°o c√°o tr·ª±c quan h√≥a nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ h·∫°n ch·∫ø trong ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† t√≠nh linh ho·∫°t.
  • C: TensorFlow Data Validation tr√™n Dataflow ch·ªß y·∫øu d√πng ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra d·ªØ li·ªáu, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o b√°o c√°o tr·ª±c quan v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
  • D: Dataprep ch·ªß y·∫øu d√πng ƒë·ªÉ chu·∫©n b·ªã v√† l√†m s·∫°ch d·ªØ li·ªáu, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho vi·ªác t·∫°o b√°o c√°o ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Cao - ƒë√°p ·ª©ng t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
  • B: Th·∫•p - h·∫°n ch·∫ø trong ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
  • C: Th·∫•p - kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho t·∫°o b√°o c√°o.
  • D: Th·∫•p - kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho t·∫°o b√°o c√°o ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 93 of 294
Question 94 (Single answer)
You work on an operations team at an international company that manages a large fleet of on-premises servers located in few data centers around the world. Your team collects monitoring data from the servers, including CPU/memory consumption. When an incident occurs on a server, your team is responsible for fixing it. Incident data has not been properly labeled yet. Your management team wants you to build a predictive maintenance solution that uses monitoring data from the VMs to detect potential failures and then alerts the service desk team. What should you do first?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p b·∫£o tr√¨ d·ª± ƒëo√°n s·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªØ li·ªáu gi√°m s√°t t·ª´ c√°c m√°y ch·ªß ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán c√°c l·ªói ti·ªÅm ·∫©n v√† sau ƒë√≥ c·∫£nh b√°o cho nh√≥m d·ªãch v·ª•. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng nh·∫•t.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: d·ªØ li·ªáu gi√°m s√°t t·ª´ m√°y ch·ªß, ph√°t hi·ªán l·ªói ti·ªÅm ·∫©n, v√† c·∫£nh b√°o cho nh√≥m d·ªãch v·ª•. D·ªØ li·ªáu s·ª± c·ªë ch∆∞a ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n nh√£n ƒë√∫ng c√°ch.

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi

  • A: ƒê·ªÅ xu·∫•t hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh chu·ªói th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n gi√° tr·ªã hi·ªáu su·∫•t v√† c·∫•u h√¨nh c·∫£nh b√°o. Tuy nhi√™n, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ d·ªØ li·ªáu ch∆∞a ƒë∆∞·ª£c g√°n nh√£n.
  • B: ƒê·ªÅ xu·∫•t s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n ƒë·ªÉ g√°n nh√£n d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠ v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n b·∫•t th∆∞·ªùng. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n h·ª£p l√Ω nh∆∞ng c·∫ßn ki·ªÉm tra th√™m.
  • C: ƒê·ªÅ xu·∫•t ph√°t tri·ªÉn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n ƒë·ªÉ g√°n nh√£n d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠ v√† th·ª≠ nghi·ªám trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng s·∫£n xu·∫•t. ƒê√¢y l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n h·ª£p l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra t√≠nh kh·∫£ thi c·ªßa ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p tr∆∞·ªõc khi tri·ªÉn khai r·ªông r√£i.
  • D: ƒê·ªÅ xu·∫•t thu√™ m·ªôt ƒë·ªôi ng≈© ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë·ªÉ g√°n nh√£n d·ªØ li·ªáu th·ªß c√¥ng. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªën k√©m v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ·ªü giai ƒëo·∫°n ƒë·∫ßu.

Question 94 of 294
Question 95 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model that uses sliced frames from video feed and creates bounding boxes around specific objects. Question 95 of 294
Question 96 (Single answer)
You are training an object detection machine learning model on a dataset that consists of three million X-ray images, each roughly 2 GB in size. You are using Vertex AI Training to run a custom training application on a Compute Engine instance with 32-cores, 128 GB of RAM, and 1 NVIDIA P100 GPU. You notice that model training is taking a very long time. You want to decrease training time without sacrificing model performance. What should you do?
B D C 2
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh m√† kh√¥ng l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. C√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng c·∫ßn ch·ªçn.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - D·ªØ li·ªáu: 3 tri·ªáu ·∫£nh X-ray, m·ªói ·∫£nh kho·∫£ng 2 GB. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Training v·ªõi c·∫•u h√¨nh: 32-cores, 128 GB RAM, 1 NVIDIA P100 GPU. - V·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ: Th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán qu√° l√¢u.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: TƒÉng b·ªô nh·ªõ v√† k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho GPU. - B: Thay th·∫ø GPU b·∫±ng TPU c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán t·ªëc ƒë·ªô hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ. - C: D·ª´ng s·ªõm c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian nh∆∞ng c√≥ nguy c∆° gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh. - D: Hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc nh∆∞ng c·∫ßn c·∫•u h√¨nh ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ GPU. - B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao, TPU th∆∞·ªùng nhanh h∆°n GPU cho c√°c t√°c v·ª• ML l·ªõn. - C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, c√≥ th·ªÉ ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh. - D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, c·∫ßn th√™m c·∫•u h√¨nh v√† kh√¥ng ch·∫Øc ch·∫Øn hi·ªáu qu·∫£.

Question 96 of 294
Question 97 (Single answer)
You are a data scientist at an industrial equipment manufacturing company. You are developing a regression model to estimate the power consumption in the company‚Äôs manufacturing plants based on sensor data collected from all of the plants. The sensors collect tens of millions of records every day. You need to schedule daily training runs for your model that use all the data collected up to the current date. Question 97 of 294
Question 98 (Single answer)
You built a custom ML model using scikit-learn. Training time is taking longer than expected. You decide to migrate your model to Vertex AI Training, and you want to improve the model‚Äôs training time. What should you try out first?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch c·∫£i thi·ªán th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ML t√πy ch·ªânh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c x√¢y d·ª±ng b·∫±ng scikit-learn khi di chuy·ªÉn sang Vertex AI Training. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
- M√¥ h√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i s·ª≠ d·ª•ng scikit-learn.
- M·ª•c ti√™u l√† c·∫£i thi·ªán th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
- S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Training.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: Migrate sang TensorFlow c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông t·ªët v·ªõi scikit-learn.
- B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng nhi·ªÅu VM c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán th·ªùi gian nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch t·ªëi ∆∞u nh·∫•t n·∫øu kh√¥ng c√≥ h·ªó tr·ª£ ph√¢n t√°n t·ª´ scikit-learn.
- C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng DLVM images v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a v·ªõi NumPy v√† SciPy c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thay ƒë·ªïi framework.
- D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c GPU.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ph·∫£i chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi framework.
- B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng trung b√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho scikit-learn.
- C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng cao v√¨ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thay ƒë·ªïi l·ªõn.
- D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng th·∫•p n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng GPU.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
L·ª±a ch·ªçn C l√† c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng v√¨ n√≥ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a hi·ªáu su·∫•t hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thay ƒë·ªïi framework ho·∫∑c c·∫•u tr√∫c m√¥ h√¨nh.
Question 98 of 294
Question 99 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a travel company. You have been researching customers‚Äô travel behavior for many years, and you have deployed models that predict customers‚Äô vacation patterns. You have observed that customers‚Äô vacation destinations vary based on seasonality and holidays; however, these seasonal variations are similar across years. You want to quickly and easily store and compare the model versions and performance statistics across years. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: L∆∞u tr·ªØ th·ªëng k√™ hi·ªáu su·∫•t trong Cloud SQL v√† truy v·∫•n ƒë·ªÉ so s√°nh. C√°ch n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác qu·∫£n l√Ω phi√™n b·∫£n m√¥ h√¨nh v√† so s√°nh theo m√πa.
  • B: T·∫°o phi√™n b·∫£n m√¥ h√¨nh cho m·ªói m√πa trong Vertex AI v√† so s√°nh trong tab Evaluate. C√°ch n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p r√µ r√†ng ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác l∆∞u tr·ªØ th·ªëng k√™ hi·ªáu su·∫•t.
  • C: L∆∞u tr·ªØ th·ªëng k√™ hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m·ªói l·∫ßn ch·∫°y pipeline trong Kubeflow. C√°ch n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác qu·∫£n l√Ω phi√™n b·∫£n m√¥ h√¨nh theo m√πa v√† nƒÉm.
  • D: L∆∞u tr·ªØ th·ªëng k√™ hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m·ªói phi√™n b·∫£n m√¥ h√¨nh s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√πa v√† nƒÉm nh∆∞ c√°c s·ª± ki·ªán trong Vertex ML Metadata. C√°ch n√†y cho ph√©p qu·∫£n l√Ω v√† so s√°nh hi·ªáu qu·∫£ theo m√πa v√† nƒÉm.

Question 99 of 294
Question 100 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a manufacturing company. You need to build a model that identifies defects in products based on images of the product taken at the end of the assembly line. You want your model to preprocess the images with lower computation to quickly extract features of defects in products. Which approach should you use to build the model?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi:
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: 'nh·∫≠n di·ªán l·ªói trong s·∫£n ph·∫©m', 'd·ª±a tr√™n h√¨nh ·∫£nh', 'x·ª≠ l√Ω tr∆∞·ªõc h√¨nh ·∫£nh v·ªõi t√≠nh to√°n th·∫•p', v√† 'tr√≠ch xu·∫•t ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng'.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- Reinforcement learning: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn x·ª≠ l√Ω h√¨nh ·∫£nh. - Recommender system: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn x·ª≠ l√Ω h√¨nh ·∫£nh. - Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN): Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ RNN th∆∞·ªùng d√πng cho d·ªØ li·ªáu tu·∫ßn t·ª±, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i h√¨nh ·∫£nh. - Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN): Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ CNN ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω v√† tr√≠ch xu·∫•t ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng t·ª´ d·ªØ li·ªáu h√¨nh ·∫£nh.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng - B: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng - C: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng - D: ƒê√∫ng
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† D: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN).
Question 100 of 294
Question 101 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model intended to classify whether X-ray images indicate bone fracture risk. You have trained a ResNet architecture on Vertex AI using a TPU as an accelerator, however you are unsatisfied with the training time and memory usage. You want to quickly iterate your training code but make minimal changes to the code. You also want to minimize impact on the model‚Äôs accuracy. What should you do?

Question 101 of 294
Question 102 (Single answer)
You have successfully deployed to production a large and complex TensorFlow model trained on tabular data. You want to predict the lifetime value (LTV) field for each subscription stored in the BigQuery table named subscription. subscriptionPurchase in the project named my-fortune500-company-project.
You have organized all your training code, from preprocessing data from the BigQuery table up to deploying the validated model to the Vertex AI endpoint, into a TensorFlow Extended (TFX) pipeline. You want to prevent prediction drift, i.e., a situation when a feature data distribution in production changes significantly over time. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ngƒÉn ch·∫∑n prediction drift cho m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow ƒë√£ tri·ªÉn khai, v·ªõi m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai th√†nh c√¥ng v√† c·∫ßn d·ª± ƒëo√°n gi√° tr·ªã LTV. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TFX pipeline ƒë·ªÉ t·ªï ch·ª©c m√£ hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh. - C·∫ßn ngƒÉn ch·∫∑n prediction drift, t·ª©c l√† s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ trong ph√¢n ph·ªëi d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng theo th·ªùi gian.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh h√†ng ng√†y, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi√°m s√°t prediction drift. - B: ƒê·ªÅ xu·∫•t c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªõi 10% d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë∆∞·ª£c l·∫•y m·∫´u m·ªói 24 gi·ªù, c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán drift. - C: T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± B nh∆∞ng v·ªõi 90% d·ª± ƒëo√°n, c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt v√† t·ªën k√©m. - D: L·∫•y m·∫´u m·ªói gi·ªù c√≥ th·ªÉ qu√° th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng gi√°m s√°t drift. - B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ gi√°m s√°t drift v·ªõi t·∫ßn su·∫•t h·ª£p l√Ω. - C: Kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt v√¨ t·∫ßn su·∫•t qu√° cao. - D: Kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt v√¨ t·∫ßn su·∫•t qu√° cao.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B, v√¨ n√≥ cung c·∫•p m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi√°m s√°t h·ª£p l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán prediction drift.
Question 102 of 294
Question 103 (Single answer)
You recently developed a deep learning model using Keras, and now you are experimenting with different training strategies. First, you trained the model using a single GPU, but the training process was too slow. Next, you distributed the training across 4 GPUs using tf.distribute.MirroredStrategy (with no other changes), but you did not observe a decrease in training time. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
- M√¥ h√¨nh deep learning s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Keras.
- ƒê√£ th·ª≠ ph√¢n ph·ªëi hu·∫•n luy·ªán tr√™n 4 GPU v·ªõi tf.distribute.MirroredStrategy.
- Kh√¥ng th·∫•y gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: Ph√¢n ph·ªëi dataset c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† nguy√™n nh√¢n ch√≠nh khi ƒë√£ d√πng MirroredStrategy.
- B: T·∫°o custom training loop c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p tr·ª±c ti·∫øp cho v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ th·ªùi gian.
- C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác t·ªëi ∆∞u GPU hi·ªán t·∫°i.
- D: TƒÉng batch size th∆∞·ªùng gi√∫p tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô hu·∫•n luy·ªán khi s·ª≠ d·ª•ng nhi·ªÅu GPU.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
- B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
- C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh.
- D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D: TƒÉng batch size.
Question 103 of 294
Question 104 (Single answer)
You work for a gaming company that has millions of customers around the world. All games offer a chat feature that allows players to communicate with each other in real time. Messages can be typed in more than 20 languages and are translated in real time using the Cloud Translation API. You have been asked to build an ML system to moderate the chat in real time while assuring that the performance is uniform across the various languages and without changing the serving infrastructure.
You trained your first model using an in-house word2vec model for embedding the chat messages translated by the Cloud Translation API. However, the model has significant differences in performance across the different languages. How should you improve it?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu c·∫£i thi·ªán h·ªá th·ªëng ML ƒë·ªÉ ƒëi·ªÅu ti·∫øt chat trong th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t ƒë·ªìng ƒë·ªÅu tr√™n c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ m√† kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi c∆° s·ªü h·∫° t·∫ßng ph·ª•c v·ª•. C·∫ßn ch·ªçn m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
  • H·ªá th·ªëng ML hi·ªán t·∫°i c√≥ s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát v·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t gi·ªØa c√°c ng√¥n ng·ªØ.
  • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh word2vec t·ª± ph√°t tri·ªÉn ƒë·ªÉ nh√∫ng th√¥ng ƒëi·ªáp chat ƒë√£ d·ªãch.
  • Y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi c∆° s·ªü h·∫° t·∫ßng ph·ª•c v·ª•.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Th√™m thu·∫≠t to√°n Min-Diff c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ g·ªëc r·ªÖ v·ªÅ ng√¥n ng·ªØ.
  • B: Hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªõi ng√¥n ng·ªØ g·ªëc c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t v√¨ kh√¥ng ph·ª• thu·ªôc v√†o ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng d·ªãch thu·∫≠t.
  • C: Thay th·∫ø word2vec b·∫±ng GPT-3 ho·∫∑c T5 c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng nh√∫ng nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu thay ƒë·ªïi c∆° s·ªü h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • D: Lo·∫°i b·ªè ƒëi·ªÅu ti·∫øt cho m·ªôt s·ªë ng√¥n ng·ªØ kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t ƒë·ªìng ƒë·ªÅu.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ng√¥n ng·ªØ.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao, gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t ng√¥n ng·ªØ m√† kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu thay ƒë·ªïi h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p, kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t ƒë·ªìng ƒë·ªÅu.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 104 of 294
Question 105 (Single answer)
You work for a gaming company that develops massively multiplayer online (MMO) games. You built a TensorFlow model that predicts whether players will make in-app purchases of more than $10 in the next two weeks. The model‚Äôs predictions will be used to adapt each user‚Äôs game experience. User data is stored in BigQuery. How should you serve your model while optimizing cost, user experience, and ease of management?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n vi·ªác ng∆∞·ªùi ch∆°i s·∫Ω th·ª±c hi·ªán mua h√†ng trong ·ª©ng d·ª•ng, v·ªõi m·ª•c ti√™u t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠, tr·∫£i nghi·ªám ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng v√† d·ªÖ qu·∫£n l√Ω. 2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†nh vi ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng. - D·ªØ li·ªáu ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery. - Y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠, tr·∫£i nghi·ªám ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng v√† d·ªÖ qu·∫£n l√Ω.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML ƒë·ªÉ nh·∫≠p m√¥ h√¨nh v√† th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n theo l√¥ t·ª´ BigQuery, sau ƒë√≥ ƒë·∫©y d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ªõi Cloud SQ. Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu v√¨ t·∫≠n d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu, t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠ v√† d·ªÖ qu·∫£n l√Ω. - B: Tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh l√™n Vertex AI Prediction v√† th·ª±c hi·ªán d·ª± ƒëo√°n theo l√¥ t·ª´ Cloud Bigtable. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒëang ·ªü BigQuery, vi·ªác chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi sang Bigtable c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u chi ph√≠. - C: Nh√∫ng m√¥ h√¨nh v√†o ·ª©ng d·ª•ng di ƒë·ªông v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n sau m·ªói s·ª± ki·ªán mua h√†ng. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ v√† ph·ª©c t·∫°p trong qu·∫£n l√Ω.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠, tr·∫£i nghi·ªám ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng v√† d·ªÖ qu·∫£n l√Ω. - B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠. - C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do tƒÉng chi ph√≠ v√† ph·ª©c t·∫°p. - D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do tƒÉng chi ph√≠ v√† ph·ª©c t·∫°p.

Question 105 of 294
Question 106 (Single answer)
You are building a linear regression model on BigQuery ML to predict a customer‚Äôs likelihood of purchasing your company‚Äôs products. Your model uses a city name variable as a key predictive component. In order to train and serve the model, your data must be organized in columns.   3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • C: G√°n m·ªói th√†nh ph·ªë v√†o m·ªôt v√πng c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t th√¥ng tin chi ti·∫øt c·ªßa t·ª´ng th√†nh ph·ªë.
