Question 106 of 294
Question 107 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a bank that has a mobile application. Management has asked you to build an ML-based biometric authentication for the app that verifies a customer‚Äôs identity based on their fingerprint. Fingerprints are considered highly sensitive personal information and cannot be downloaded and stored into the bank databases. Which learning strategy should you recommend to train and deploy this ML mode?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c h·ªçc m√°y ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh x√°c th·ª±c sinh tr·∫Øc h·ªçc d·ª±a tr√™n d·∫•u v√¢n tay m√† kh√¥ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ th√¥ng tin nh·∫°y c·∫£m v√†o c∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu c·ªßa ng√¢n h√†ng. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: 'x√°c th·ª±c sinh tr·∫Øc h·ªçc', 'd·∫•u v√¢n tay', 'th√¥ng tin nh·∫°y c·∫£m', 'kh√¥ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√†o c∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu'.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A. Data Loss Prevention API: ƒê√¢y l√† c√¥ng c·ª• ƒë·ªÉ b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c h·ªçc m√°y.
  • B. Federated learning: ƒê√¢y l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p h·ªçc m√°y m√† d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng c·∫ßn ph·∫£i r·ªùi kh·ªèi thi·∫øt b·ªã c√° nh√¢n, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ th√¥ng tin nh·∫°y c·∫£m v√†o c∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  • C. MD5 to encrypt data: MD5 l√† m·ªôt h√†m bƒÉm, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c h·ªçc m√°y v√† kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu.
  • D. Differential privacy: ƒê√¢y l√† k·ªπ thu·∫≠t b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c h·ªçc m√°y ƒë·ªÉ tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh x√°c th·ª±c sinh tr·∫Øc h·ªçc.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n B c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ th√¥ng tin nh·∫°y c·∫£m v√†o c∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† l√† m·ªôt chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c h·ªçc m√°y ph√π h·ª£p.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B. Federated learning.
Question 107 of 294
Question 108 (Single answer)
You are experimenting with a built-in distributed XGBoost model in Vertex AI Workbench user-managed notebooks. You use BigQuery to split your data into training and validation sets using the following queries:
CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE ‚Äòmyproject.mydataset.training‚Äò AS (SELECT * FROM ‚Äòmyproject.mydataset.mytable‚Äò WHERE RAND() <= 0.8);
CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE ‚Äòmyproject.mydataset.validation‚Äò AS (SELECT * FROM ‚Äòmyproject.mydataset.mytable‚Äò WHERE RAND() <= 0.2);
After training the model, you achieve an area under the receiver operating characteristic curve (AUC ROC) value of 0.8, but after deploying the model to production, you notice that your model performance has dropped to an AUC ROC value of 0.65. What problem is most likely occurring?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·∫£y ra nh·∫•t khi hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh gi·∫£m t·ª´ 0.8 xu·ªëng 0.65 sau khi tri·ªÉn khai. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng XGBoost ph√¢n t√°n trong Vertex AI Workbench. - D·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c chia th√†nh t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† t·∫≠p ki·ªÉm tra b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng h√†m RAND() trong BigQuery. - Hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh gi·∫£m t·ª´ 0.8 xu·ªëng 0.65 sau khi tri·ªÉn khai.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: "C√≥ s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát gi·ªØa m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† tri·ªÉn khai." - Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng c√≥ th√¥ng tin n√†o v·ªÅ s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng. - B: "Kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán." - Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng c√≥ th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc d·ªØ li·ªáu. - C: "C√°c b·∫£ng hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† ki·ªÉm tra c√≥ th·ªÉ chia s·∫ª m·ªôt s·ªë b·∫£n ghi." - Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ c√°ch chia d·ªØ li·ªáu b·∫±ng RAND() c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn s·ª± tr√πng l·∫∑p. - D: "H√†m RAND() t·∫°o ra s·ªë nh·ªè h∆°n 0.2 trong c·∫£ hai tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p." - Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Th·∫•p - B: Th·∫•p - C: Cao - D: Th·∫•p
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 108 of 294
Question 109 (Single answer)
During batch training of a neural network, you notice that there is an oscillation in the loss. How should you adjust your model to ensure that it converges?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o n√≥ h·ªôi t·ª• khi c√≥ hi·ªán t∆∞·ª£ng dao ƒë·ªông trong h√†m m·∫•t m√°t trong qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán theo l√¥. C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm "dao ƒë·ªông trong h√†m m·∫•t m√°t" v√† "ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o h·ªôi t·ª•". Dao ƒë·ªông trong h√†m m·∫•t m√°t th∆∞·ªùng x·∫£y ra khi t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc qu√° cao, d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác m√¥ h√¨nh nh·∫£y qua l·∫°i xung quanh ƒëi·ªÉm h·ªôi t·ª•.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc l√¥ hu·∫•n luy·ªán c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô nhi·ªÖu trong ∆∞·ªõc l∆∞·ª£ng gradient, kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt gi√∫p h·ªôi t·ª•.
  • B: Gi·∫£m t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m dao ƒë·ªông v√† gi√∫p m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªôi t·ª• ·ªïn ƒë·ªãnh h∆°n.
  • C: TƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng dao ƒë·ªông, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ n√†y.
  • D: TƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc l√¥ hu·∫•n luy·ªán c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô nhi·ªÖu trong ∆∞·ªõc l∆∞·ª£ng gradient, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ dao ƒë·ªông do t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc cao.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng r·∫•t th·∫•p.
  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh.

Question 109 of 294
Question 110 (Single answer)
You work for a toy manufacturer that has been experiencing a large increase in demand. You need to build an ML model to reduce the amount of time spent by quality control inspectors checking for product defects. Faster defect detection is a priority. The factory does not have reliable Wi-Fi. Your company wants to implement the new ML model as soon as possible. Which model should you use?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn m√¥ h√¨nh ML ph√π h·ª£p
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian ki·ªÉm tra l·ªói s·∫£n ph·∫©m trong ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán nh√† m√°y kh√¥ng c√≥ Wi-Fi ƒë√°ng tin c·∫≠y v√† c·∫ßn tri·ªÉn khai nhanh ch√≥ng. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • Y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian ki·ªÉm tra l·ªói s·∫£n ph·∫©m (t·ª©c l√† c·∫ßn ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p).
    • Nh√† m√°y kh√¥ng c√≥ Wi-Fi ƒë√°ng tin c·∫≠y (c·∫ßn m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông t·ªët tr√™n thi·∫øt b·ªã di ƒë·ªông m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn k·∫øt n·ªëi m·∫°ng li√™n t·ª•c).

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: AutoML Vision Edge mobile-high-accuracy-1 model - T·∫≠p trung v√†o ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c cao, c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p.
    • B: AutoML Vision Edge mobile-low-latency-1 model - T·∫≠p trung v√†o ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian ki·ªÉm tra.
    • C: AutoML Vision model - Kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† m√¥ h√¨nh Edge, c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p khi kh√¥ng c√≥ Wi-Fi ƒë√°ng tin c·∫≠y.
    • D: AutoML Vision Edge mobile-versatile-1 model - ƒêa d·ª•ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng r√µ r√†ng v·ªÅ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p v√† ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông tr√™n thi·∫øt b·ªã di ƒë·ªông.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† m√¥ h√¨nh Edge.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng r√µ r√†ng v·ªÅ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p.

Question 110 of 294
Question 111 (Single answer)
You need to build classification workflows over several structured datasets currently stored in BigQuery. Because you will be performing the classification several times, you want to complete the following steps without writing code: exploratory data analysis, feature selection, model building, training, and hyperparameter tuning and serving. Question 111 of 294
Question 112 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer in the contact center of a large enterprise. You need to build a sentiment analysis tool that predicts customer sentiment from recorded phone conversations.   • D: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi gi·ªçng n√≥i th√†nh vƒÉn b·∫£n v√† tr√≠ch xu·∫•t c·∫£m x√∫c b·∫±ng ph√¢n t√≠ch c√∫ ph√°p. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu s·ª± thi√™n v·ªã.

Question 112 of 294
Question 113 (Single answer)
You need to analyze user activity data from your company‚Äôs mobile applications. Your team will use BigQuery for data analysis, transformation, and experimentation with ML algorithms. You need to ensure real-time ingestion of the user activity data into BigQuery. What should you do?

  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o vi·ªác nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c v√†o BigQuery. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: C·∫•u h√¨nh Pub/Sub ƒë·ªÉ truy·ªÅn d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o BigQuery. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn cho vi·ªác nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
    • B: Ch·∫°y m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác streaming c·ªßa Apache Spark tr√™n Dataproc ƒë·ªÉ nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o BigQuery. Gi·∫£i ph√°p n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
    • C: Ch·∫°y m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác streaming c·ªßa Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o BigQuery. ƒê√¢y c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p kh·∫£ thi cho vi·ªác nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
    • D: C·∫•u h√¨nh Pub/Sub v√† m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác streaming c·ªßa Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o BigQuery. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p k·∫øt h·ª£p, c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho th·ªùi gian th·ª±c v√† ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh v√¨ Dataflow c≈©ng h·ªó tr·ª£ streaming nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p r√µ r√†ng nh∆∞ Pub/Sub.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 113 of 294
Question 114 (Single answer)
You work for a gaming company that manages a popular online multiplayer game where teams with 6 players play against each other in 5-minute battles. There are many new players every day. You need to build a model that automatically assigns available players to teams in real time. User research indicates that the game is more enjoyable when battles have players with similar skill levels. Which business metrics should you track to measure your model‚Äôs performance?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë kinh doanh c·∫ßn theo d√µi ƒë·ªÉ ƒëo l∆∞·ªùng hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n b·ªï ng∆∞·ªùi ch∆°i v√†o c√°c ƒë·ªôi trong th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng nh·∫•t.

Question 114 of 294
Question 115 (Single answer)
You are building an ML model to predict trends in the stock market based on a wide range of factors. While exploring the data, you notice that some features have a large range. You want to ensure that the features with the largest magnitude don‚Äôt overfit the model. What should you do?

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng h√†m log c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô l·ªõn c·ªßa d·ªØ li·ªáu nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c gi√° tr·ªã n·∫±m trong c√πng m·ªôt ph·∫°m vi.
  • B: PCA gi·∫£m chi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ v·ªÅ ƒë·ªô l·ªõn c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng.
  • C: Binning thay th·∫ø gi√° tr·ªã b·∫±ng s·ªë th·ª© t·ª± c·ªßa bin, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ƒë·ªô l·ªõn.
  • D: Chu·∫©n h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu v·ªÅ kho·∫£ng 0 v√† 1 gi√∫p ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c√≥ ƒë·ªô l·ªõn t∆∞∆°ng ƒë∆∞∆°ng, gi·∫£m nguy c∆° overfit.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

  • B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.

Question 115 of 294
Question 116 (Single answer)
You work for a biotech startup that is experimenting with deep learning ML models based on properties of biological organisms. Your team frequently works on early-stage experiments with new architectures of ML models, and writes custom TensorFlow ops in C++. You train your models on large datasets and large batch sizes. Your typical batch size has 1024 examples, and each example is about 1 MB in size. The average size of a network with all weights and embeddings is 20 GB. Question 116 of 294
Question 117 (Single answer)

Question 117 of 294
Question 118 (Single answer)
You are building a TensorFlow model for a financial institution that predicts the impact of consumer spending on inflation globally. Due to the size and nature of the data, your model is long-running across all types of hardware, and you have built frequent checkpointing into the training process. Your organization has asked you to minimize cost. What hardware should you choose?

    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU v3-8 kh√¥ng preemptible, m·∫°nh nh∆∞ng chi ph√≠ cao h∆°n preemptible.

    • C: Kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u chi ph√≠ do kh√¥ng preemptible.
    • D: Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi ∆∞u chi ph√≠ v√† c√≥ checkpoint ƒë·ªÉ kh√¥i ph·ª•c khi b·ªã gi√°n ƒëo·∫°n.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 118 of 294
Question 119 (Single answer)
You work for a company that provides an anti-spam service that flags and hides spam posts on social media platforms. Your company currently uses a list of 200,000 keywords to identify suspected spam posts. If a post contains more than a few of these keywords, the post is identified as spam. You want to start using machine learning to flag spam posts for human review. What is the main advantage of implementing machine learning for this business case?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi:
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh l·ª£i √≠ch ch√≠nh c·ªßa vi·ªác √°p d·ª•ng machine learning trong vi·ªác ph√°t hi·ªán c√°c b√†i ƒëƒÉng spam tr√™n m·∫°ng x√£ h·ªôi. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: Hi·ªán t·∫°i c√¥ng ty s·ª≠ d·ª•ng danh s√°ch 200,000 t·ª´ kh√≥a ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh c√°c b√†i ƒëƒÉng spam. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m ra l·ª£i √≠ch ch√≠nh c·ªßa vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng machine learning thay v√¨ ch·ªâ d·ª±a v√†o danh s√°ch t·ª´ kh√≥a.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B: Machine learning c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng h·ªçc v√† nh·∫≠n di·ªán c√°c c·ª•m t·ª´ m·ªõi c√≥ th·ªÉ l√† spam m√† kh√¥ng c√≥ trong danh s√°ch t·ª´ kh√≥a ban ƒë·∫ßu, ƒë√¢y l√† m·ªôt l·ª£i √≠ch quan tr·ªçng.
  • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng danh s√°ch t·ª´ kh√≥a d√†i h∆°n kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª£i √≠ch ch√≠nh c·ªßa ML, v√¨ ML kh√¥ng c·∫ßn d·ª±a v√†o danh s√°ch t·ª´ kh√≥a d√†i.

Question 119 of 294
Question 120 (Single answer)
One of your models is trained using data provided by a third-party data broker. The data broker does not reliably notify you of formatting changes in the data. You want to make your model training pipeline more robust to issues like this. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch l√†m cho quy tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh tr·ªü n√™n m·∫°nh m·∫Ω h∆°n tr∆∞·ªõc c√°c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ v·ªÅ thay ƒë·ªïi ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ nh√† cung c·∫•p d·ªØ li·ªáu b√™n th·ª© ba. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

Question 120 of 294
Question 121 (Single answer)

Question 121 of 294
Question 122 (Single answer)
You recently built the first version of an image segmentation model for a self-driving car. After deploying the model, you observe a decrease in the area under the curve (AUC) metric. When analyzing the video recordings, you also discover that the model fails in highly congested traffic but works as expected when there is less traffic.     • B: AUC kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë√∫ng ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i, tuy nhi√™n, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát v·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t gi·ªØa c√°c t√¨nh hu·ªëng giao th√¥ng.
    • C: Qu√° nhi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ khu v·ª±c ƒë√¥ng ƒë√∫c c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn overfitting, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c vi·ªác m√¥ h√¨nh ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông t·ªët trong giao th√¥ng √≠t.

Question 122 of 294
Question 123 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model to predict house prices. While preparing the data, you discover that an important predictor variable, distance from the closest school, is often missing and does not have high variance. Question 123 of 294
Question 124 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer responsible for designing and implementing training pipelines for ML models. You need to create an end- to-end training pipeline for a TensorFlow model. The TensorFlow model will be trained on several terabytes of structured data. You need the pipeline to include data quality checks before training and model quality checks after training but prior to deployment. You want to minimize development time and the need for infrastructure maintenance. How should you build and orchestrate your training pipeline?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt k·∫ø v√† tri·ªÉn khai m·ªôt pipeline hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë·∫ßu-cu·ªëi cho m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc l·ªõn. Question 124 of 294
Question 125 (Single answer)
You manage a team of data scientists who use a cloud-based backend system to submit training jobs. This system has become very difficult to administer, and you want to use a managed service instead. The data scientists you work with use many different frameworks, including Keras, PyTorch, theano, scikit-learn, and custom libraries. What should you do?

Question 125 of 294
Question 126 (Single answer)
You are training an object detection model using a Cloud TPU v2. Training time is taking longer than expected. Based on this simplified trace obtained with a Cloud TPU profile, what action should you take to decrease training time in a cost-efficient way?

Question 126 of 294
Question 127 (Single answer)
While performing exploratory data analysis on a dataset, you find that an important categorical feature has null values. You want to minimize the bias that could result from the missing values. How should you handle the missing values?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

    ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch x·ª≠ l√Ω c√°c gi√° tr·ªã null trong m·ªôt ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu sai l·ªách c√≥ th·ªÉ x·∫£y ra. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

    C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i, gi√° tr·ªã null, v√† m·ª•c ti√™u l√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu sai l·ªách (bias).

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c h√†ng c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu v√† tƒÉng m·∫´u d·ªØ li·ªáu l√™n 5%. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng v√† kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu sai l·ªách.
    • B: Thay th·∫ø gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu b·∫±ng gi√° tr·ªã trung b√¨nh c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√¨ gi√° tr·ªã trung b√¨nh kh√¥ng c√≥ √Ω nghƒ©a.
    • C: Thay th·∫ø gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu b·∫±ng m·ªôt danh m·ª•c gi·ªØ ch·ªó ch·ªâ ƒë·ªãnh gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y gi√∫p gi·ªØ l·∫°i th√¥ng tin v·ªÅ s·ª± thi·∫øu d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu sai l·ªách.
    • D: Di chuy·ªÉn c√°c h√†ng c√≥ gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu v√†o t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ki·ªÉm tra. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ thi·∫øu d·ªØ li·ªáu trong t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    ƒê√°p √°n C c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ x·ª≠ l√Ω gi√° tr·ªã thi·∫øu m·ªôt c√°ch ph√π h·ª£p cho d·ªØ li·ªáu ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu sai l·ªách.

  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:

    ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.

Question 127 of 294
Question 128 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer on an agricultural research team working on a crop disease detection tool to detect leaf rust spots in images of crops to determine the presence of a disease. These spots, which can vary in shape and size, are correlated to the severity of the disease. You want to develop a solution that predicts the presence and severity of the disease with high accuracy. Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • B: M√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n ƒëo·∫°n h√¨nh ·∫£nh c√≥ th·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ch√≠nh x√°c bi√™n gi·ªõi c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·ªëm g·ªâ s·∫Øt, cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin chi ti·∫øt c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m·ª©c ƒë·ªô nghi√™m tr·ªçng c·ªßa b·ªánh.
    • C: Thu·∫≠t to√°n kh·ªõp m·∫´u truy·ªÅn th·ªëng th∆∞·ªùng kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß linh ho·∫°t cho c√°c h√¨nh d·∫°ng v√† k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc ƒë·ªëm g·ªâ s·∫Øt ƒëa d·∫°ng.
    • D: M√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh ch·ªâ c√≥ th·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh s·ª± hi·ªán di·ªán c·ªßa b·ªánh, kh√¥ng th·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m·ª©c ƒë·ªô nghi√™m tr·ªçng.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do thi·∫øu th√¥ng tin chi ti·∫øt v·ªÅ bi√™n gi·ªõi.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do thi·∫øu t√≠nh linh ho·∫°t v√† ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng ƒë√°nh gi√° ƒë∆∞·ª£c m·ª©c ƒë·ªô nghi√™m tr·ªçng.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B v√¨ m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n ƒëo·∫°n h√¨nh ·∫£nh c√≥ th·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh ch√≠nh x√°c bi√™n gi·ªõi c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·ªëm g·ªâ s·∫Øt, cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m·ª©c ƒë·ªô nghi√™m tr·ªçng c·ªßa b·ªánh.
Question 128 of 294
Question 129 (Single answer)
You have been asked to productionize a proof-of-concept ML model built using Keras. The model was trained in a Jupyter notebook on a data scientist‚Äôs local machine. The notebook contains a cell that performs data validation and a cell that performs model analysis. You need to orchestrate the steps contained in the notebook and automate the execution of these steps for weekly retraining. You expect much more training data in the future. H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi:

2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- M√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒë∆∞·ª£c x√¢y d·ª±ng b·∫±ng Keras trong Jupyter notebook.
- C·∫ßn t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a c√°c b∆∞·ªõc trong notebook cho vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i h√†ng tu·∫ßn.
- D·ª± ki·∫øn s·∫Ω c√≥ nhi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán h∆°n trong t∆∞∆°ng lai.
- C·∫ßn t·∫≠n d·ª•ng c√°c d·ªãch v·ª• qu·∫£n l√Ω v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Vi·∫øt l·∫°i c√°c b∆∞·ªõc th√†nh m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác Apache Spark v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Dataproc. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªëi ƒëa c√°c d·ªãch v·ª• qu·∫£n l√Ω c·ªßa GCP.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Composer v·ªõi Apache Airflow. M·∫∑c d√π c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªëi ƒëa c√°c d·ªãch v·ª• qu·∫£n l√Ω cho ML nh∆∞ Vertex AI.

Question 129 of 294
Question 130 (Single answer)
You are working on a system log anomaly detection model for a cybersecurity organization. You have developed the model using TensorFlow, and you plan to use it for real-time prediction. Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Run c√≥ th·ªÉ linh ho·∫°t nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p nh·∫•t v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ c√≥ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ khi kh·ªüi ƒë·ªông container.

  • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI endpoint cho ph√©p t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ v√¨ d·ªãch v·ª• n√†y ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø cho ph·ª•c v·ª• m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªõi ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TFServing tr√™n GKE c√≥ th·ªÉ hi·ªáu qu·∫£ nh∆∞ng ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n trong vi·ªác qu·∫£n l√Ω v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u b·∫±ng Vertex AI cho ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

Question 130 of 294
Question 131 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a mobile gaming company. A data scientist on your team recently trained a TensorFlow model, and you are responsible for deploying this model into a mobile application. You discover that the inference latency of the current model doesn‚Äôt meet production requirements. You need to reduce the inference time by, and you are willing to accept a small decrease in model accuracy in order to reach the latency requirement. Without training a new model, which model optimization technique for reducing latency should you try first?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m m·ªôt k·ªπ thu·∫≠t t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ suy lu·∫≠n m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh, ch·∫•p nh·∫≠n m·ªôt s·ª± gi·∫£m nh·ªè v·ªÅ ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • Y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ suy lu·∫≠n.
    • Kh√¥ng c·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh.
    • Ch·∫•p nh·∫≠n gi·∫£m nh·∫π ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • Weight pruning: K·ªπ thu·∫≠t n√†y lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c tr·ªçng s·ªë kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt, c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc m√¥ h√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√∫c n√†o c≈©ng gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
    • Dynamic range quantization: K·ªπ thu·∫≠t n√†y chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi c√°c tr·ªçng s·ªë t·ª´ float32 sang int8, gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc m√¥ h√¨nh v√† th∆∞·ªùng gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ suy lu·∫≠n ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ.
    • Model distillation: Y√™u c·∫ßu hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh nh·ªè h∆°n t·ª´ m√¥ h√¨nh l·ªõn, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ƒë·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i.
    • Dimensionality reduction: Th∆∞·ªùng √°p d·ª•ng cho d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·∫ßu v√†o h∆°n l√† m√¥ h√¨nh, kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ suy lu·∫≠n.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • Weight pruning: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • Dynamic range quantization: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
    • Model distillation: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • Dimensionality reduction: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B. Dynamic range quantization.
Question 131 of 294
Question 132 (Single answer)
You work on a data science team at a bank and are creating an ML model to predict loan default risk. You have collected and cleaned hundreds of millions of records worth of training data in a BigQuery table, and you now want to develop and compare multiple models on this data using TensorFlow and Vertex AI. You want to minimize any bottlenecks during the data ingestion state while considering scalability. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† so s√°nh nhi·ªÅu m√¥ h√¨nh ML tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn trong BigQuery b·∫±ng TensorFlow v√† Vertex AI, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√°c n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai trong giai ƒëo·∫°n nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† c√¢n nh·∫Øc kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn trong BigQuery, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow v√† Vertex AI, t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai, v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery client library ƒë·ªÉ t·∫£i d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o dataframe v√† d√πng tf.data.Dataset.from_tensor_slices() c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√¨ dataframe c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng x·ª≠ l√Ω t·ªët v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
  • B: Xu·∫•t d·ªØ li·ªáu ra file CSV v√† ƒë·ªçc b·∫±ng tf.data.TextLineDataset() c√≥ th·ªÉ g√¢y ra n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai do vi·ªác ƒë·ªçc v√† ghi file.
  • C: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu th√†nh TFRecords v√† ƒë·ªçc b·∫±ng tf.data.TFRecordDataset() l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n t·ªët cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, nh∆∞ng v·∫´n c·∫ßn b∆∞·ªõc chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery Reader c·ªßa TensorFlow I/O ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·ªçc tr·ª±c ti·∫øp d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ BigQuery l√† c√°ch t·ªëi ∆∞u nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ tr√°nh n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai v√† h·ªó tr·ª£ kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do c√≥ th·ªÉ g√¢y n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, t·ªët nh∆∞ng c·∫ßn b∆∞·ªõc chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t, t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† tr√°nh n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D v√¨ n√≥ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng t·ªët nh·∫•t y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i v·ªÅ t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a n√∫t th·∫Øt c·ªï chai v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông.
Question 132 of 294
Question 133 (Single answer)
You have recently created a proof-of-concept (POC) deep learning model. You are satisfied with the overall architecture, but you need to determine the value for a couple of hyperparameters. You want to perform hyperparameter tuning on Vertex AI to determine both the appropriate embedding dimension for a categorical feature used by your model and the optimal learning rate. You configure the following settings: ‚Ä¢ For the embedding dimension, you set the type to INTEGER with a minValue of 16 and maxValue of 64.
‚Ä¢ For the learning rate, you set the type to DOUBLE with a minValue of 10e-05 and maxValue of 10e-02.
You are using the default Bayesian optimization tuning algorithm, and you want to maximize model accuracy. Training time is not a concern. How should you set the hyperparameter scaling for each hyperparameter and the maxParallelTrials?
B Other
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh c√°ch thi·∫øt l·∫≠p scale cho c√°c hyperparameter v√† s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng maxParallelTrials khi th·ª±c hi·ªán tuning tr√™n Vertex AI ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points quan tr·ªçng
- M√¥ h√¨nh deep learning ƒë√£ c√≥ ki·∫øn tr√∫c ·ªïn ƒë·ªãnh, c·∫ßn t·ªëi ∆∞u hyperparameters.
- S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Bayesian optimization ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c.
- Kh√¥ng quan t√¢m ƒë·∫øn th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
- C·∫ßn x√°c ƒë·ªãnh scale cho embedding dimension (INTEGER) v√† learning rate (DOUBLE).
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- UNIT_LINEAR_SCALE ph√π h·ª£p cho c√°c gi√° tr·ªã INTEGER nh∆∞ embedding dimension.
- UNIT_LOG_SCALE ph√π h·ª£p cho c√°c gi√° tr·ªã DOUBLE nh∆∞ learning rate, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát khi gi√° tr·ªã tr·∫£i d√†i tr√™n nhi·ªÅu b·∫≠c ƒë·ªô l·ªõn.
- S·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng parallel trials l·ªõn c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt khi th·ªùi gian kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ, v√† Bayesian optimization th∆∞·ªùng ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông t·ªët h∆°n v·ªõi s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám song song nh·ªè.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n
- ƒê√°p √°n A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng parallel trials l·ªõn kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
- ƒê√°p √°n B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë√∫ng scale v√† s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng parallel trials nh·ªè.
- ƒê√°p √°n C: Sai v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng scale kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng cho embedding dimension.
- ƒê√°p √°n D: Sai v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng scale kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng cho embedding dimension.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi
ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B: "Use UNIT_LINEAR_SCALE for the embedding dimension, UNIT_LOG_SCALE for the learning rate, and a small number of parallel trials."
Question 133 of 294
Question 134 (Single answer)
You are the Director of Data Science at a large company, and your Data Science team has recently begun using the Kubeflow Pipelines SDK to orchestrate their training pipelines. Your team is struggling to integrate their custom Python code into the Kubeflow Pipelines SDK. How should you instruct them to proceed in order to quickly integrate their code with the Kubeflow Pipelines SDK?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points quan tr·ªçng: - ƒê·ªôi ng≈© ƒëang g·∫∑p kh√≥ khƒÉn trong vi·ªác t√≠ch h·ª£p m√£ Python t√πy ch·ªânh. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Kubeflow Pipelines SDK.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng h√†m func_to_container_op ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn t√πy ch·ªânh t·ª´ m√£ Python. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ t√≠ch h·ª£p m√£ Python v√†o Kubeflow Pipelines. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn c√≥ s·∫µn ƒë·ªÉ truy c·∫≠p Dataproc v√† ch·∫°y m√£ t√πy ch·ªânh. C√°ch n√†y ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng nhanh ch√≥ng. - D: Tri·ªÉn khai m√£ Python l√™n Cloud Functions v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Kubeflow Pipelines ƒë·ªÉ k√≠ch ho·∫°t. 4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Cao, v√¨ ƒë√¢y l√† c√°ch tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v√† nhanh ch√≥ng ƒë·ªÉ t√≠ch h·ª£p m√£ Python. - B: Th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng t√≠ch h·ª£p tr·ª±c ti·∫øp m√£ Python. - C: Trung b√¨nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nhanh ch√≥ng. - D: Th·∫•p, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i c√°ch t√≠ch h·ª£p tr·ª±c ti·∫øp.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: - ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 134 of 294
Question 135 (Single answer)
You work for the AI team of an automobile company, and you are developing a visual defect detection model using TensorFlow and Keras. To improve your model performance, you want to incorporate some image augmentation functions such as translation, cropping, and contrast tweaking. You randomly apply these functions to each training batch. You want to optimize your data processing pipeline for run time and compute resources utilization. What should you do?
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

Question 135 of 294
Question 136 (Single answer)
You work for an online publisher that delivers news articles to over 50 million readers. You have built an AI model that recommends content for the company‚Äôs weekly newsletter. A recommendation is considered successful if the article is opened within two days of the newsletter‚Äôs published date and the user remains on the page for at least one minute.
All the information needed to compute the success metric is available in BigQuery and is updated hourly. The model is trained on eight weeks of data, on average its performance degrades below the acceptable baseline after five weeks, and training time is 12 hours. You want to ensure that the model‚Äôs performance is above the acceptable baseline while minimizing cost. How should you monitor the model to determine when retraining is necessary?
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch√∫ng ta t√¨m c√°ch gi√°m s√°t m√¥ h√¨nh AI ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh khi n√†o c·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i nh·∫±m ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh lu√¥n tr√™n m·ª©c ch·∫•p nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a chi ph√≠. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
- M√¥ h√¨nh AI khuy·∫øn ngh·ªã n·ªôi dung cho b·∫£n tin h√†ng tu·∫ßn.
- M·ªôt khuy·∫øn ngh·ªã th√†nh c√¥ng khi b√†i vi·∫øt ƒë∆∞·ª£c m·ªü trong v√≤ng hai ng√†y v√† ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng ·ªü l·∫°i trang √≠t nh·∫•t m·ªôt ph√∫t.
- D·ªØ li·ªáu c·∫ßn thi·∫øt c√≥ s·∫µn trong BigQuery v√† c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t h√†ng gi·ªù.
- M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu t√°m tu·∫ßn, hi·ªáu su·∫•t gi·∫£m sau nƒÉm tu·∫ßn.
- Th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán l√† 12 gi·ªù.
- C·∫ßn gi√°m s√°t ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh khi n√†o c·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i.
B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Model Monitoring ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± l·ªách c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë·∫ßu v√†o v·ªõi t·∫ßn su·∫•t hai ng√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi√∫p x√°c ƒë·ªãnh khi n√†o c·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i d·ª±a tr√™n hi·ªáu su·∫•t th·ª±c t·∫ø.
- B: L√™n l·ªãch cron job ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh h√†ng tu·∫ßn c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√¨ kh√¥ng d·ª±a tr√™n hi·ªáu su·∫•t th·ª±c t·∫ø.
- C: L√™n l·ªãch truy v·∫•n h√†ng tu·∫ßn trong BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n metric th√†nh c√¥ng gi√∫p theo d√µi hi·ªáu su·∫•t th·ª±c t·∫ø c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
- D: L√™n l·ªãch c√¥ng vi·ªác h√†ng ng√†y trong Cloud Composer ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n metric th√†nh c√¥ng c√≥ th·ªÉ qu√° th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n
- A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi√°m s√°t hi·ªáu su·∫•t th·ª±c t·∫ø.

Question 136 of 294
Question 137 (Single answer)
You deployed an ML model into production a year ago. Every month, you collect all raw requests that were sent to your model prediction service during the previous month. You send a subset of these requests to a human labeling service to evaluate your model‚Äôs performance. After a year, you notice that your model's performance sometimes degrades significantly after a month, while other times it takes several months to notice any decrease in performance. The labeling service is costly, but you also need to avoid large performance degradations. You want to determine how often you should retrain your model to maintain a high level of performance while minimizing cost. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i quy·∫øt c√¢u h·ªèi:
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√°c ƒë·ªãnh t·∫ßn su·∫•t c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh nh·∫±m duy tr√¨ hi·ªáu su·∫•t cao trong khi t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a chi ph√≠. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai m·ªôt nƒÉm tr∆∞·ªõc.
    • Hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ sau m·ªôt th√°ng ho·∫∑c v√†i th√°ng.
    • D·ªãch v·ª• g√°n nh√£n th·ªß c√¥ng c√≥ chi ph√≠ cao.

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh ph√°t hi·ªán b·∫•t th∆∞·ªùng ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán d·ªØ li·ªáu b·∫•t th∆∞·ªùng v√† g·ª≠i d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë√≥ ƒëi g√°n nh√£n. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v√¨ kh√¥ng ph·∫£i t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c b·∫•t th∆∞·ªùng ƒë·ªÅu d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn suy gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t.
    • B: T·∫°o l·ªãch tr√¨nh d·ª±a tr√™n c√°c m·∫´u hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr∆∞·ªõc ƒë√≥. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng linh ho·∫°t v·ªõi c√°c thay ƒë·ªïi kh√¥ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr∆∞·ªõc.
    • C: So s√°nh chi ph√≠ d·ªãch v·ª• g√°n nh√£n v·ªõi doanh thu b·ªã m·∫•t. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ t·∫ßn su·∫•t hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i.
    • D: Ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát gi·ªØa d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† d·ªØ li·ªáu ph·ª•c v·ª•. N·∫øu ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± kh√°c bi·ªát, g·ª≠i d·ªØ li·ªáu ph·ª•c v·ª• g·∫ßn nh·∫•t ƒëi g√°n nh√£n. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu k·ªãp th·ªùi.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 137 of 294
Question 138 (Single answer)
You work for a company that manages a ticketing platform for a large chain of cinemas. Customers use a mobile app to search for movies they‚Äôre interested in and purchase tickets in the app. Ticket purchase requests are sent to Pub/Sub and are processed with a Dataflow streaming pipeline configured to conduct the following steps: 1. Check for availability of the movie tickets at the selected cinema. 2. Assign the ticket price and accept payment. 3. Reserve the tickets at the selected cinema. 4. Send successful purchases to your database.
Each step in this process has low latency requirements (less than 50 milliseconds). You have developed a logistic regression model with BigQuery ML that predicts whether offering a promo code for free popcorn increases the chance of a ticket purchase, and this prediction should be added to the ticket purchase process. You want to identify the simplest way to deploy this model to production while adding minimal latency. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh logistic regression v√†o quy tr√¨nh mua v√© m√† kh√¥ng l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- M√¥ h√¨nh logistic regression d·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng tƒÉng mua v√© khi cung c·∫•p m√£ khuy·∫øn m√£i.
- Quy tr√¨nh mua v√© c√≥ y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p (d∆∞·ªõi 50ms).

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Ch·∫°y d·ª± ƒëo√°n theo l√¥ m·ªói 5 ph√∫t c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: Th√™m b∆∞·ªõc RunInference v√†o Dataflow c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh tr√™n Vertex AI v√† g·ªçi d·ª± ƒëo√°n t·ª´ pipeline c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ do th·ªùi gian g·ªçi API.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow Lite v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p v√†o ·ª©ng d·ª•ng di ƒë·ªông gi√∫p d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c hi·ªán ngay tr√™n thi·∫øt b·ªã, gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do kh√¥ng ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t v√¨ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ b·∫±ng c√°ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr√™n thi·∫øt b·ªã.

Question 138 of 294
Question 139 (Single answer)
You work on a team in a data center that is responsible for server maintenance. Your management team wants you to build a predictive maintenance solution that uses monitoring data to detect potential server failures. Incident data has not been labeled yet. What should you do first?

Question 139 of 294
Question 140 (Single answer)
You work for a retailer that sells clothes to customers around the world. You have been tasked with ensuring that ML models are built in a secure manner. Specifically, you need to protect sensitive customer data that might be used in the models. You have identified four fields containing sensitive data that are being used by your data science team: AGE, IS_EXISTING_CUSTOMER, LATITUDE_LONGITUDE, and SHIRT_SIZE. What should you do with the data before it is made available to the data science team for training purposes?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n

  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • D·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m bao g·ªìm: AGE, IS_EXISTING_CUSTOMER, LATITUDE_LONGITUDE, v√† SHIRT_SIZE.
    • C·∫ßn b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m tr∆∞·ªõc khi s·ª≠ d·ª•ng cho m·ª•c ƒë√≠ch hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Token h√≥a t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√°c gi√° tr·ªã gi·∫£ m√£ h√≥a ƒë·ªÉ thay th·∫ø c√°c gi√° tr·ªã th·ª±c. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m b·∫±ng c√°ch l√†m cho d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng th·ªÉ nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ph√¢n t√≠ch th√†nh ph·∫ßn ch√≠nh (PCA) ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m b·ªën tr∆∞·ªùng nh·∫°y c·∫£m th√†nh m·ªôt vector PCA. PCA th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m chi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m.
    • C: L√†m th√¥ d·ªØ li·ªáu b·∫±ng c√°ch ƒë∆∞a AGE v√†o c√°c ph√¢n v·ªã v√† l√†m tr√≤n LATITUDE_LONGITUDE. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o b·∫£o m·∫≠t d·ªØ li·ªáu.
    • D: Lo·∫°i b·ªè t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m v√† y√™u c·∫ßu nh√≥m khoa h·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh b·∫±ng d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng nh·∫°y c·∫£m. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng cho m√¥ h√¨nh.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ token h√≥a l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m hi·ªáu qu·∫£.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ PCA kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu.

Question 140 of 294
Question 141 (Single answer)
You work for a magazine publisher and have been tasked with predicting whether customers will cancel their annual subscription. In your exploratory data analysis, you find that of individuals renew their subscription every year, and only of individuals cancel their subscription. After training a NN Classifier, your model predicts those who cancel their subscription with accuracy and predicts those who renew their subscription with accuracy. How should you interpret these results?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n gi·∫£i th√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n vi·ªác h·ªßy ƒëƒÉng k√Ω h√†ng nƒÉm c·ªßa kh√°ch h√†ng. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.

- M√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n vi·ªác h·ªßy ƒëƒÉng k√Ω v√† vi·ªác gia h·∫°n ƒëƒÉng k√Ω v·ªõi ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c kh√°c nhau.

- ƒê√°p √°n A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng c√≥ l√Ω do n√†o cho r·∫±ng ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa vi·ªác gia h·∫°n c·∫ßn cao h∆°n vi·ªác h·ªßy.

- ƒê√°p √°n C: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ vi·ªác d·ª± ƒëo√°n nh√≥m c√≥ √≠t d·ªØ li·ªáu (ng∆∞·ªùi h·ªßy) th∆∞·ªùng kh√≥ h∆°n.
- ƒê√°p √°n D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c tr√™n 80% kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt l√† t·ªët n·∫øu c√≥ s·ª± ch√™nh l·ªách l·ªõn gi·ªØa hai nh√≥m.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- ƒê√°p √°n A: Th·∫•p
- ƒê√°p √°n B: Th·∫•p
- ƒê√°p √°n C: Cao
- ƒê√°p √°n D: Th·∫•p

ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C, v√¨ vi·ªác d·ª± ƒëo√°n nh√≥m c√≥ √≠t d·ªØ li·ªáu h∆°n (ng∆∞·ªùi h·ªßy) th∆∞·ªùng kh√≥ h∆°n, v√† m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ l√†m t·ªët trong b·ªëi c·∫£nh n√†y.
Question 141 of 294
Question 142 (Single answer)
You have built a model that is trained on data stored in Parquet files. You access the data through a Hive table hosted on Google Cloud. You preprocessed these data with PySpark and exported it as a CSV file into Cloud Storage. After preprocessing, you execute additional steps to train and evaluate your model. You want to parametrize this model training in Kubeflow Pipelines. What should you do?

    • M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu l∆∞u tr·ªØ d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng file Parquet v√† truy c·∫≠p qua b·∫£ng Hive tr√™n Google Cloud.

    • C·∫ßn tham s·ªë h√≥a qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh trong Kubeflow Pipelines.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Lo·∫°i b·ªè b∆∞·ªõc chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu kh·ªèi pipeline kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt ƒë∆∞·ª£c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ tham s·ªë h√≥a.
    • B: Container h√≥a b∆∞·ªõc chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi PySpark v√† th√™m v√†o pipeline c√≥ th·ªÉ l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c c√°c d·ªãch v·ª• c√≥ s·∫µn c·ªßa Google Cloud.
    • C: Th√™m m·ªôt ContainerOp v√†o pipeline ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o m·ªôt c·ª•m Dataproc, th·ª±c hi·ªán chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi v√† l∆∞u d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë√£ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi v√†o Cloud Storage. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n h·ª£p l√Ω v√¨ t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c Dataproc cho x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
    • D: Tri·ªÉn khai Apache Spark t·∫°i m·ªôt node pool ri√™ng trong Google Kubernetes Engine v√† th√™m m·ªôt ContainerOp ƒë·ªÉ g·ªçi job chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi. C√°ch n√†y ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c d·ªãch v·ª• Dataproc.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
    • B: C√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë√∫ng nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u.
    • C: ƒê√∫ng v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 142 of 294
Question 143 (Single answer)
You have developed an ML model to detect the sentiment of users‚Äô posts on your company's social media page to identify outages or bugs. You are using Dataflow to provide real-time predictions on data ingested from Pub/Sub. You plan to have multiple training iterations for your model and keep the latest two versions live after every run. You want to split the traffic between the versions in an 80:20 ratio, with the newest model getting the majority of the traffic. You want to keep the pipeline as simple as possible, with minimal management required. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu tri·ªÉn khai c√°c phi√™n b·∫£n c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c t·ª´ d·ªØ li·ªáu Pub/Sub v·ªõi t·ª∑ l·ªá chia l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng 80:20 gi·ªØa hai phi√™n b·∫£n m·ªõi nh·∫•t, trong ƒë√≥ phi√™n b·∫£n m·ªõi nh·∫•t nh·∫≠n 80% l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu gi·ªØ cho pipeline ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n nh·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ v√† y√™u c·∫ßu qu·∫£n l√Ω t·ªëi thi·ªÉu.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. - Chia l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng gi·ªØa hai phi√™n b·∫£n m√¥ h√¨nh theo t·ª∑ l·ªá 80:20. - Gi·ªØ pipeline ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n v√† y√™u c·∫ßu qu·∫£n l√Ω t·ªëi thi·ªÉu.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI endpoint v·ªõi c·∫•u h√¨nh traffic-split = 0 = 80, PREVIOUS_MODEL_ID = 20. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu chia l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng v√† gi·ªØ cho pipeline ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng App Engine v·ªõi c·∫•u h√¨nh --splits PREVIOUS_VERSION = 0.2, NEW_VERSION = 0.8. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n do c·∫ßn qu·∫£n l√Ω ·ª©ng d·ª•ng App Engine. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Run v·ªõi c·∫•u h√¨nh REVISION1 = 20, REVISION2 = 80. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n do c·∫ßn qu·∫£n l√Ω container v√† c√°c phi√™n b·∫£n. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng beam.Partition() trong Dataflow v·ªõi h√†m ph√¢n chia g·ªçi Vertex AI endpoint. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n do c·∫ßn qu·∫£n l√Ω logic ph√¢n chia trong Dataflow.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë·ªß y√™u c·∫ßu chia l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng v√† ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n h√≥a pipeline. - B, C, D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p h∆°n do c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† y√™u c·∫ßu qu·∫£n l√Ω nhi·ªÅu h∆°n.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 143 of 294
Question 144 (Single answer)
You are developing an image recognition model using PyTorch based on ResNet50 architecture. Your code is working fine on your local laptop on a small subsample. Your full dataset has 200k labeled images. You want to quickly scale your training workload while minimizing cost. You plan to use 4 V100 GPUs. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • N·ªôi dung y√™u c·∫ßu: B·∫°n ƒëang ph√°t tri·ªÉn m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng h√¨nh ·∫£nh s·ª≠ d·ª•ng PyTorch d·ª±a tr√™n ki·∫øn tr√∫c ResNet50. M√£ c·ªßa b·∫°n ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông t·ªët tr√™n m√°y t√≠nh c√° nh√¢n v·ªõi m·ªôt m·∫´u nh·ªè. B·ªô d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß c√≥ 200k h√¨nh ·∫£nh c√≥ nh√£n. B·∫°n mu·ªën nhanh ch√≥ng m·ªü r·ªông kh·ªëi l∆∞·ª£ng c√¥ng vi·ªác ƒë√†o t·∫°o trong khi gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠. B·∫°n d·ª± ƒë·ªãnh s·ª≠ d·ª•ng 4 GPU V100. B·∫°n n√™n l√†m g√¨?
    • S·ªë l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng: 1
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh s·ª≠ d·ª•ng PyTorch v√† ResNet50.
    • B·ªô d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v·ªõi 200k h√¨nh ·∫£nh.
    • M·ª•c ti√™u l√† m·ªü r·ªông nhanh ch√≥ng v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠.
    • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng 4 GPU V100.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Google Kubernetes Engine v·ªõi TFJob operator kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ TFJob ch·ªß y·∫øu d√†nh cho TensorFlow, kh√¥ng ph·∫£i PyTorch.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Workbench c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªët kh·∫£ nƒÉng ph√¢n t√°n.
    • C: ƒê√≥ng g√≥i m√£ v·ªõi Setuptools v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng container d·ª±ng s·∫µn tr√™n Vertex AI l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n h·ª£p l√Ω, cho ph√©p t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªët t√†i nguy√™n v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u chi ph√≠.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Compute Engine VM c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠ nh∆∞ Vertex AI.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
    • ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√†: C
Question 144 of 294
Question 145 (Single answer)
You have trained a DNN regressor with TensorFlow to predict housing prices using a set of predictive features. Your default precision is tf.float64, and you use a standard TensorFlow estimator:
Your model performs well, but just before deploying it to production, you discover that your current serving latency is 10ms @ 90 percentile and you currently serve on CPUs. Your production requirements expect a model latency of 8ms @ 90 percentile. You're willing to accept a small decrease in performance in order to reach the latency requirement. Therefore your plan is to improve latency while evaluating how much the model's prediction decreases. What should you first try to quickly lower the serving latency?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
  • N·ªôi dung y√™u c·∫ßu: B·∫°n ƒë√£ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh DNN regressor ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n gi√° nh√† v√† c·∫ßn gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ ph·ª•c v·ª• t·ª´ 10ms xu·ªëng 8ms ·ªü ph·∫ßn trƒÉm th·ª© 90.
  • S·ªë l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng: 1
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points quan tr·ªçng:
  • M√¥ h√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i ƒëang ph·ª•c v·ª• tr√™n CPU.
  • ƒê·ªô tr·ªÖ hi·ªán t·∫°i l√† 10ms v√† c·∫ßn gi·∫£m xu·ªëng 8ms.
  • C√≥ th·ªÉ ch·∫•p nh·∫≠n m·ªôt s·ª± gi·∫£m nh·ªè v·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫°t y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Chuy·ªÉn t·ª´ CPU sang GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o hi·ªáu qu·∫£ chi ph√≠ v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt cho m√¥ h√¨nh nh·ªè.
  • B: √Åp d·ª•ng l∆∞·ª£ng t·ª≠ h√≥a b·∫±ng c√°ch gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa s·ªë th·ª±c c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc m√¥ h√¨nh v√† tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô ph·ª•c v·ª•.
  • C: TƒÉng t·ª∑ l·ªá dropout v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh v√† kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ ph·ª•c v·ª•.
  • D: TƒÉng t·ª∑ l·ªá dropout trong ch·∫ø ƒë·ªô d·ª± ƒëo√°n kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ti√™u chu·∫©n v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m gi·∫£m ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do chi ph√≠ v√† ph·ª©c t·∫°p kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ l∆∞·ª£ng t·ª≠ h√≥a l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ti√™u chu·∫©n.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
  • ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng: B - √Åp d·ª•ng l∆∞·ª£ng t·ª≠ h√≥a b·∫±ng c√°ch gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa s·ªë th·ª±c xu·ªëng tf.float16.
Question 145 of 294
Question 146 (Single answer)
You work on the data science team at a manufacturing company. You are reviewing the company‚Äôs historical sales data, which has hundreds of millions of records. For your exploratory data analysis, you need to calculate descriptive statistics such as mean, median, and mode; conduct complex statistical tests for hypothesis testing; and plot variations of the features over time. You want to use as much of the sales data as possible in your analyses while minimizing computational resources. What should you do?
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n th·ª±c hi·ªán ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√°m ph√° tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu b√°n h√†ng l·ªãch s·ª≠ c·ªßa c√¥ng ty s·∫£n xu·∫•t. B·∫°n c·∫ßn t√≠nh to√°n c√°c th·ªëng k√™ m√¥ t·∫£ nh∆∞ trung b√¨nh, trung v·ªã v√† mode; th·ª±c hi·ªán c√°c ki·ªÉm tra th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p cho ki·ªÉm ƒë·ªãnh gi·∫£ thuy·∫øt; v√† v·∫Ω bi·ªÉu ƒë·ªì bi·∫øn ƒë·ªïi c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng theo th·ªùi gian. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√†ng nhi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu c√†ng t·ªët trong khi gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: t√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ m√¥ t·∫£, ki·ªÉm tra th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p, v·∫Ω bi·ªÉu ƒë·ªì bi·∫øn ƒë·ªïi theo th·ªùi gian, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng nhi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ, v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n.
B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Google Data Studio ƒë·ªÉ v·∫Ω bi·ªÉu ƒë·ªì th·ªùi gian v√† Vertex AI Workbench ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch. Kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Workbench cho c·∫£ ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™ v√† tr·ª±c quan h√≥a. Kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ m√¥ t·∫£, Vertex AI Workbench ƒë·ªÉ tr·ª±c quan h√≥a v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™. T·∫≠n d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn hi·ªáu qu·∫£. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery cho th·ªëng k√™ m√¥ t·∫£, Google Data Studio cho tr·ª±c quan h√≥a, v√† Vertex AI Workbench cho ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ l·ª±a ch·ªçn C nh∆∞ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng th√™m Google Data Studio.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n. Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: Kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng BigQuery. Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: T·∫≠n d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a t√†i nguy√™n t√≠nh to√°n. Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± C nh∆∞ng ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n do s·ª≠ d·ª•ng th√™m c√¥ng c·ª•. Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh.
B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi
L·ª±a ch·ªçn C l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ t·∫≠n d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ m√¥ t·∫£ tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn m·ªôt c√°ch hi·ªáu qu·∫£, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Workbench cho c√°c ph√¢n t√≠ch th·ªëng k√™ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† tr·ª±c quan h√≥a.
Question 146 of 294
Question 147 (Single answer)
Your data science team needs to rapidly experiment with various features, model architectures, and hyperparameters. They need to track the accuracy metrics for various experiments and use an API to query the metrics over time. What should they use to track and report their experiments while minimizing manual effort?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë·ªÉ nh√≥m khoa h·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ nhanh ch√≥ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám v·ªõi c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, ki·∫øn tr√∫c m√¥ h√¨nh v√† si√™u tham s·ªë kh√°c nhau. H·ªç c·∫ßn theo d√µi c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c cho c√°c th·ª≠ nghi·ªám v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng API ƒë·ªÉ truy v·∫•n c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë theo th·ªùi gian. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë√∫ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: "rapidly experiment", "track the accuracy metrics", "use an API to query the metrics", v√† "minimizing manual effort".

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi

  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Training v√† ghi c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c v√†o BigQuery. Truy v·∫•n k·∫øt qu·∫£ b·∫±ng BigQuery API. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ƒë∆∞·ª£c nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a cho vi·ªác theo d√µi v√† truy v·∫•n t·ª± ƒë·ªông.

  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Workbench v√† l∆∞u k·∫øt qu·∫£ v√†o Google Sheets. Truy v·∫•n k·∫øt qu·∫£ b·∫±ng Google Sheets API. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu thao t√°c th·ªß c√¥ng v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a.

Question 147 of 294
Question 148 (Single answer)
You are training an ML model using data stored in BigQuery that contains several values that are considered Personally Identifiable Information (PII). You need to reduce the sensitivity of the dataset before training your model. Every column is critical to your model. How should you proceed?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô nh·∫°y c·∫£m c·ªßa d·ªØ li·ªáu ch·ª©a th√¥ng tin nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng c√° nh√¢n (PII) tr∆∞·ªõc khi hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ML. M·ªói c·ªôt d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·ªÅu quan tr·ªçng cho m√¥ h√¨nh, do ƒë√≥ kh√¥ng th·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè c·ªôt n√†o. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: Random h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng, kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t√≠nh b·∫£o m·∫≠t.

  • C: M√£ h√≥a AES-256 v·ªõi salt c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m thay ƒë·ªïi ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng d·ªØ li·ªáu, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu gi·ªØ nguy√™n ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng.
  • D: Lo·∫°i b·ªè c·ªôt ch·ª©a d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m kh√¥ng kh·∫£ thi v√¨ m·ªçi c·ªôt ƒë·ªÅu quan tr·ªçng.

Question 148 of 294
Question 149 (Multiple answers)
You recently deployed an ML model. Three months after deployment, you notice that your model is underperforming on certain subgroups, thus potentially leading to biased results. You suspect that the inequitable performance is due to class imbalances in the training data, but you cannot collect more data. What should you do? (Choose two.)
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m ra hai ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ƒë·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ML khi kh√¥ng th·ªÉ thu th·∫≠p th√™m d·ªØ li·ªáu, trong b·ªëi c·∫£nh m√¥ h√¨nh ƒëang ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông k√©m tr√™n m·ªôt s·ªë nh√≥m con do m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp trong d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: m√¥ h√¨nh ho·∫°t ƒë·ªông k√©m tr√™n m·ªôt s·ªë nh√≥m con, nghi ng·ªù do m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp, kh√¥ng th·ªÉ thu th·∫≠p th√™m d·ªØ li·ªáu, v√† c·∫ßn ch·ªçn hai ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B: Th√™m m·ªôt m·ª•c ti√™u ph·ª• ƒë·ªÉ ph·∫°t m√¥ h√¨nh nhi·ªÅu h∆°n cho c√°c l·ªói tr√™n l·ªõp thi·ªÉu s·ªë c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t tr√™n c√°c nh√≥m con b·ªã ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng.
  • C: Lo·∫°i b·ªè c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c√≥ t∆∞∆°ng quan cao v·ªõi l·ªõp ƒëa s·ªë c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m m·∫•t th√¥ng tin quan tr·ªçng v√† kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp.

  • E: Tri·ªÉn khai l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh v√† cung c·∫•p nh√£n gi·∫£i th√≠ch h√†nh vi c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t v√† m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp.

Question 149 of 294
Question 150 (Single answer)
You are working on a binary classification ML algorithm that detects whether an image of a classified scanned document contains a company‚Äôs logo. In the dataset, of examples don‚Äôt have the logo, so the dataset is very skewed. Which metric would give you the most confidence in your model?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn metric ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n, trong ƒë√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách (skewed) v√¨ ph·∫ßn l·ªõn kh√¥ng c√≥ logo. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - B√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n. - D·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách, ph·∫ßn l·ªõn kh√¥ng c√≥ logo. - C·∫ßn metric ƒë√°nh gi√° ƒë·ªô tin c·∫≠y c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - Precision: ƒêo l∆∞·ªùng t·ª∑ l·ªá d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë√∫ng trong s·ªë c√°c d·ª± ƒëo√°n l√† c√≥ logo. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p khi d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách. - Recall: ƒêo l∆∞·ªùng t·ª∑ l·ªá d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë√∫ng trong s·ªë c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p th·ª±c s·ª± c√≥ logo. C≈©ng kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° to√†n di·ªán khi d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách. - RMS: Kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† metric ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh·ªã ph√¢n. - F1 score: L√† trung b√¨nh ƒëi·ªÅu h√≤a c·ªßa Precision v√† Recall, ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Precision - Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - B: Recall - Kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß to√†n di·ªán. - C: RMS - Kh√¥ng li√™n quan. - D: F1 score - Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D: F1 score v√¨ n√≥ cung c·∫•p ƒë√°nh gi√° c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa Precision v√† Recall, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát h·ªØu √≠ch khi d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã l·ªách.
Question 150 of 294
Question 151 (Single answer)
While running a model training pipeline on Vertex Al, you discover that the evaluation step is failing because of an out-of-memory error. You are currently using TensorFlow Model Analysis (TFMA) with a standard Evaluator TensorFlow Extended (TFX) pipeline component for the evaluation step. You want to stabilize the pipeline without downgrading the evaluation quality while minimizing infrastructure overhead. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng DataflowRunner c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn h∆°n m√† kh√¥ng g·∫∑p l·ªói b·ªô nh·ªõ, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a chi ph√≠ h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • B: Ch·∫°y tr√™n Compute Engine VMs c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ b·ªô nh·ªõ nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • C: Migrate sang Kubeflow c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • D: Gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng metrics c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m gi·∫£m ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng ƒë√°nh gi√°.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c c·∫£ hai y√™u c·∫ßu: kh√¥ng gi·∫£m ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng v√† t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a chi ph√≠.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ h·∫° t·∫ßng.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng ch·∫Øc ch·∫Øn v·ªÅ chi ph√≠.
  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng ƒë√°nh gi√°.
B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi

ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A: "Include the flag -runner = DataflowRunner in beam_pipeline_args to run the evaluation step on Dataflow."

Question 151 of 294
Question 152 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model using a dataset with categorical input variables. You have randomly split half of the data into training and test sets. After applying one-hot encoding on the categorical variables in the training set, you discover that one categorical variable is missing from the test set. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n x·ª≠ l√Ω t√¨nh hu·ªëng khi m·ªôt bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i b·ªã thi·∫øu trong t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ki·ªÉm tra sau khi ƒë√£ √°p d·ª•ng one-hot encoding tr√™n t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán. B·∫°n c·∫ßn ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ n√†y. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
- D·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i. - ƒê√£ √°p d·ª•ng one-hot encoding tr√™n t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán. - M·ªôt bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i b·ªã thi·∫øu trong t·∫≠p ki·ªÉm tra.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn th∆∞a th·ªõt trong t·∫≠p ki·ªÉm tra kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ thi·∫øu bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i. - B: Ph√¢n ph·ªëi l·∫°i d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i s·∫Ω xu·∫•t hi·ªán trong t·∫≠p ki·ªÉm tra. - C: √Åp d·ª•ng one-hot encoding tr√™n t·∫≠p ki·ªÉm tra l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ƒë√∫ng ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o c√°c bi·∫øn ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒë∆∞·ª£c m√£ h√≥a nh·∫•t qu√°n. - D: Thu th·∫≠p th√™m d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng kh·∫£ thi ho·∫∑c kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt trong ng·ªØ c·∫£nh n√†y.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p. - C: Ph√π h·ª£p. - D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† C: "Apply one-hot encoding on the categorical variables in the test data".
Question 152 of 294
Question 153 (Single answer)
You work for a bank and are building a random forest model for fraud detection. You have a dataset that includes transactions, of which are identified as fraudulent. Which data transformation strategy would likely improve the performance of your classifier?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i random forest d√πng ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh: Random forest.
    • B√†i to√°n: Ph√°t hi·ªán gian l·∫≠n.
    • D·ªØ li·ªáu: Bao g·ªìm c√°c giao d·ªãch, m·ªôt s·ªë trong ƒë√≥ ƒë∆∞·ª£c x√°c ƒë·ªãnh l√† gian l·∫≠n.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Box-Cox transformation th∆∞·ªùng ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë·ªÉ bi·∫øn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu sao cho g·∫ßn v·ªõi ph√¢n ph·ªëi chu·∫©n, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho bi·∫øn m·ª•c ti√™u trong b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i.
    • B: Z-normalize c√≥ th·ªÉ h·ªØu √≠ch cho m·ªôt s·ªë m√¥ h√¨nh, nh∆∞ng random forest kh√¥ng nh·∫°y c·∫£m v·ªõi vi·ªác chu·∫©n h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu.
    • C: Oversampling c√°c giao d·ªãch gian l·∫≠n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p c√¢n b·∫±ng d·ªØ li·ªáu, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y th∆∞·ªùng c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh trong c√°c b√†i to√°n m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng d·ªØ li·ªáu.
    • D: Log transform c√≥ th·ªÉ h·ªØu √≠ch cho vi·ªác x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªách, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t trong b√†i to√°n n√†y.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 153 of 294
Question 154 (Single answer)
You are developing a classification model to support predictions for your company‚Äôs various products. The dataset you were given for model development has class imbalance You need to minimize false positives and false negatives What evaluation metric should you use to properly train the model?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt metric ƒë√°nh gi√° ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi c·∫ßn gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu c·∫£ false positives v√† false negatives. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- M√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i. - D·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng l·ªõp. - C·∫ßn gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu false positives v√† false negatives.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- F1 score: L√† trung b√¨nh ƒëi·ªÅu h√≤a c·ªßa Precision v√† Recall, ph√π h·ª£p khi c·∫ßn c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa false positives v√† false negatives. - Recall: T·∫≠p trung v√†o gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu false negatives, kh√¥ng c√¢n b·∫±ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c v·ªõi false positives. - Accuracy: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ cho k·∫øt qu·∫£ sai l·ªách. - Precision: T·∫≠p trung v√†o gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu false positives, kh√¥ng c√¢n b·∫±ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c v·ªõi false negatives.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- F1 score: Cao, v√¨ n√≥ c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa Precision v√† Recall. - Recall: Th·∫•p, v√¨ ch·ªâ t·∫≠p trung v√†o false negatives. - Accuracy: Th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng. - Precision: Th·∫•p, v√¨ ch·ªâ t·∫≠p trung v√†o false positives.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† F1 score (A), v√¨ n√≥ l√† metric ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa false positives v√† false negatives trong tr∆∞·ªùng h·ª£p d·ªØ li·ªáu b·ªã m·∫•t c√¢n b·∫±ng.
Question 154 of 294
Question 155 (Single answer)
You are training an object detection machine learning model on a dataset that consists of three million X-ray images, each roughly 2 GB in size. You are using Vertex AI Training to run a custom training application on a Compute Engine instance with 32-cores, 128 GB of RAM, and 1 NVIDIA P100 GPU. You notice that model training is taking a very long time. You want to decrease training time without sacrificing model performance. What should you do?
D Other
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh m√† kh√¥ng l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - D·ªØ li·ªáu: 3 tri·ªáu ·∫£nh X-ray, m·ªói ·∫£nh kho·∫£ng 2 GB. - M√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng hu·∫•n luy·ªán: Vertex AI Training, Compute Engine v·ªõi 32-cores, 128 GB RAM, 1 NVIDIA P100 GPU. - V·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ: Th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán qu√° l√¢u. - M·ª•c ti√™u: Gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√† kh√¥ng gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: TƒÉng b·ªô nh·ªõ l√™n 512 GB v√† tƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu nhanh h∆°n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ. - B: Thay th·∫ø GPU P100 b·∫±ng K80 c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m gi·∫£m hi·ªáu su·∫•t v√¨ K80 y·∫øu h∆°n P100. - C: K√≠ch ho·∫°t early stopping c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p d·ª´ng hu·∫•n luy·ªán s·ªõm n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng c·∫£i thi·ªán, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ ƒë·∫°t hi·ªáu su·∫•t t·ªëi ∆∞u. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng tf.distribute.Strategy API ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán b·∫±ng c√°ch ph√¢n ph·ªëi c√¥ng vi·ªác tr√™n nhi·ªÅu t√†i nguy√™n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ ch·ªâ tƒÉng b·ªô nh·ªõ v√† batch size kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë√°ng k·ªÉ. - B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng r·∫•t th·∫•p v√¨ K80 y·∫øu h∆°n P100. - C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh v√¨ early stopping kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian ƒë·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u. - D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán hi·ªáu qu·∫£.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng tf.distribute.Strategy API v√† ch·∫°y hu·∫•n luy·ªán ph√¢n t√°n.
Question 155 of 294
Question 156 (Single answer)
You need to build classification workflows over several structured datasets currently stored in BigQuery. Because you will be performing the classification several times, you want to complete the following steps without writing code: exploratory data analysis, feature selection, model building, training, and hyperparameter tuning and serving.   1. C√°c b∆∞·ªõc c·∫ßn th·ª±c hi·ªán bao g·ªìm: ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu thƒÉm d√≤, ch·ªçn ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh, hu·∫•n luy·ªán, ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë v√† tri·ªÉn khai. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn 1 ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.

    • B: Train a classification Vertex AutoML model. - Vertex AutoML cho ph√©p th·ª±c hi·ªán c√°c b∆∞·ªõc c·∫ßn thi·∫øt m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn vi·∫øt m√£, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu.
    • C: Run a logistic regression job on BigQuery ML. - BigQuery ML c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng h·ªó tr·ª£ t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c b∆∞·ªõc nh∆∞ ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√† kh√¥ng vi·∫øt m√£.
    • D: Use scikit-learn in Vertex AI Workbench user-managed notebooks with pandas library. - C·∫ßn vi·∫øt m√£, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu kh√¥ng vi·∫øt m√£.
