    • B: ƒê√∫ng, v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß y√™u c·∫ßu m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn vi·∫øt m√£.
    • C: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, v√¨ c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng h·ªó tr·ª£ t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c b∆∞·ªõc m√† kh√¥ng vi·∫øt m√£.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, v√¨ c·∫ßn vi·∫øt m√£.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 156 of 294
Question 157 (Single answer)
You recently developed a deep learning model. To test your new model, you trained it for a few epochs on a large dataset. You observe that the training and validation losses barely changed during the training run. You want to quickly debug your model. What should you do first?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m ra b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n ƒë·ªÉ debug m√¥ h√¨nh deep learning khi th·∫•y r·∫±ng loss kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi nhi·ªÅu trong qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- M√¥ h√¨nh deep learning m·ªõi ph√°t tri·ªÉn.
- Loss kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi nhi·ªÅu trong qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
- C·∫ßn debug nhanh m√¥ h√¨nh.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: Ki·ªÉm tra xem m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ ƒë·∫°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c loss th·∫•p tr√™n m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·ªè hay kh√¥ng. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ki·ªÉm tra nhanh xem m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng h·ªçc kh√¥ng.
- B: Th√™m c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng th·ªß c√¥ng ƒë·ªÉ ƒë∆∞a ki·∫øn th·ª©c mi·ªÅn v√†o m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ h·ªØu √≠ch nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n ƒë·ªÉ debug.
- C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªãch v·ª• ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh si√™u tham s·ªë c·ªßa Vertex AI ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m ra learning rate t·ªët h∆°n. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n khi loss kh√¥ng thay ƒë·ªïi.
- D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ph·∫ßn c·ª©ng tƒÉng t·ªëc v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh l√¢u h∆°n. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng h·ªçc ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ª´ ƒë·∫ßu.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Cao. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ki·ªÉm tra nhanh ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh xem m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng h·ªçc hay kh√¥ng.
- B: Th·∫•p. Kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n ƒë·ªÉ debug.
- C: Trung b√¨nh. C√≥ th·ªÉ h·ªØu √≠ch nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n.
- D: Th·∫•p. Kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ g·ªëc n·∫øu m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng h·ªçc ƒë∆∞·ª£c.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† A: "Verify that your model can obtain a low loss on a small subset of the dataset". ƒê√¢y l√† b∆∞·ªõc ƒë·∫ßu ti√™n h·ª£p l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra kh·∫£ nƒÉng h·ªçc c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.
Question 157 of 294
Question 158 (Single answer)
You are a data scientist at an industrial equipment manufacturing company. You are developing a regression model to estimate the power consumption in the company‚Äôs manufacturing plants based on sensor data collected from all of the plants. The sensors collect tens of millions of records every day. You need to schedule daily training runs for your model that use all the data collected up to the current date. You want your model to scale smoothly and require minimal development work. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi:

    • D: Ph√°t tri·ªÉn m√¥ h√¨nh PyTorch t√πy ch·ªânh c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu c√¥ng vi·ªác ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a.

Question 158 of 294
Question 159 (Single answer)
Your organization manages an online message board. A few months ago, you discovered an increase in toxic language and bullying on the message board. You deployed an automated text classifier that flags certain comments as toxic or harmful. Now some users are reporting that benign comments referencing their religion are being misclassified as abusive. Upon further inspection, you find that your classifier's false positive rate is higher for comments that reference certain underrepresented religious groups. Your team has a limited budget and is already overextended. What should you do?

    • A: Th√™m d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán t·ªïng h·ª£p c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p c·∫£i thi·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh, nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªën k√©m v√† kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ.
    • B: Lo·∫°i b·ªè m√¥ h√¨nh v√† thay th·∫ø b·∫±ng ki·ªÉm duy·ªát th·ªß c√¥ng c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng kh·∫£ thi do h·∫°n ch·∫ø v·ªÅ ngu·ªìn l·ª±c.
    • C: Thay th·∫ø m√¥ h√¨nh b·∫±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh kh√°c c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt ƒë∆∞·ª£c v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ g·ªëc r·ªÖ v√† c≈©ng t·ªën k√©m.

Question 159 of 294
Question 160 (Single answer)
You work for a magazine distributor and need to build a model that predicts which customers will renew their subscriptions for the upcoming year. Using your company‚Äôs historical data as your training set, you created a TensorFlow model and deployed it to Vertex AI. You need to determine which customer attribute has the most predictive power for each prediction served by the
model. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh thu·ªôc t√≠nh kh√°ch h√†ng n√†o c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t cho m·ªói d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë∆∞·ª£c ph·ª•c v·ª• b·ªüi m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n Vertex AI. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n Vertex AI. - C·∫ßn x√°c ƒë·ªãnh thu·ªôc t√≠nh kh√°ch h√†ng c√≥ s·ª©c m·∫°nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n l·ªõn nh·∫•t. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠ c·ªßa c√¥ng ty l√†m t·∫≠p hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh h·ªá s·ªë t∆∞∆°ng quan Pearson gi·ªØa t·ª´ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v√† bi·∫øn m·ª•c ti√™u. M·∫∑c d√π h·ªØu √≠ch trong vi·ªác ch·ªçn l·ªçc ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin chi ti·∫øt cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng c·ª• What-If ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh khi lo·∫°i b·ªè t·ª´ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p ƒë√°nh gi√° t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng c·ª• th·ªÉ cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Th·∫•p - B: Cao - C: Trung b√¨nh - D: Trung b√¨nh
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B v√¨ Vertex Explainable AI v·ªõi ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p Shapley cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin chi ti·∫øt v·ªÅ s·ª± ƒë√≥ng g√≥p c·ªßa t·ª´ng ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng cho m·ªói d·ª± ƒëo√°n, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
Question 160 of 294
Question 161 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a manufacturing company. You are creating a classification model for a predictive maintenance use case. You need to predict whether a crucial machine will fail in the next three days so that the repair crew has enough time to fix the machine before it breaks. Regular maintenance of the machine is relatively inexpensive, but a failure would be very costly. You have trained several binary classifiers to predict whether the machine will fail, where a prediction of 1 means that the ML model predicts a failure.
You are now evaluating each model on an evaluation dataset. You want to choose a model that prioritizes detection while ensuring that more than of the maintenance jobs triggered by your model address an imminent machine failure. Which model should you choose?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • N·ªôi dung y√™u c·∫ßu: Ch·ªçn m√¥ h√¨nh ∆∞u ti√™n ph√°t hi·ªán (detection) v√† ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng h∆°n m·ªôt n·ª≠a c√°c c√¥ng vi·ªác b·∫£o tr√¨ ƒë∆∞·ª£c k√≠ch ho·∫°t b·ªüi m√¥ h√¨nh l√† ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω s·ª± c·ªë m√°y m√≥c s·∫Øp x·∫£y ra.
    • S·ªë l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng: 1
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn ∆∞u ti√™n ph√°t hi·ªán, t·ª©c l√† c·∫ßn c√≥ recall cao.
    • ƒê·∫£m b·∫£o h∆°n m·ªôt n·ª≠a c√¥ng vi·ªác b·∫£o tr√¨ l√† c·∫ßn thi·∫øt, t·ª©c l√† precision ph·∫£i l·ªõn h∆°n 0.5.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: AUC ROC cao v√† precision > 0.5. AUC ROC cao l√† t·ªët nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o recall cao.
    • B: RMSE th·∫•p v√† recall > 0.5. RMSE kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i, recall > 0.5 l√† c·∫ßn thi·∫øt nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß.
    • C: Recall cao nh·∫•t v·ªõi precision > 0.5. ƒê√°p ·ª©ng c·∫£ hai y√™u c·∫ßu: ∆∞u ti√™n ph√°t hi·ªán v√† precision > 0.5.
    • D: Precision cao nh·∫•t v·ªõi recall > 0.5. ∆Øu ti√™n precision kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ∆∞u ti√™n ph√°t hi·ªán.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o recall cao.
    • B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ RMSE kh√¥ng li√™n quan.
    • C: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng c·∫£ hai y√™u c·∫ßu.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ ∆∞u ti√™n precision.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
    • ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 161 of 294
Question 162 (Single answer)
You built a custom ML model using scikit-learn. Training time is taking longer than expected. You decide to migrate your model to Vertex AI Training, and you want to improve the model‚Äôs training time. What should you try out first?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n cho c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch c·∫£i thi·ªán th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ML t√πy ch·ªânh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c x√¢y d·ª±ng b·∫±ng scikit-learn khi chuy·ªÉn sang Vertex AI Training. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.

Question 162 of 294
Question 163 (Single answer)
You are an ML engineer at a retail company. You have built a model that predicts a coupon to offer an ecommerce customer at checkout based on the items in their cart. When a customer goes to checkout, your serving pipeline, which is hosted on Google Cloud, joins the customer's existing cart with a row in a BigQuery table that contains the customers' historic purchase behavior and uses that as the model's input. The web team is reporting that your model is returning predictions too slowly to load the coupon offer with the rest of the web page. How should you speed up your model's predictions?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

Question 163 of 294
Question 164 (Single answer)
You work for a small company that has deployed an ML model with autoscaling on Vertex AI to serve online predictions in a production environment. The current model receives about 20 prediction requests per hour with an average response time of one second. You have retrained the same model on a new batch of data, and now you are canary testing it, sending ~ of production traffic to the new model. During this canary test, you notice that prediction requests for your new model are taking between 30 and 180 seconds to complete. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. Question 164 of 294
Question 165 (Single answer)
You want to train an AutoML model to predict house prices by using a small public dataset stored in BigQuery. You need to prepare the data and want to use the simplest, most efficient approach. What should you do?

1. Question 165 of 294
Question 166 (Single answer)
You developed a Vertex AI ML pipeline that consists of preprocessing and training steps and each set of steps runs on a separate custom Docker image. Your organization uses GitHub and GitHub Actions as CI/CD to run unit and integration tests. You need to automate the model retraining workflow so that it can be initiated both manually and when a new version of the code is merged in the main branch. You want to minimize the steps required to build the workflow while also allowing for maximum flexibility. How should you configure the CI/CD workflow?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n c·∫•u h√¨nh workflow CI/CD ƒë·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a quy tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh. Workflow c·∫ßn ƒë∆∞·ª£c k√≠ch ho·∫°t th·ªß c√¥ng v√† khi c√≥ phi√™n b·∫£n m·ªõi c·ªßa m√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c h·ª£p nh·∫•t v√†o nh√°nh ch√≠nh. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√°c b∆∞·ªõc c·∫ßn thi·∫øt ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng workflow, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi cho ph√©p linh ho·∫°t t·ªëi ƒëa. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: s·ª≠ d·ª•ng GitHub Actions cho CI/CD, t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a quy tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh, k√≠ch ho·∫°t th·ªß c√¥ng v√† khi c√≥ m√£ m·ªõi, t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√°c b∆∞·ªõc v√† t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a t√≠nh linh ho·∫°t.

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Build ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y c√°c b∆∞·ªõc, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác t√≠ch h·ª£p v·ªõi GitHub Actions.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Run ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng Docker images, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng ph·ªï bi·∫øn v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  • C: Kh√¥ng c√≥ b∆∞·ªõc x√¢y d·ª±ng Docker images trong GitHub Actions, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t√≠nh linh ho·∫°t t·ªëi ƒëa.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng GitHub Actions ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y c√°c b√†i ki·ªÉm tra v√† Cloud Build ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng Docker images, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác t√≠ch h·ª£p v√† linh ho·∫°t.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng GitHub Actions ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra v√† Cloud Build cho vi·ªác x√¢y d·ª±ng, ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët v√† linh ho·∫°t.

B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi

C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† D.

Question 166 of 294
Question 167 (Single answer)
You are working with a dataset that contains customer transactions. You need to build an ML model to predict customer purchase behavior. You plan to develop the model in BigQuery ML, and export it to Cloud Storage for online prediction. You notice that the input data contains a few categorical features, including product category and payment method. You want to deploy the model as quickly as possible. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†nh vi mua h√†ng c·ªßa kh√°ch h√†ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh nhanh ch√≥ng. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
  • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh.
  • D·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·∫ßu v√†o c√≥ ch·ª©a c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i (categorical features).
  • Tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh nhanh ch√≥ng.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TRANSFORM clause v·ªõi ML.ONE_HOT_ENCODER c√≥ th·ªÉ l√† m·ªôt c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n t·ªët, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch nhanh nh·∫•t v√¨ c·∫ßn th√™m b∆∞·ªõc TRANSFORM.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ML.ONE_HOT_ENCODER tr·ª±c ti·∫øp tr√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√† ch·ªçn c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë√£ m√£ h√≥a c√πng v·ªõi c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n nhanh ch√≥ng v√† ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu.
  • C: Ch·ªâ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng CREATE MODEL m√† kh√¥ng m√£ h√≥a c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn m√¥ h√¨nh kh√¥ng ch√≠nh x√°c.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ML.MULTI_HOT_ENCODER kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p trong y√™u c·∫ßu v√† th∆∞·ªùng kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng cho c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch nhanh nh·∫•t.
  • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß y√™u c·∫ßu v√† nhanh ch√≥ng.
  • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do thi·∫øu b∆∞·ªõc m√£ h√≥a c·∫ßn thi·∫øt.
  • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 167 of 294
Question 168 (Single answer)
You need to develop an image classification model by using a large dataset that contains labeled images in a Cloud Storage bucket. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

- L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Pipelines v·ªõi TensorFlow Extended (TFX) ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o m·ªôt pipeline ƒë·ªçc h√¨nh ·∫£nh t·ª´ Cloud Storage v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Nh·∫≠p c√°c h√¨nh ·∫£nh ƒë√£ g√°n nh√£n nh∆∞ m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c qu·∫£n l√Ω trong Vertex AI v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh. AutoML l√† m·ªôt c√¥ng c·ª• t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a m·∫°nh m·∫Ω, d·ªÖ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng kh√¥ng chuy√™n s√¢u.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu h√¨nh ·∫£nh sang ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng b·∫£ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Dataflow, t·∫£i d·ªØ li·ªáu v√†o BigQuery v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh.

4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

Question 168 of 294
Question 169 (Single answer)
You are developing a model to detect fraudulent credit card transactions. Question 169 of 294
Question 170 (Single answer)
You need to deploy a scikit-leam classification model to production. The model must be able to serve requests 24/7, and you expect millions of requests per second to the production application from 8 am to 7 pm. You need to minimize the cost of deployment. What should you do?

Question 170 of 294
Question 171 (Single answer)
You work with a team of researchers to develop state-of-the-art algorithms for financial analysis. Your team develops and debugs complex models in TensorFlow. You want to maintain the ease of debugging while also reducing the model training time. How should you set up your training environment?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt l·∫≠p m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë·ªÉ duy tr√¨ s·ª± d·ªÖ d√†ng trong vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói v√† ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:

    • Duy tr√¨ s·ª± d·ªÖ d√†ng trong vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói.
    • Gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU VM c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng d·ªÖ d√†ng cho vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói nh∆∞ GPU.
    • B: T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ A, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU node c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng ParameterServerStrategy c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói v√† kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªëi ƒëa kh·∫£ nƒÉng c·ªßa GPU.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy v·ªõi GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† v·∫´n duy tr√¨ s·ª± d·ªÖ d√†ng trong vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác g·ª° l·ªói.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng c·∫£ hai y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 171 of 294
Question 172 (Single answer)
You created an ML pipeline with multiple input parameters. You want to investigate the tradeoffs between different parameter combinations. The parameter options are ‚Ä¢ Input dataset ‚Ä¢ Max tree depth of the boosted tree regressor ‚Ä¢ Optimizer learning rate
You need to compare the pipeline performance of the different parameter combinations measured in F1 score, time to train, and model complexity. You want your approach to be reproducible, and track all pipeline runs on the same platform. What should you do?

Question 172 of 294
Question 173 (Single answer)
You received a training-serving skew alert from a Vertex AI Model Monitoring job running in production. You retrained the model with more recent training data, and deployed it back to the Vertex AI endpoint, but you are still receiving the same alert. What should you do?

Question 173 of 294
Question 174 (Single answer)
You developed a custom model by using Vertex AI to forecast the sales of your company‚Äôs products based on historical transactional data. Question 174 of 294
Question 175 (Single answer)
You have recently trained a scikit-learn model that you plan to deploy on Vertex AI. This model will support both online and batch prediction. You need to preprocess input data for model inference. You want to package the model for deployment while minimizing additional code. What should you do?
B Other
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi:

Question 175 of 294
Question 176 (Single answer)
You work for a food product company. Your company‚Äôs historical sales data is stored in BigQuery.You need to use Vertex AI‚Äôs custom training service to train multiple TensorFlow models that read the data from BigQuery and predict future sales. You plan to implement a data preprocessing algorithm that performs mm-max scaling and bucketing on a large number of features before you start experimenting with the models.   2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI, hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow, d·ªØ li·ªáu t·ª´ BigQuery, ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu v·ªõi mm-max scaling v√† bucketing, v√† m·ª•c ti√™u gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu th·ªùi gian, chi ph√≠, c√¥ng s·ª©c.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

    • B: Vi·∫øt truy v·∫•n SQL ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu tr·ª±c ti·∫øp trong BigQuery l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n, hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† th·ªùi gian, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.

Question 176 of 294
Question 177 (Single answer)
You have created a Vertex AI pipeline that includes two steps. The first step preprocesses 10 TB data completes in about 1 hour, and saves the result in a Cloud Storage bucket. The second step uses the processed data to train a model. You need to update the model‚Äôs code to allow you to test different algorithms. You want to reduce pipeline execution time and cost while also minimizing pipeline changes. What should you do?

Question 177 of 294
Question 178 (Single answer)
You work for a bank. You have created a custom model to predict whether a loan application should be flagged for human review. The input features are stored in a BigQuery table. The model is performing well, and you plan to deploy it to production. Due to compliance requirements the model must provide explanations for each prediction. Question 178 of 294
Question 179 (Single answer)

Question 179 of 294
Question 180 (Single answer)
You recently deployed a pipeline in Vertex AI Pipelines that trains and pushes a model to a Vertex AI endpoint to serve real-time traffic. Question 180 of 294
Question 181 (Single answer)
You work for a bank with strict data governance requirements. You recently implemented a custom model to detect fraudulent transactions. You want your training code to download internal data by using an API endpoint hosted in your project‚Äôs network. You need the data to be accessed in the most secure way, while mitigating the risk of data exfiltration. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

Question 181 of 294
Question 182 (Single answer)
You are deploying a new version of a model to a production Vertex Al endpoint that is serving traffic. You plan to direct all user traffic to the new model. You need to deploy the model with minimal disruption to your application. What should you do?

Question 182 of 294
Question 183 (Single answer)
You are training an ML model on a large dataset. You are using a TPU to accelerate the training process. You notice that the training process is taking longer than expected. You discover that the TPU is not reaching its full capacity. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ƒë·ªÉ TPU ƒë·∫°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c hi·ªáu su·∫•t t·ªëi ƒëa khi qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ML ƒëang di·ªÖn ra ch·∫≠m h∆°n d·ª± ki·∫øn. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU ƒë·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† vi·ªác TPU kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°t ƒë∆∞·ª£c c√¥ng su·∫•t t·ªëi ƒëa.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: TƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc (learning rate): TƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m cho m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªôi t·ª• nhanh h∆°n nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng nh·∫•t thi·∫øt l√†m tƒÉng hi·ªáu su·∫•t s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU.
  • B: TƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng epochs: TƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng epochs ch·ªâ k√©o d√†i qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√† kh√¥ng c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t TPU.
  • C: Gi·∫£m t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc (learning rate): Gi·∫£m t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m cho m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªôi t·ª• ch·∫≠m h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t TPU.
  • D: TƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch (batch size): TƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p TPU x·ª≠ l√Ω nhi·ªÅu d·ªØ li·ªáu h∆°n trong m·ªôt l·∫ßn, do ƒë√≥ c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU.

5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D: TƒÉng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch.
Question 183 of 294
Question 184 (Single answer)
You work for a retail company. You have a managed tabular dataset in Vertex AI that contains sales data from three different stores. The dataset includes several features, such as store name and sale timestamp. You want to use the data to train a model that makes sales predictions for a new store that will open soon. You need to split the data between the training, validation, and test sets. What approach should you use to split the data?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi:

    • C: Chia theo th·ªùi gian (chronological split) s·∫Ω gi√∫p m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªçc ƒë∆∞·ª£c xu h∆∞·ªõng theo th·ªùi gian, ph√π h·ª£p cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n t∆∞∆°ng lai.

Question 184 of 294
Question 185 (Single answer)
You have developed a BigQuery ML model that predicts customer chum, and deployed the model to Vertex AI Endpoints. You want to automate the retraining of your model by using minimal additional code when model feature values change. You also want to minimize the number of times that your model is retrained to reduce training costs. What should you do?
3. Use a Cloud Function to monitor the Pub/Sub queue, and trigger retraining in BigQuery
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi:
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n t√¨m c√°ch t·ª± ƒë·ªông hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh BigQuery ML khi gi√° tr·ªã ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh thay ƒë·ªïi, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu s·ªë l·∫ßn hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i ƒë·ªÉ ti·∫øt ki·ªám chi ph√≠. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B: T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ A, nh∆∞ng t·∫≠p trung v√†o "training/serving skew". C≈©ng kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn Pub/Sub ho·∫∑c Cloud Function.
  • C: ƒê·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác t·∫°o c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t "prediction drift" v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Pub/Sub c√πng Cloud Function ƒë·ªÉ k√≠ch ho·∫°t hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a.
  • D: T·∫≠p trung v√†o "training/serving skew" v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Pub/Sub ƒë·ªÉ k√≠ch ho·∫°t hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Function ƒë·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a ho√†n to√†n.
4. Question 185 of 294
Question 186 (Single answer)
You have been tasked with deploying prototype code to production. The feature engineering code is in PySpark and runs on Dataproc Serverless. The model training is executed by using a Vertex AI custom training job. The two steps are not connected, and the model training must currently be run manually after the feature engineering step finishes. You need to create a scalable and maintainable production process that runs end-to-end and tracks the connections between steps. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t·∫°o ra m·ªôt quy tr√¨nh s·∫£n xu·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ m·ªü r·ªông v√† d·ªÖ b·∫£o tr√¨, ch·∫°y t·ª´ ƒë·∫ßu ƒë·∫øn cu·ªëi v√† theo d√µi c√°c k·∫øt n·ªëi gi·ªØa c√°c b∆∞·ªõc. C√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng c·∫ßn ch·ªçn.
2. 3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

Question 186 of 294
Question 187 (Single answer)
You recently deployed a scikit-learn model to a Vertex AI endpoint. You are now testing the model on live production traffic. While monitoring the endpoint, you discover twice as many requests per hour than expected throughout the day. You want the endpoint to efficiently scale when the demand increases in the future to prevent users from experiencing high latency. What should you do?

Question 187 of 294
Question 188 (Single answer)
You work at a bank. You have a custom tabular ML model that was provided by the bank‚Äôs vendor. The training data is not available due to its sensitivity. Question 188 of 294
Question 189 (Single answer)
You are implementing a batch inference ML pipeline in Google Cloud. The model was developed using TensorFlow and is stored in SavedModel format in Cloud Storage. You need to apply the model to a historical dataset containing 10 TB of data that is stored in a BigQuery table. How should you perform the inference?

  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points:

    • D·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠ 10 TB n·∫±m trong b·∫£ng BigQuery.

    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¢u l·ªánh CREATE MODEL trong BigQuery ML ƒë·ªÉ nh·∫≠p m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow v√† √°p d·ª•ng d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªãch s·ª≠. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch t·∫≠n d·ª•ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp kh·∫£ nƒÉng c·ªßa BigQuery ML ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán inference m√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn xu·∫•t d·ªØ li·ªáu ra ngo√†i.

    • D: C·∫•u h√¨nh m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t c·ªßa Vertex AI ƒë·ªÉ √°p d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh l√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu trong BigQuery. Tuy nhi√™n, Vertex AI kh√¥ng h·ªó tr·ª£ tr·ª±c ti·∫øp vi·ªác √°p d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh TensorFlow t·ª´ BigQuery m√† kh√¥ng qua b∆∞·ªõc trung gian.

Question 189 of 294
Question 190 (Single answer)
You recently deployed a model to a Vertex AI endpoint. Your data drifts frequently, so you have enabled request-response logging and created a Vertex AI Model Monitoring job. You have observed that your model is receiving higher traffic than expected. You need to reduce the model monitoring cost while continuing to quickly detect drift. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi:
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ gi√°m s√°t m√¥ h√¨nh trong khi v·∫´n nhanh ch√≥ng ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu (drift). B·∫°n c·∫ßn ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- ƒê√£ tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh tr√™n Vertex AI endpoint.
- D·ªØ li·ªáu th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n thay ƒë·ªïi (data drift).
- ƒê√£ b·∫≠t ghi nh·∫≠t k√Ω y√™u c·∫ßu-ph·∫£n h·ªìi v√† t·∫°o c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t m√¥ h√¨nh.
- L∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng truy c·∫≠p cao h∆°n d·ª± ki·∫øn.
- C·∫ßn gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ gi√°m s√°t nh∆∞ng v·∫´n ph√°t hi·ªán nhanh s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
A. Thay th·∫ø c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t b·∫±ng m·ªôt pipeline DataFlow s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow Data Validation (TFD): Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ vi·ªác thay th·∫ø ho√†n to√†n c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o gi·∫£m chi ph√≠.
B. Thay th·∫ø c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t b·∫±ng m·ªôt script SQL t√πy ch·ªânh ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ tr√™n c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n trong BigQuery: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ vi·ªác n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ v√† kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o ph√°t hi·ªán nhanh s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi.
C. Gi·∫£m tham s·ªë sample_rate trong RandomSampleConfig c·ªßa c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ gi·∫£m t·ª∑ l·ªá m·∫´u s·∫Ω gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ gi√°m s√°t trong khi v·∫´n duy tr√¨ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi.
D. TƒÉng tham s·ªë monitor_interval trong ScheduleConfig c·ªßa c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t: Ph√π h·ª£p m·ªôt ph·∫ßn v√¨ tƒÉng kho·∫£ng th·ªùi gian gi√°m s√°t c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m ch·∫≠m ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
A: Th·∫•p
B: Th·∫•p
C: Cao
D: Trung b√¨nh
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
C. Gi·∫£m tham s·ªë sample_rate trong RandomSampleConfig c·ªßa c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t.
Question 190 of 294
Question 191 (Single answer)
You work for a retail company. You have created a Vertex AI forecast model that produces monthly item sales predictions. You want to quickly create a report that will help to explain how the model calculates the predictions. You have one month of recent actual sales data that was not included in the training dataset. Question 192 (Single answer)

Question 192 of 294
Question 193 (Single answer)

Question 194 (Single answer)

Question 194 of 294
Question 195 (Single answer)
You work for a retail company. You have been asked to develop a model to predict whether a customer will purchase a product on a given day. Your team has processed the company‚Äôs sales data, and created a table with the following rows: ‚Ä¢ Customer_id ‚Ä¢ Product_id ‚Ä¢ Date ‚Ä¢ Days_since_last_purchase (measured in days) ‚Ä¢ Average_purchase_frequency (measured in 1/days) ‚Ä¢ Purchase (binary class, if customer purchased product on the Date)
You need to interpret your model‚Äôs results for each individual prediction. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ph√°t tri·ªÉn m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n li·ªáu kh√°ch h√†ng c√≥ mua s·∫£n ph·∫©m v√†o m·ªôt ng√†y c·ª• th·ªÉ hay kh√¥ng. B·∫°n c·∫ßn gi·∫£i th√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√° nh√¢n. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh c·∫ßn d·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng mua h√†ng c·ªßa kh√°ch h√†ng. - C·∫ßn gi·∫£i th√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£ d·ª± ƒëo√°n cho t·ª´ng kh√°ch h√†ng. - D·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c x·ª≠ l√Ω v√† c√≥ c√°c thu·ªôc t√≠nh nh∆∞ Customer_id, Product_id, Date, Days_since_last_purchase, Average_purchase_frequency, v√† Purchase.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML v·ªõi c√¢y quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p hi·ªÉu c√°ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒë∆∞·ª£c th·ª±c hi·ªán, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI v·ªõi AutoML v√† t√≠nh nƒÉng gi·∫£i th√≠ch (feature attributions) l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√° nh√¢n. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng h·ªìi quy logistic trong BigQuery ML c√≥ th·ªÉ cho bi·∫øt t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng L1 regularization ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng kh√¥ng th√¥ng tin kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n. - B: Cao, v√¨ cung c·∫•p gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt cho t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n th√¥ng qua feature attributions. - C: Trung b√¨nh, v√¨ ch·ªâ cung c·∫•p t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng m√† kh√¥ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch t·ª´ng d·ª± ƒëo√°n. - D: Th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 195 of 294
Question 196 (Single answer)
You work for a company that captures live video footage of checkout areas in their retail stores. You need to use the live video footage to build a model to detect the number of customers waiting for service in near real time. You want to implement a solution quickly and with minimal effort. How should you build the model?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:

    • B: Trung b√¨nh - C√≥ th·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u.
    • C: Th·∫•p - Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu nhanh ch√≥ng v√† √≠t n·ªó l·ª±c.

Question 196 of 294
Question 197 (Single answer)
You work as an analyst at a large banking firm. You are developing a robust scalable ML pipeline to tram several regression and classification models. Your primary focus for the pipeline is model interpretability. You want to productionize the pipeline as quickly as possible. What should you do?

Question 197 of 294
Question 198 (Single answer)

Question 198 of 294
Question 199 (Single answer)
You are developing a process for training and running your custom model in production. You need to be able to show lineage for your model and predictions. What should you do?
3. Generate batch predictions in Vertex AI. B. 1. Use a Vertex AI Pipelines custom training job component to tram your model. 2. Generate predictions by using a Vertex AI Pipelines model batch predict component. C. 1. Upload your dataset to BigQuery. 2. Use a Vertex AI custom training job to train your model. 3. Generate predictions by using Vertex Al SDK custom prediction routines. D. 1. Use Vertex AI Experiments to train your model. 2. Register your model in Vertex AI Model Registry. 3. Generate batch predictions in Vertex AI.
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ph√°t tri·ªÉn m·ªôt quy tr√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† ch·∫°y m√¥ h√¨nh t√πy ch·ªânh trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng s·∫£n xu·∫•t, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi c·∫ßn c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc (lineage) c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: "quy tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† ch·∫°y m√¥ h√¨nh", "hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n", v√† "s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI".
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: T·∫°o m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c qu·∫£n l√Ω b·ªüi Vertex AI v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng pipeline hu·∫•n luy·ªán c·ªßa Vertex AI. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng th√†nh ph·∫ßn c√¥ng vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán t√πy ch·ªânh c·ªßa Vertex AI Pipelines v√† th√†nh ph·∫ßn d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng r√µ r√†ng b·∫±ng ph∆∞∆°ng √°n D.
  • C: T·∫£i d·ªØ li·ªáu l√™n BigQuery, s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán t√πy ch·ªânh c·ªßa Vertex AI v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n b·∫±ng SDK. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p r√µ r√†ng ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Experiments ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh, ƒëƒÉng k√Ω m√¥ h√¨nh trong Vertex AI Model Registry v√† t·∫°o d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng lo·∫°t. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y r√µ r√†ng nh·∫•t v·ªÅ vi·ªác hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ bao g·ªìm c√°c b∆∞·ªõc r√µ r√†ng ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉn th·ªã ngu·ªìn g·ªëc c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n.

Question 199 of 294
Question 200 (Single answer)
You work for a hotel and have a dataset that contains customers‚Äô written comments scanned from paper-based customer feedback forms, which are stored as PDF files. Every form has the same layout. You need to quickly predict an overall satisfaction score from the customer comments on each form. How should you accomplish this task?

X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n d·ª± ƒëo√°n ƒëi·ªÉm h√†i l√≤ng t·ªïng th·ªÉ t·ª´ c√°c b√¨nh lu·∫≠n c·ªßa kh√°ch h√†ng tr√™n c√°c m·∫´u ph·∫£n h·ªìi d·∫°ng PDF. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ ƒë·ªãnh r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:

Question 200 of 294

Question 203 of 294
Question 204 (Single answer)

    • D: Hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ph√°t hi·ªán ƒë·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng trong Vertex AI custom training. Ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng c√≥ th·ªÉ m·∫•t nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian h∆°n do c·∫ßn c·∫•u h√¨nh v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán t·ª´ ƒë·∫ßu.

Question 204 of 294
Question 205 (Single answer)
You are analyzing customer data for a healthcare organization that is stored in Cloud Storage. The data contains personally identifiable information (PII). You need to perform data exploration and preprocessing while ensuring the security and privacy of sensitive fields. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n th·ª±c hi·ªán kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu kh√°ch h√†ng cho m·ªôt t·ªï ch·ª©c chƒÉm s√≥c s·ª©c kh·ªèe, trong ƒë√≥ d·ªØ li·ªáu ch·ª©a th√¥ng tin nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng c√° nh√¢n (PII). B·∫°n c·∫ßn ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o an ninh v√† b·∫£o m·∫≠t cho c√°c tr∆∞·ªùng nh·∫°y c·∫£m. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: d·ªØ li·ªáu ch·ª©a PII, c·∫ßn th·ª±c hi·ªán kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu, v√† ph·∫£i ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o an ninh v√† b·∫£o m·∫≠t cho d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) API ƒë·ªÉ lo·∫°i b·ªè th√¥ng tin nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng c√° nh√¢n tr∆∞·ªõc khi th·ª±c hi·ªán kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ DLP API ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø ƒë·ªÉ b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫°y c·∫£m b·∫±ng c√°ch che gi·∫•u ho·∫∑c lo·∫°i b·ªè th√¥ng tin nh·∫≠n d·∫°ng c√° nh√¢n.
  • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng kh√≥a m√£ h√≥a do kh√°ch h√†ng qu·∫£n l√Ω (CMEK) ƒë·ªÉ m√£ h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu PII khi l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† gi·∫£i m√£ khi kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω.   • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√°y ·∫£o trong m·ªôt v√†nh ƒëai b·∫£o m·∫≠t c·ªßa VPC Service Controls ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu. M·∫∑c d√π ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng c∆∞·ªùng b·∫£o m·∫≠t m·∫°ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu PII c·ª• th·ªÉ.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng kh√≥a m√£ h√≥a do Google qu·∫£n l√Ω ƒë·ªÉ m√£ h√≥a d·ªØ li·ªáu PII khi l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† gi·∫£i m√£ khi kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± nh∆∞ B, ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ b·∫£o v·ªá d·ªØ li·ªáu khi kh√°m ph√° v√† ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω.

Question 205 of 294
Question 206 (Single answer)
You are building a predictive maintenance model to preemptively detect part defects in bridges. You plan to use high definition images of the bridges as model inputs. Question 206 of 294
Question 207 (Single answer)
You work for a hospital that wants to optimize how it schedules operations. You need to create a model that uses the relationship between the number of surgeries scheduled and beds used. Question 207 of 294
Question 208 (Single answer)
You recently developed a wide and deep model in TensorFlow. You generated training datasets using a SQL script that preprocessed raw data in BigQuery by performing instance-level transformations of the data. Question 208 of 294
Question 209 (Single answer)
You are training a custom language model for your company using a large dataset. You plan to use the Reduction Server strategy on Vertex AI. You need to configure the worker pools of the distributed training job. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu c·∫•u h√¨nh c√°c worker pools cho m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác ƒë√†o t·∫°o ph√¢n t√°n tr√™n Vertex AI s·ª≠ d·ª•ng chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c Reduction Server. C·∫ßn ch·ªçn c·∫•u h√¨nh ph√π h·ª£p cho c√°c worker pools.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- ƒê√†o t·∫°o m√¥ h√¨nh ng√¥n ng·ªØ t√πy ch·ªânh v·ªõi dataset l·ªõn.
- S·ª≠ d·ª•ng chi·∫øn l∆∞·ª£c Reduction Server tr√™n Vertex AI.
- C·∫ßn c·∫•u h√¨nh worker pools cho c√¥ng vi·ªác ƒë√†o t·∫°o ph√¢n t√°n.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- ƒê√°p √°n A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng GPU cho c·∫£ ba worker pools, trong ƒë√≥ pool th·ª© ba d√πng reductionserver container image. Kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v√¨ pool th·ª© ba kh√¥ng c·∫ßn GPU m√† c·∫ßn ∆∞u ti√™n bƒÉng th√¥ng.
- ƒê√°p √°n B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng GPU cho hai worker pools ƒë·∫ßu, pool th·ª© ba d√πng reductionserver container image kh√¥ng c√≥ GPU, ∆∞u ti√™n bƒÉng th√¥ng. Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi ∆∞u bƒÉng th√¥ng cho pool th·ª© ba.
- ƒê√°p √°n C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU cho hai worker pools ƒë·∫ßu, pool th·ª© ba kh√¥ng c√≥ tƒÉng t·ªëc, d√πng reductionserver container image kh√¥ng c√≥ tƒÉng t·ªëc, ∆∞u ti√™n bƒÉng th√¥ng. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng GPU.
- ƒê√°p √°n D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU cho c·∫£ ba pools, pool th·ª© ba d√πng reductionserver container image. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ pool th·ª© ba kh√¥ng c·∫ßn TPU m√† c·∫ßn ∆∞u ti√™n bƒÉng th√¥ng.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- ƒê√°p √°n A: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
- ƒê√°p √°n B: ƒê√∫ng.
- ƒê√°p √°n C: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
- ƒê√°p √°n D: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:
ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 209 of 294
Question 210 (Single answer)
You have trained a model by using data that was preprocessed in a batch Dataflow pipeline. Your use case requires real-time inference. You want to ensure that the data preprocessing logic is applied consistently between training and serving. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng logic ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c √°p d·ª•ng nh·∫•t qu√°n gi·ªØa qu√° tr√¨nh hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† ph·ª•c v·ª• m√¥ h√¨nh. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Ch·ªâ ki·ªÉm tra ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·∫ßu v√†o, kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o logic ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω nh·∫•t qu√°n. - B: T√°i c·∫•u tr√∫c m√£ chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ngo√†i pipeline v√† d√πng c√πng m√£ cho endpoint, ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o t√≠nh nh·∫•t qu√°n. - C: Chia s·∫ª m√£ v·ªõi ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng cu·ªëi kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng m√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng nh·∫•t qu√°n trong endpoint. - D: X·ª≠ l√Ω theo l√¥ cho y√™u c·∫ßu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu suy lu·∫≠n th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.

Question 210 of 294
Question 211 (Single answer)

Question 211 of 294
Question 212 (Single answer)
You are pre-training a large language model on Google Cloud. This model includes custom TensorFlow operations in the training loop. Model training will use a large batch size, and you expect training to take several weeks. You need to configure a training architecture that minimizes both training time and compute costs. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • Hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ng√¥n ng·ªØ l·ªõn.
    • C√≥ c√°c ph√©p to√°n TensorFlow t√πy ch·ªânh trong v√≤ng l·∫∑p hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
    • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc batch l·ªõn.
    • Th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán d·ª± ki·∫øn k√©o d√†i v√†i tu·∫ßn.

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng 8 m√°y a2-megagpu-16g v·ªõi tf.distribute.MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß m·∫°nh cho m√¥ h√¨nh l·ªõn v√† th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán d√†i.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU Pod slice v·ªõi -accelerator-type = v4-l28 v√† tf.distribute.TPUStrategy l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn m·∫°nh m·∫Ω, t·ªëi ∆∞u cho m√¥ h√¨nh l·ªõn v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng 16 m√°y c2d-highcpu-32 v·ªõi tf.distribute.MirroredStrategy c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß GPU cho m√¥ h√¨nh l·ªõn.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng 16 m√°y a2-highgpu-8g v·ªõi tf.distribute.MultiWorkerMirroredStrategy c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªët nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u b·∫±ng TPU cho m√¥ h√¨nh l·ªõn.

Question 212 of 294
Question 213 (Single answer)
You are building a TensorFlow text-to-image generative model by using a dataset that contains billions of images with their respective captions. You want to create a low maintenance, automated workflow that reads the data from a Cloud Storage bucket collects statistics, splits the dataset into training/validation/test datasets performs data transformations trains the model using the training/validation datasets, and validates the model by using the test dataset. 1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

B·∫°n c·∫ßn ch·ªçn m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ tri·ªÉn khai quy tr√¨nh n√†y tr√™n GCP. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
- M√¥ h√¨nh sinh ·∫£nh t·ª´ vƒÉn b·∫£n b·∫±ng TensorFlow. - T·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn ch·ª©a h√†ng t·ª∑ h√¨nh ·∫£nh v√† ch√∫ th√≠ch. - Quy tr√¨nh t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a: ƒë·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu, thu th·∫≠p th·ªëng k√™, chia t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu, bi·∫øn ƒë·ªïi d·ªØ li·ªáu, hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† ƒë√°nh gi√° m√¥ h√¨nh. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªãch v·ª• Dataflow v√† Vertex AI. - Tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n GCP.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Apache Airflow v√† Cloud Composer c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a quy tr√¨nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác t√≠ch h·ª£p s√¢u v·ªõi TensorFlow v√† Vertex AI. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: MLFlow kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√¥ng c·ª• ch√≠nh cho vi·ªác x√¢y d·ª±ng pipeline tr√™n GCP v·ªõi TensorFlow v√† Vertex AI. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Kubeflow Pipelines l√† m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªët ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng pipeline, nh∆∞ng TFX l√† c√¥ng c·ª• chuy√™n bi·ªát h∆°n cho TensorFlow. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: TFX ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω pipeline cho TensorFlow, t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët v·ªõi Dataflow v√† Vertex AI.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho TensorFlow. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u b·∫±ng TFX. - L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao, TFX l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u cho y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi
L·ª±a ch·ªçn D l√† c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng v√¨ TFX l√† c√¥ng c·ª• t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng pipeline cho TensorFlow, t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët v·ªõi c√°c d·ªãch v·ª• GCP nh∆∞ Dataflow v√† Vertex AI.
Question 213 of 294
Question 214 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML pipeline using Vertex AI Pipelines. You want your pipeline to upload a new version of the XGBoost model to Vertex AI Model Registry and deploy it to Vertex AI Endpoints for online inference. You want to use the simplest approach. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i
ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn c√°ch ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ t·∫£i l√™n m·ªôt phi√™n b·∫£n m·ªõi c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh XGBoost l√™n Vertex AI Model Registry v√† tri·ªÉn khai n√≥ ƒë·∫øn Vertex AI Endpoints cho suy lu·∫≠n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points
C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Pipelines, t·∫£i l√™n m√¥ h√¨nh XGBoost, tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·∫øn Vertex AI Endpoints, v√† t√¨m c√°ch ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n nh·∫•t.
B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi

Question 214 of 294
Question 215 (Single answer)

Question 216 of 294
Question 217 (Single answer)
Your team frequently creates new ML models and runs experiments. Your team pushes code to a single repository hosted on Cloud Source Repositories. Question 217 of 294
Question 218 (Single answer)
You have built a custom model that performs several memory-intensive preprocessing tasks before it makes a prediction. You deployed the model to a Vertex AI endpoint, and validated that results were received in a reasonable amount of time. After routing user traffic to the endpoint, you discover that the endpoint does not autoscale as expected when receiving multiple requests. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi:

Question 218 of 294
Question 219 (Single answer)
Your company manages an ecommerce website. You developed an ML model that recommends additional products to users in near real time based on items currently in the user‚Äôs cart. The workflow will include the following processes:
1. The website will send a Pub/Sub message with the relevant data and then receive a message with the prediction from Pub/Sub 2. Predictions will be stored in BigQuery 3. The model will be stored in a Cloud Storage bucket and will be updated frequently

Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh ML c·∫ßn d·ª± ƒëo√°n s·∫£n ph·∫©m b·ªï sung cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng g·∫ßn nh∆∞ theo th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. - D·ª± ƒëo√°n c·∫ßn ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery. - M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong Cloud Storage v√† th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t. - C·∫ßn gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ d·ª± ƒëo√°n v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Function ƒë·ªÉ t·∫£i m√¥ h√¨nh v√†o b·ªô nh·ªõ c√≥ th·ªÉ g√¢y ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ cao do th·ªùi gian kh·ªüi t·∫°o. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Pipelines c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho y√™u c·∫ßu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI endpoint c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng RunInference API v·ªõi WatchFilePattern trong Dataflow c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªëi ∆∞u cho vi·ªác c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh v√† gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ cao. - B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho th·ªùi gian th·ª±c. - C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, t·ªët cho ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh. - D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao, t·ªëi ∆∞u cho c·∫£ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ v√† c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh.

Question 219 of 294
Question 220 (Single answer)

Question 220 of 294
Question 221 (Single answer)
You work at a leading healthcare firm developing state-of-the-art algorithms for various use cases. You have unstructured textual data with custom labels. You need to extract and classify various medical phrases with these labels. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

    • C: AutoML Entity Extraction cho ph√©p hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh tr√≠ch xu·∫•t th·ª±c th·ªÉ v·ªõi nh√£n t√πy ch·ªânh, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow ƒë·ªÉ x√¢y d·ª±ng m√¥ h√¨nh t√πy ch·ªânh c√≥ th·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ƒë∆∞·ª£c nh∆∞ng ƒë√≤i h·ªèi nhi·ªÅu th·ªùi gian v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c ph√°t tri·ªÉn.

Question 221 of 294
Question 222 (Single answer)
You developed a custom model by using Vertex AI to predict your application's user churn rate. You are using Vertex AI Model Monitoring for skew detection. The training data stored in BigQuery contains two sets of features - demographic and behavioral. Question 222 of 294
Question 223 (Single answer)

Question 223 of 294
Question 224 (Single answer)
You are building a MLOps platform to automate your company‚Äôs ML experiments and model retraining. You need to organize the artifacts for dozens of pipelines. How should you store the pipelines‚Äô artifacts?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n t√¨m c√°ch l∆∞u tr·ªØ c√°c artifacts c·ªßa c√°c pipeline trong m·ªôt n·ªÅn t·∫£ng MLOps. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng nh·∫•t.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√°c key points bao g·ªìm: "MLOps platform", "automate ML experiments", "model retraining", "organize artifacts", v√† "dozens of pipelines". ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y cho th·∫•y c·∫ßn m·ªôt gi·∫£i ph√°p l∆∞u tr·ªØ c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng qu·∫£n l√Ω t·ªët v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p v·ªõi c√°c c√¥ng c·ª• ML hi·ªán ƒë·∫°i.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: L∆∞u tr·ªØ tham s·ªë trong Cloud SQL v√† m√£ ngu·ªìn, binary c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh trong GitHub kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† c√°ch t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë·ªÉ qu·∫£n l√Ω artifacts c·ªßa ML pipelines, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát khi c·∫ßn t√≠ch h·ª£p v√† theo d√µi chi ti·∫øt.

Question 224 of 294
Question 225 (Single answer)
You work for a telecommunications company. You‚Äôre building a model to predict which customers may fail to pay their next phone bill. The purpose of this model is to proactively offer at-risk customers assistance such as service discounts and bill deadline extensions. The data is stored in BigQuery and the predictive features that are available for model training include:
- Customer_id - Age - Salary (measured in local currency) - Sex - Average bill value (measured in local currency) - Number of phone calls in the last month (integer) - Average duration of phone calls (measured in minutes)
You need to investigate and mitigate potential bias against disadvantaged groups, while preserving model accuracy.
What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch chi ti·∫øt c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

Question 225 of 294
Question 226 (Single answer)

Question 226 of 294
Question 227 (Single answer)
You work at a bank. You need to develop a credit risk model to support loan application decisions. You decide to implement the model by using a neural network in TensorFlow. Due to regulatory requirements, you need to be able to explain the model‚Äôs predictions based on its features. When the model is deployed, you also want to monitor the model‚Äôs performance over time. You decided to use Vertex AI for both model development and deployment. What should you do?

Question 227 of 294
Question 228 (Single answer)
You are investigating the root cause of a misclassification error made by one of your models. You used Vertex AI Pipelines to train and deploy the model. The pipeline reads data from BigQuery. creates a copy of the data in Cloud Storage in TFRecord format, trains the model in Vertex AI Training on that copy, and deploys the model to a Vertex AI endpoint. You have identified the specific version of that model that misclassified, and you need to recover the data this model was trained on. How should you find that copy of the data?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch kh√¥i ph·ª•c d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán. C√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng c·∫ßn t√¨m.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh b·ªã l·ªói ph√¢n lo·∫°i sai.
    • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Pipelines ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh.
    • D·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªçc t·ª´ BigQuery v√† sao ch√©p sang Cloud Storage d∆∞·ªõi ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng TFRecord.
    • C·∫ßn t√¨m b·∫£n sao d·ªØ li·ªáu m√† m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Vertex AI Feature Store kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p trong quy tr√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i, do ƒë√≥ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng t√≠nh nƒÉng lineage c·ªßa Vertex AI Metadata ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m artifact c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh v√† x√°c ƒë·ªãnh b∆∞·ªõc t·∫°o b·∫£n sao d·ªØ li·ªáu l√† h·ª£p l√Ω v√† ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng logging ƒë·ªÉ t√¨m timestamp v√† pipeline run c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp nh∆∞ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng metadata.
    • D: T√¨m ki·∫øm trong logs c·ªßa job ID c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng cung c·∫•p th√¥ng tin ch√≠nh x√°c v·ªÅ b·∫£n sao d·ªØ li·ªáu.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
    • B: ƒê√∫ng.
    • C: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 228 of 294
Question 229 (Single answer)
You work for a manufacturing company. You need to train a custom image classification model to detect product defects at the end of an assembly line. Although your model is performing well, some images in your holdout set are consistently mislabeled with high confidence. You want to use Vertex AI to understand your model‚Äôs results. Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉu r√µ h∆°n v·ªÅ k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh t√πy ch·ªânh, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát l√† nh·ªØng h√¨nh ·∫£nh b·ªã g√°n nh√£n sai v·ªõi ƒë·ªô tin c·∫≠y cao. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh t√πy ch·ªânh. - H√¨nh ·∫£nh b·ªã g√°n nh√£n sai v·ªõi ƒë·ªô tin c·∫≠y cao. - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n t√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Integrated Gradients ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª±a tr√™n ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, v·ªõi lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh l√† PIXELS v√† clip_percent_upperbound l√† 95. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉu r√µ h∆°n v·ªÅ c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Matching Engine ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o ch·ªâ m·ª•c v√† truy v·∫•n v·ªõi c√°c h√¨nh ·∫£nh b·ªã g√°n nh√£n sai. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p n√†y kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i th√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng XRAI ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª±a tr√™n ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, v·ªõi lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh l√† OUTLINES v√† polarity l√† positive. ƒê√¢y c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi·∫£i th√≠ch, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·ªï bi·∫øn b·∫±ng Integrated Gradients trong ng·ªØ c·∫£nh n√†y. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng gi·∫£i th√≠ch d·ª±a tr√™n v√≠ d·ª• v·ªõi l·ªõp ƒë·∫ßu ra nh√∫ng cho bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn kh√¥ng gian ti·ªÅm ·∫©n. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Cao, v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Integrated Gradients l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£ ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. - B: Th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác gi·∫£i th√≠ch k·∫øt qu·∫£ c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. - C: Trung b√¨nh, v√¨ XRAI c≈©ng l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi·∫£i th√≠ch nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·ªï bi·∫øn b·∫±ng Integrated Gradients trong ng·ªØ c·∫£nh n√†y. - D: Th·∫•p, v√¨ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√°c quy·∫øt ƒë·ªãnh c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.

Question 229 of 294
Question 230 (Single answer)

Question 230 of 294
Question 231 (Single answer)

M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ hu·∫•n luy·ªán s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán suy lu·∫≠n h√†ng lo·∫°t trong BigQuery. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t.
B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points quan tr·ªçng

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Apache Spark tr√™n Dataproc c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v·ªõi BigQuery.

- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng SQL trong BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω v√† ƒë·ªçc d·ªØ li·ªáu tr·ª±c ti·∫øp t·ª´ BigQuery b·∫±ng BigQueryClient trong TensorFlow l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Apache Beam tr√™n Dataflow c√≥ th·ªÉ hi·ªáu qu·∫£ nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t√≠ch h·ª£p tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v·ªõi BigQuery nh∆∞ l·ª±a ch·ªçn C.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi

Question 232 (Single answer)

Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

Question 232 of 294
Question 233 (Single answer)
You are building a custom image classification model and plan to use Vertex AI Pipelines to implement the end-to-end training. Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn (components) c·∫ßn s·ª≠ d·ª•ng trong Vertex AI Pipelines ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán c√°c b∆∞·ªõc ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu h√¨nh ·∫£nh v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • B·∫°n ƒëang x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh t√πy ch·ªânh.
    • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Pipelines ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán hu·∫•n luy·ªán t·ª´ ƒë·∫ßu ƒë·∫øn cu·ªëi.
    • D·ªØ li·ªáu c·∫ßn ƒë∆∞·ª£c ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω: thay ƒë·ªïi k√≠ch th∆∞·ªõc, chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi sang thang ƒë·ªô x√°m, v√† tr√≠ch xu·∫•t ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng.
    • ƒê√£ c√≥ s·∫µn m·ªôt s·ªë h√†m Python cho c√°c t√°c v·ª• ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

Question 233 of 294
Question 234 (Single answer)
You work for a retail company that is using a regression model built with BigQuery ML to predict product sales. This model is being used to serve online predictions. Recently you developed a new version of the model that uses a different architecture (custom model). Initial analysis revealed that both models are performing as expected. Question 235 of 294
Question 236 (Single answer)

Question 237 (Single answer)

Question 237 of 294
Question 238 (Single answer)
You have deployed a scikit-team model to a Vertex AI endpoint using a custom model server. You enabled autoscaling: however, the deployed model fails to scale beyond one replica, which led to dropped requests. You notice that CPU utilization remains low even during periods of high load. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ƒë·ªÉ m√¥ h√¨nh scikit-team ƒë√£ tri·ªÉn khai c√≥ th·ªÉ m·ªü r·ªông v∆∞·ª£t qu√° m·ªôt b·∫£n sao (replica) v√¨ hi·ªán t·∫°i n√≥ kh√¥ng th·ªÉ m·ªü r·ªông v√† d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác y√™u c·∫ßu b·ªã b·ªè qua. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng.

Question 238 of 294
Question 239 (Single answer)
You work for a pet food company that manages an online forum. Customers upload photos of their pets on the forum to share with others. About 20 photos are uploaded daily. You want to automatically and in near real time detect whether each uploaded photo has an animal. You want to prioritize time and minimize cost of your application development and deployment. What should you do?

Question 239 of 294
Question 240 (Single answer)
You work at a mobile gaming startup that creates online multiplayer games. Recently, your company observed an increase in players cheating in the games, leading to a loss of revenue and a poor user experience You built a binary classification model to determine whether a player cheated after a completed game session, and then send a message to other downstream systems to ban the player that cheated. Question 240 of 294
Question 241 (Single answer)

Question 241 of 294
Question 242 (Single answer)
Your team is training a large number of ML models that use different algorithms, parameters, and datasets. Some models are trained in Vertex AI Pipelines, and some are trained on Vertex AI Workbench notebook instances. Your team wants to compare the performance of the models across both services. Question 242 of 294
Question 243 (Single answer)
You work on a team that builds state-of-the-art deep learning models by using the TensorFlow framework. Your team runs multiple ML experiments each week, which makes it difficult to track the experiment runs. You want a simple approach to effectively track, visualize, and debug ML experiment runs on Google Cloud while minimizing any overhead code. How should you proceed?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. Question 243 of 294
Question 244 (Single answer)
Your work for a textile manufacturing company. Your company has hundreds of machines, and each machine has many sensors. Your team used the sensory data to build hundreds of ML models that detect machine anomalies. Models are retrained daily, and you need to deploy these models in a cost-effective way. The models must operate 24/7 without downtime and make sub millisecond predictions. What should you do?

Question 244 of 294
Question 245 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model that predicts the cost of used automobiles based on data such as location, condition, model type, color, and engine/battery efficiency. The data is updated every night. Car dealerships will use the model to determine appropriate car prices. You created a Vertex AI pipeline that reads the data splits the data into training/evaluation/test sets performs feature engineering trains the model by using the training dataset and validates the model by using the evaluation dataset. Question 245 of 294
Question 246 (Single answer)

Question 246 of 294
Question 247 (Single answer)

Question 247 of 294
Question 248 (Single answer)
You trained a model packaged it with a custom Docker container for serving, and deployed it to Vertex AI Model Registry. When you submit a batch prediction job, it fails with this error: "Error model server never became ready. Please validate that your model file or container configuration are valid. " There are no additional errors in the logs. What should you do?

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n x√°c ƒë·ªãnh nguy√™n nh√¢n v√† c√°ch kh·∫Øc ph·ª•c l·ªói khi th·ª±c hi·ªán batch prediction job v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë√≥ng g√≥i trong Docker container v√† tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n Vertex AI Model Registry. C√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
- M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë√≥ng g√≥i trong Docker container.
- L·ªói x·∫£y ra: "Error model server never became ready. Please validate that your model file or container configuration are valid."
- Kh√¥ng c√≥ l·ªói b·ªï sung trong logs.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
- A: Th√™m c·∫•u h√¨nh logging ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t logs l√™n Cloud Logging. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p ki·ªÉm tra logs nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ.
- B: Thay ƒë·ªïi c·ªïng HTTP trong c·∫•u h√¨nh m√¥ h√¨nh v·ªÅ gi√° tr·ªã m·∫∑c ƒë·ªãnh 8080. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫ßn thi·∫øt n·∫øu c·ªïng kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng c√≥ th√¥ng tin n√†o trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i cho th·∫•y c·ªïng l√† nguy√™n nh√¢n.
- C: Thay ƒë·ªïi gi√° tr·ªã healthRoute trong c·∫•u h√¨nh m√¥ h√¨nh th√†nh /healthcheck. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫ßn thi·∫øt n·∫øu healthRoute kh√¥ng ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng c√≥ th√¥ng tin n√†o trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i cho th·∫•y healthRoute l√† nguy√™n nh√¢n.
- D: K√©o Docker image v·ªÅ m√°y c·ª•c b·ªô v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng l·ªánh docker run ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y n√≥ c·ª•c b·ªô. S·ª≠ d·ª•ng l·ªánh docker logs ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra l·ªói. ƒê√¢y l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·ªÉ ki·ªÉm tra v√† kh·∫Øc ph·ª•c l·ªói trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng c·ª•c b·ªô.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

Question 248 of 294
Question 249 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model to identify your company‚Äôs products in images. You have access to over one million images in a Cloud Storage bucket. Question 249 of 294
Question 250 (Single answer)

Question 250 of 294
Question 251 (Single answer)

Question 251 of 294
Question 252 (Single answer)

Question 252 of 294
Question 253 (Single answer)
You work for a delivery company. You need to design a system that stores and manages features such as parcels delivered and truck locations over time. The system must retrieve the features with low latency and feed those features into a model for online prediction. The data science team will retrieve historical data at a specific point in time for model training. You want to store the features with minimal effort. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu thi·∫øt k·∫ø m·ªôt h·ªá th·ªëng l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng nh∆∞ c√°c ki·ªán h√†ng ƒë√£ giao v√† v·ªã tr√≠ xe t·∫£i theo th·ªùi gian. H·ªá th·ªëng c·∫ßn truy xu·∫•t c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v·ªõi ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p v√† ƒë∆∞a v√†o m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn. D·ªØ li·ªáu c·∫ßn ƒë∆∞·ª£c l∆∞u tr·ªØ v·ªõi n·ªó l·ª±c t·ªëi thi·ªÉu.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - L∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng (features) - Truy xu·∫•t v·ªõi ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p - D·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn - L∆∞u tr·ªØ v·ªõi n·ªó l·ª±c t·ªëi thi·ªÉu
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Bigtable l√† c∆° s·ªü d·ªØ li·ªáu NoSQL c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu key/value, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho qu·∫£n l√Ω ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn. - B: Vertex AI Feature Store ƒë∆∞·ª£c thi·∫øt k·∫ø ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† qu·∫£n l√Ω ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, h·ªó tr·ª£ truy xu·∫•t nhanh v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët v·ªõi c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh AI cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn. - C: Vertex AI dataset ch·ªß y·∫øu d√πng cho l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu hu·∫•n luy·ªán, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho truy xu·∫•t nhanh v√† d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn. - D: BigQuery c√≥ th·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† truy v·∫•n m·∫°nh m·∫Ω, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho truy xu·∫•t v·ªõi ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ th·∫•p trong d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Th·∫•p - B: Cao - C: Th·∫•p - D: Trung b√¨nh
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B: Store features in Vertex AI Feature Store.
Question 253 of 294
Question 254 (Single answer)
You are working on a prototype of a text classification model in a managed Vertex AI Workbench notebook. You want to quickly experiment with tokenizing text by using a Natural Language Toolkit (NLTK) library. How should you add the library to your Jupyter kernel?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√¢u h·ªèi y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n th√™m th∆∞ vi·ªán NLTK v√†o kernel c·ªßa Jupyter trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng Vertex AI Workbench notebook. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i nh·∫•n m·∫°nh vi·ªác nhanh ch√≥ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám v·ªõi vi·ªác token h√≥a vƒÉn b·∫£n b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng th∆∞ vi·ªán NLTK trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng Jupyter notebook.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: C√†i ƒë·∫∑t th∆∞ vi·ªán NLTK t·ª´ terminal b·∫±ng l·ªánh pip install nltk. C√°ch n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ·∫£nh h∆∞·ªüng ƒë·∫øn kernel c·ªßa Jupyter notebook.
  • B: Vi·∫øt m·ªôt job Dataflow t√πy ch·ªânh ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng NLTK. C√°ch n√†y ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu "nhanh ch√≥ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám".
  • C: T·∫°o m·ªôt notebook m·ªõi v·ªõi image t√πy ch·ªânh c√≥ s·∫µn NLTK. C√°ch n√†y c≈©ng ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng nhanh ch√≥ng.
  • D: C√†i ƒë·∫∑t th∆∞ vi·ªán NLTK t·ª´ m·ªôt √¥ Jupyter b·∫±ng l·ªánh !pip install nltk --user. C√°ch n√†y tr·ª±c ti·∫øp v√† nhanh ch√≥ng, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu c·ªßa ƒë·ªÅ b√†i.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: ƒê√°p √°n D c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu nhanh ch√≥ng v√† tr·ª±c ti·∫øp c√†i ƒë·∫∑t th∆∞ vi·ªán v√†o kernel c·ªßa Jupyter notebook.

Question 254 of 294
Question 255 (Single answer)
You have recently used TensorFlow to train a classification model on tabular data. You have created a Dataflow pipeline that can transform several terabytes of data into training or prediction datasets consisting of TFRecords. You now need to productionize the model, and you want the predictions to be automatically uploaded to a BigQuery table on a weekly schedule. What should you do?

Question 255 of 294
Question 256 (Single answer)
You work for an online grocery store. You recently developed a custom ML model that recommends a recipe when a user arrives at the website. You chose the machine type on the Vertex AI endpoint to optimize costs by using the queries per second (QPS) that the model can serve, and you deployed it on a single machine with 8 vCPUs and no accelerators.
A holiday season is approaching and you anticipate four times more traffic during this time than the typical daily traffic. You need to ensure that the model can scale efficiently to the increased demand. What should you do?

    • D·ª± ƒëo√°n l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng truy c·∫≠p s·∫Ω tƒÉng g·∫•p b·ªën l·∫ßn.
    • C·∫ßn ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông hi·ªáu qu·∫£.

    • A: Gi·ªØ nguy√™n lo·∫°i m√°y v√† th√™m n√∫t t√≠nh to√°n khi nh·∫≠n c·∫£nh b√°o. Kh√¥ng t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªü r·ªông, c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë√°p ·ª©ng k·ªãp th·ªùi nhu c·∫ßu tƒÉng cao.
    • B: Thay ƒë·ªïi lo·∫°i m√°y l√™n 32 vCPUs v√† m·ªü r·ªông th√™m khi c·∫ßn. Chi ph√≠ cao v√† kh√¥ng t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªü r·ªông.
    • C: Gi·ªØ nguy√™n lo·∫°i m√°y v√† c·∫•u h√¨nh t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªü r·ªông d·ª±a tr√™n s·ª≠ d·ª•ng vCPU. Ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu m·ªü r·ªông t·ª± ƒë·ªông.
    • D: Thay ƒë·ªïi lo·∫°i m√°y sang GPU v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªü r·ªông d·ª±a tr√™n GPU. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ m√¥ h√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i kh√¥ng s·ª≠ d·ª•ng GPU.

    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c y√™u c·∫ßu m·ªü r·ªông t·ª± ƒë·ªông.

Question 256 of 294
Question 257 (Single answer)
You recently trained an XGBoost model on tabular data. You plan to expose the model for internal use as an HTTP microservice. After deployment, you expect a small number of incoming requests. You want to productionize the model with the least amount of effort and latency. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n tri·ªÉn khai m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh XGBoost ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng n·ªôi b·ªô d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng m·ªôt d·ªãch v·ª• HTTP microservice. Sau khi tri·ªÉn khai, b·∫°n d·ª± ki·∫øn s·∫Ω c√≥ m·ªôt s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng nh·ªè c√°c y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·∫øn. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† ƒë∆∞a m√¥ h√¨nh v√†o s·∫£n xu·∫•t v·ªõi √≠t n·ªó l·ª±c v√† ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: m√¥ h√¨nh XGBoost, d·ªãch v·ª• HTTP microservice, s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng y√™u c·∫ßu nh·ªè, √≠t n·ªó l·ª±c v√† ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh l√™n BigQuery ML kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ BigQuery ML kh√¥ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a cho vi·ªác tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh d∆∞·ªõi d·∫°ng d·ªãch v·ª• HTTP microservice.
    • B: X√¢y d·ª±ng ·ª©ng d·ª•ng d·ª±a tr√™n Flask v√† tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n Vertex AI Endpoints c√≥ th·ªÉ l√† m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn, nh∆∞ng vi·ªác t·∫°o container t√πy ch·ªânh c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªën nhi·ªÅu c√¥ng s·ª©c h∆°n.
    • C: Tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n Google Kubernetes Engine c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng c·∫ßn thi·∫øt cho s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng y√™u c·∫ßu nh·ªè.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng container XGBoost c√≥ s·∫µn tr√™n Vertex AI ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o m√¥ h√¨nh v√† tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n Vertex AI Endpoints l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£ nh·∫•t, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu √≠t n·ªó l·ª±c v√† ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
