    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† D.
Question 257 of 294
Question 258 (Single answer)
You work for an international manufacturing organization that ships scientific products all over the world. Instruction manuals for these products need to be translated to 15 different languages. Your organization‚Äôs leadership team wants to start using machine learning to reduce the cost of manual human translations and increase translation speed. You need to implement a scalable solution that maximizes accuracy and minimizes operational overhead. You also want to include a process to evaluate and fix incorrect translations. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n cho c√¢u h·ªèi v·ªÅ gi·∫£i ph√°p d·ªãch thu·∫≠t b·∫±ng ML tr√™n GCP
1. Question 258 of 294
Question 259 (Single answer)
You have developed an application that uses a chain of multiple scikit-learn models to predict the optimal price for your company‚Äôs products. The workflow logic is shown in the diagram. Members of your team use the individual models in other solution workflows. You want to deploy this workflow while ensuring version control for each individual model and the overall workflow. Your application needs to be able to scale down to zero. You want to minimize the compute resource utilization and the manual effort required to manage this solution. What should you do?

Question 259 of 294
Question 260 (Single answer)
You are developing a model to predict whether a failure will occur in a critical machine part. You have a dataset consisting of a multivariate time series and labels indicating whether the machine part failed. You recently started experimenting with a few different preprocessing and modeling approaches in a Vertex AI Workbench notebook. You want to log data and track artifacts from each run. Question 260 of 294
Question 261 (Single answer)

Question 261 of 294
Question 262 (Single answer)
You recently deployed a model to a Vertex AI endpoint and set up online serving in Vertex AI Feature Store. You have configured a daily batch ingestion job to update your featurestore. During the batch ingestion jobs, you discover that CPU utilization is high in your featurestore‚Äôs online serving nodes and that feature retrieval latency is high. You need to improve online serving performance during the daily batch ingestion. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi:

    • C√¥ng vi·ªác nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu h√†ng lo·∫°t h√†ng ng√†y g√¢y ra vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng CPU cao v√† ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ truy xu·∫•t ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng cao.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: TƒÉng s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng n√∫t ph·ª•c v·ª• tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn tr∆∞·ªõc khi nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p gi·∫£m t·∫£i, nh∆∞ng c·∫ßn ph·∫£i th·ª±c hi·ªán th·ªß c√¥ng v√† kh√¥ng linh ho·∫°t.
    • B: B·∫≠t t√≠nh nƒÉng t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªü r·ªông (autoscaling) cho c√°c n√∫t ph·ª•c v·ª• tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn s·∫Ω t·ª± ƒë·ªông ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng n√∫t d·ª±a tr√™n t·∫£i, gi√∫p c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t m·ªôt c√°ch linh ho·∫°t.
    • C: B·∫≠t t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªü r·ªông cho c√°c n√∫t d·ª± ƒëo√°n c·ªßa DeployedModel kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ c·ªßa Feature Store.
    • D: TƒÉng worker_count trong y√™u c·∫ßu ImportFeatureValues c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán t·ªëc ƒë·ªô nh·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t ph·ª•c v·ª• tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do c·∫ßn th·ª±c hi·ªán th·ªß c√¥ng.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ t·ª± ƒë·ªông ƒëi·ªÅu ch·ªânh s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng n√∫t ph·ª•c v·ª•.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng li√™n quan tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ƒë·∫øn v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ch√≠nh.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 262 of 294
Question 263 (Single answer)
You are developing a custom TensorFlow classification model based on tabular data. Your raw data is stored in BigQuery. contains hundreds of millions of rows, and includes both categorical and numerical features. You need to use a MaxMin scaler on some numerical features, and apply a one-hot encoding to some categorical features such as SKU names. Your model will be trained over multiple epochs. You want to minimize the effort and cost of your solution. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ph√°t tri·ªÉn m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i TensorFlow t√πy ch·ªânh d·ª±a tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu d·∫°ng b·∫£ng l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong BigQuery. D·ªØ li·ªáu bao g·ªìm c·∫£ c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√† s·ªë h·ªçc. C·∫ßn s·ª≠ d·ª•ng MaxMin scaler cho m·ªôt s·ªë ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng s·ªë h·ªçc v√† √°p d·ª•ng one-hot encoding cho m·ªôt s·ªë ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i nh∆∞ t√™n SKU. M·ª•c ti√™u l√† t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c v√† chi ph√≠.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - D·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn (h√†ng trƒÉm tri·ªáu d√≤ng) trong BigQuery. - C·∫ßn MaxMin scaler cho ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng s·ªë h·ªçc. - C·∫ßn one-hot encoding cho ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i. - M√¥ h√¨nh s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán qua nhi·ªÅu epochs. - T·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c v√† chi ph√≠.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√¥ h√¨nh t·ª´ Hugging Face ƒë·ªÉ m√£ h√≥a vƒÉn b·∫£n c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c cho one-hot encoding. - B: ƒê·ªÉ TensorFlow th·ª±c hi·ªán one-hot encoding c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ hi·ªáu su·∫•t khi x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TFX v√† Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l√† c√°ch ti·∫øp c·∫≠n t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, cho ph√©p x·ª≠ l√Ω song song v√† hi·ªáu qu·∫£. - D: Th·ª±c hi·ªán one-hot encoding trong BigQuery c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c so v·ªõi vi·ªác s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng c·ª• chuy√™n d·ª•ng nh∆∞ TFX.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c. - B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng trung b√¨nh, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn. - C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao, t·ªëi ∆∞u cho x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† t√≠ch h·ª£p t·ªët v·ªõi Vertex AI. - D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠ v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng TFX v√† Dataflow ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn m·ªôt c√°ch hi·ªáu qu·∫£ v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u.
Question 263 of 294
Question 264 (Single answer)
You work for a retail company. You have been tasked with building a model to determine the probability of churn for each customer. You need the predictions to be interpretable so the results can be used to develop marketing campaigns that target at- risk customers. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh x√°c su·∫•t kh√°ch h√†ng r·ªùi b·ªè (churn) v√† c·∫ßn c√°c d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t tri·ªÉn c√°c chi·∫øn d·ªãch marketing nh·∫Øm v√†o kh√°ch h√†ng c√≥ nguy c∆°. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: x√°c su·∫•t churn, d·ª± ƒëo√°n c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c, v√† ph√°t tri·ªÉn chi·∫øn d·ªãch marketing.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • A: M√¥ h√¨nh h·ªìi quy r·ª´ng ng·∫´u nhi√™n c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫°o ra t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, nh∆∞ng h·ªìi quy kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i churn.
  • B: AutoML tabular regression kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ h·ªìi quy kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªët nh·∫•t cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i churn.
  • C: M·∫°ng n∆°-ron t√πy ch·ªânh v·ªõi TensorFlow c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫°o ra gi·∫£i th√≠ch, nh∆∞ng th∆∞·ªùng ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√≥ gi·∫£i th√≠ch h∆°n so v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh r·ª´ng ng·∫´u nhi√™n.
  • D: M√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i r·ª´ng ng·∫´u nhi√™n c√≥ th·ªÉ t·∫°o ra t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v√† ph√π h·ª£p h∆°n cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i churn.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
  • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng h·ªìi quy cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i.
  • B: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng h·ªìi quy cho b√†i to√°n ph√¢n lo·∫°i.
  • C: C√≥ th·ªÉ ph√π h·ª£p nh∆∞ng ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† kh√≥ gi·∫£i th√≠ch.
  • D: Ph√π h·ª£p nh·∫•t v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£i th√≠ch ƒë∆∞·ª£c th√¥ng qua t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng.

Question 264 of 294
Question 265 (Single answer)
You work for a company that is developing an application to help users with meal planning. You want to use machine learning to scan a corpus of recipes and extract each ingredient (e.g., carrot, rice, pasta) and each kitchen cookware (e.g., bowl, pot, spoon) mentioned. Each recipe is saved in an unstructured text file. What should you do?
Evaluate performance on a holdout dataset. B. Create a multi-label text classification dataset on Vertex AI. Create a test dataset, and label each recipe that corresponds to its ingredients and cookware. Train a multi-class classification model. Evaluate the model‚Äôs performance on a holdout dataset. C. Use the Entity Analysis method of the Natural Language API to extract the ingredients and cookware from each recipe. Evaluate the model's performance on a prelabeled dataset. D. Create a text dataset on Vertex AI for entity extraction. Create as many entities as there are different ingredients and cookware. Train an AutoML entity extraction model to extract those entities. Evaluate the model‚Äôs performance on a holdout dataset.
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng machine learning nh·∫±m qu√©t m·ªôt t·∫≠p h·ª£p c√°c c√¥ng th·ª©c n·∫•u ƒÉn v√† tr√≠ch xu·∫•t t·ª´ng th√†nh ph·∫ßn nguy√™n li·ªáu v√† d·ª•ng c·ª• nh√† b·∫øp ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm vi·ªác x·ª≠ l√Ω vƒÉn b·∫£n kh√¥ng c√≥ c·∫•u tr√∫c, tr√≠ch xu·∫•t th·ª±c th·ªÉ (entity extraction), v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng c√¥ng c·ª• ph√π h·ª£p trong GCP nh∆∞ Vertex AI ho·∫∑c Natural Language API.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
  • L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: T·∫°o m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu vƒÉn b·∫£n tr√™n Vertex AI cho vi·ªác tr√≠ch xu·∫•t th·ª±c th·ªÉ, t·∫°o hai th·ª±c th·ªÉ l√† "ingredient" v√† "cookware", v√† g√°n nh√£n √≠t nh·∫•t 200 v√≠ d·ª• cho m·ªói th·ª±c th·ªÉ. Hu·∫•n luy·ªán m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh AutoML ƒë·ªÉ tr√≠ch xu·∫•t c√°c lo·∫°i th·ª±c th·ªÉ n√†y. ƒê√¢y l√† m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng AutoML cho vi·ªác tr√≠ch xu·∫•t th·ª±c th·ªÉ, ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu tr√≠ch xu·∫•t c√°c th√†nh ph·∫ßn v√† d·ª•ng c·ª• t·ª´ vƒÉn b·∫£n kh√¥ng c√≥ c·∫•u tr√∫c.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: L·ª±a ch·ªçn A c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng ƒë√∫ng c√¥ng c·ª• v√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p (AutoML entity extraction) ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ tr√≠ch xu·∫•t th·ª±c th·ªÉ t·ª´ vƒÉn b·∫£n kh√¥ng c√≥ c·∫•u tr√∫c.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn A.
Question 265 of 294
Question 266 (Single answer)
You work for an organization that operates a streaming music service. You have a custom production model that is serving a ‚Äúnext song‚Äù recommendation based on a user's recent listening history. Your model is deployed on a Vertex AI endpoint. You recently retrained the same model by using fresh data. The model received positive test results offline. You now want to test the new model in production while minimizing complexity. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n th·ª≠ nghi·ªám m√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng s·∫£n xu·∫•t v·ªõi m·ª©c ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p t·ªëi thi·ªÉu. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • M√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi ƒë√£ ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi v√† c√≥ k·∫øt qu·∫£ ki·ªÉm tra t√≠ch c·ª±c offline.
    • M√¥ h√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i ƒëang ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai tr√™n m·ªôt endpoint c·ªßa Vertex AI.
    • M·ª•c ti√™u l√† th·ª≠ nghi·ªám m√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi trong s·∫£n xu·∫•t m√† kh√¥ng l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: T·∫°o m·ªôt endpoint m·ªõi v√† x√¢y d·ª±ng d·ªãch v·ª• ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn 5% l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng c√≥ th·ªÉ l√†m tƒÉng ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery v√† Vertex AI Experiments ƒë·ªÉ so s√°nh hi·ªáu su·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp ki·ªÉm tra trong m√¥i tr∆∞·ªùng s·∫£n xu·∫•t.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng traffic splitting tr√™n endpoint hi·ªán t·∫°i ƒë·ªÉ chuy·ªÉn 5% l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng ƒë·∫øn m√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi, gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
    • D: C·∫•u h√¨nh c√¥ng vi·ªác gi√°m s√°t m√¥ h√¨nh v√† c·∫≠p nh·∫≠t m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp th·ª≠ nghi·ªám m√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do tƒÉng ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám tr·ª±c ti·∫øp trong s·∫£n xu·∫•t.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao do ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu th·ª≠ nghi·ªám trong s·∫£n xu·∫•t v·ªõi ƒë·ªô ph·ª©c t·∫°p t·ªëi thi·ªÉu.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do kh√¥ng th·ª≠ nghi·ªám m√¥ h√¨nh m·ªõi.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† C.
Question 266 of 294
Question 267 (Single answer)
You created a model that uses BigQuery ML to perform linear regression. You need to retrain the model on the cumulative data collected every week. You want to minimize the development effort and the scheduling cost. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML h√†ng tu·∫ßn v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu t√≠ch l≈©y, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† chi ph√≠ l·∫≠p l·ªãch. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: "retrain the model", "cumulative data collected every week", "minimize the development effort", v√† "scheduling cost".

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªãch v·ª• l·∫≠p l·ªãch c·ªßa BigQuery ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y truy v·∫•n hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªãnh k·ª≥. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† chi ph√≠ l·∫≠p l·ªãch v√¨ BigQuery c√≥ s·∫µn d·ªãch v·ª• l·∫≠p l·ªãch.
  • B: T·∫°o m·ªôt pipeline trong Vertex AI Pipelines v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Scheduler API ƒë·ªÉ ch·∫°y truy v·∫•n h√†ng tu·∫ßn. C√°ch n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† t·ªën c√¥ng s·ª©c ph√°t tri·ªÉn h∆°n.
  • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Cloud Scheduler ƒë·ªÉ k√≠ch ho·∫°t m·ªôt Cloud Function h√†ng tu·∫ßn ch·∫°y truy v·∫•n hu·∫•n luy·ªán l·∫°i m√¥ h√¨nh. C√°ch n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ v√† c√¥ng s·ª©c ph√°t tri·ªÉn do c·∫ßn tri·ªÉn khai th√™m Cloud Function.
  • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery API Connector v√† Cloud Scheduler ƒë·ªÉ k√≠ch ho·∫°t Workflows h√†ng tu·∫ßn. C√°ch n√†y c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† t·ªën k√©m h∆°n.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

ƒê√°p √°n A c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ n√≥ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªãch v·ª• c√≥ s·∫µn c·ªßa BigQuery, gi√∫p t·ªëi thi·ªÉu h√≥a c√¥ng s·ª©c ph√°t tri·ªÉn v√† chi ph√≠ l·∫≠p l·ªãch.

B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi

Ch·ªçn ƒë√°p √°n A l√† c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng.

Question 267 of 294
Question 268 (Single answer)
You want to migrate a scikit-learn classifier model to TensorFlow. You plan to train the TensorFlow classifier model using the same training set that was used to train the scikit-learn model, and then compare the performances using a common test set. You want to use the Vertex AI Python SDK to manually log the evaluation metrics of each model and compare them based on their F1 scores and confusion matrices. How should you log the metrics?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ghi l·∫°i c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë ƒë√°nh gi√° (evaluation metrics) c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·ªÉ so s√°nh d·ª±a tr√™n F1 scores v√† confusion matrices. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i c√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • Migrate m√¥ h√¨nh t·ª´ scikit-learn sang TensorFlow.
    • S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Python SDK ƒë·ªÉ ghi l·∫°i c√°c ch·ªâ s·ªë.
    • So s√°nh d·ª±a tr√™n F1 scores v√† confusion matrices.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ aiplatform.log_classification_metrics c√≥ th·ªÉ ghi c·∫£ F1 score v√† confusion matrix.
    • B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ aiplatform.log_classification_metrics c√≥ th·ªÉ ghi c·∫£ F1 score v√† confusion matrix.
    • C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ aiplatform.log_metrics kh√¥ng chuy√™n bi·ªát cho classification metrics nh∆∞ F1 score v√† confusion matrix.
    • D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ aiplatform.log_metrics kh√¥ng chuy√™n bi·ªát cho F1 score v√† aiplatform.log_classification_metrics c√≥ th·ªÉ ghi c·∫£ F1 score v√† confusion matrix.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
    • D: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p.
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B.
Question 268 of 294
Question 269 (Single answer)
You are developing a model to help your company create more targeted online advertising campaigns. You need to create a dataset that you will use to train the model. You want to avoid creating or reinforcing unfair bias in the model. What should you do? (Choose two.)
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n t·∫°o m·ªôt t·∫≠p d·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh qu·∫£ng c√°o tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn m√† kh√¥ng t·∫°o ra ho·∫∑c c·ªßng c·ªë s·ª± thi√™n v·ªã kh√¥ng c√¥ng b·∫±ng. B·∫°n c·∫ßn ch·ªçn hai ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë√∫ng.

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

  • B: Ch·ªâ bao g·ªìm c√°c nh√≥m nh√¢n kh·∫©u h·ªçc th∆∞·ªùng xuy√™n t∆∞∆°ng t√°c v·ªõi qu·∫£ng c√°o c√≥ th·ªÉ d·∫´n ƒë·∫øn thi√™n v·ªã v√¨ n√≥ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫°i di·ªán cho to√†n b·ªô d√¢n s·ªë.
  • C: Thu th·∫≠p m·∫´u ng·∫´u nhi√™n t·ª´ l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng truy c·∫≠p s·∫£n xu·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c nh√≥m nh√¢n kh·∫©u h·ªçc ƒë·ªÅu ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫°i di·ªán ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß.
  • D: Thu th·∫≠p m·∫´u ph√¢n t·∫ßng t·ª´ l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng truy c·∫≠p s·∫£n xu·∫•t c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p ƒë·∫£m b·∫£o r·∫±ng t·∫•t c·∫£ c√°c nh√≥m nh√¢n kh·∫©u h·ªçc ƒë·ªÅu ƒë∆∞·ª£c ƒë·∫°i di·ªán, gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu thi√™n v·ªã.
  • E: Th·ª±c hi·ªán c√°c b√†i ki·ªÉm tra c√¥ng b·∫±ng tr√™n c√°c danh m·ª•c nh·∫°y c·∫£m v√† nh√¢n kh·∫©u h·ªçc tr√™n m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë√£ hu·∫•n luy·ªán c√≥ th·ªÉ gi√∫p x√°c ƒë·ªãnh v√† gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu thi√™n v·ªã.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: D v√† E c√≥ kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao nh·∫•t v√¨ ch√∫ng tr·ª±c ti·∫øp li√™n quan ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu thi√™n v·ªã trong d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† m√¥ h√¨nh.

Question 269 of 294
Question 270 (Single answer)
You are developing an ML model in a Vertex AI Workbench notebook. You want to track artifacts and compare models during experimentation using different approaches. You need to rapidly and easily transition successful experiments to production as you iterate on your model implementation. What should you do?

  1.   2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng bao g·ªìm: theo d√µi artifacts, so s√°nh m√¥ h√¨nh, chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi nhanh ch√≥ng v√† d·ªÖ d√†ng t·ª´ th·ª≠ nghi·ªám sang s·∫£n xu·∫•t, v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Workbench notebook.

    • ƒê√°p √°n D: T·∫°o pipeline v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI SDK ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o m·ªôt l·∫ßn ch·∫°y th·ª≠ nghi·ªám, theo d√µi tham s·ªë v√† ch·ªâ s·ªë. Tuy nhi√™n, kh√¥ng ƒë·ªÅ c·∫≠p ƒë·∫øn vi·ªác ƒë√≠nh k√®m artifacts trong qu√° tr√¨nh th·ª±c hi·ªán.

Question 270 of 294
Question 271 (Single answer)
You recently created a new Google Cloud project. Question 271 of 294
Question 272 (Single answer)
You work for a semiconductor manufacturing company. You need to create a real-time application that automates the quality control process. High-definition images of each semiconductor are taken at the end of the assembly line in real time. The photos are uploaded to a Cloud Storage bucket along with tabular data that includes each semiconductor‚Äôs batch number, serial number, dimensions, and weight. You need to configure model training and serving while maximizing model accuracy. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t·∫°o m·ªôt ·ª©ng d·ª•ng th·ªùi gian th·ª±c ƒë·ªÉ t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a quy tr√¨nh ki·ªÉm so√°t ch·∫•t l∆∞·ª£ng cho c√¥ng ty s·∫£n xu·∫•t ch·∫•t b√°n d·∫´n. ·ª®ng d·ª•ng c·∫ßn x·ª≠ l√Ω h√¨nh ·∫£nh ƒë·ªô ph√¢n gi·∫£i cao v√† d·ªØ li·ªáu b·∫£ng, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh. Ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points

C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i bao g·ªìm: x·ª≠ l√Ω h√¨nh ·∫£nh ƒë·ªô ph√¢n gi·∫£i cao, d·ªØ li·ªáu b·∫£ng, th·ªùi gian th·ª±c, v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c c·ªßa m√¥ h√¨nh.

B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
  • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Data Labeling Service ƒë·ªÉ g√°n nh√£n h√¨nh ·∫£nh v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh AutoML.   • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Vertex AI Data Labeling Service ƒë·ªÉ g√°n nh√£n h√¨nh ·∫£nh v√† l√™n l·ªãch c√¥ng vi·ªác d·ª± ƒëo√°n h√†ng ng√†y. Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu th·ªùi gian th·ª±c.
  • C: Chuy·ªÉn ƒë·ªïi h√¨nh ·∫£nh th√†nh bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn nh√∫ng v√† s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML ƒë·ªÉ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n c·ª•m K-means. Kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ƒë·ªô ch√≠nh x√°c m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n lo·∫°i h√¨nh ·∫£nh.

Question 272 of 294
Question 273 (Single answer)
You work for a rapidly growing social media company. Your team builds TensorFlow recommender models in an on-premises CPU cluster. The data contains billions of historical user events and 100,000 categorical features. You notice that as the data increases, the model training time increases. You plan to move the models to Google Cloud. You want to use the most scalable approach that also minimizes training time. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TPU VMs v·ªõi TPUv3 Pod slices v√† TPUEmbedding API c√≥ th·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω t·ªët c√°c m√¥ h√¨nh l·ªõn v√† ph·ª©c t·∫°p, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát l√† v·ªõi d·ªØ li·ªáu c√≥ nhi·ªÅu ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ph√¢n lo·∫°i. - B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Google Kubernetes Engine v·ªõi CPU c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß m·∫°nh ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn v√† nhi·ªÅu ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng nh∆∞ y√™u c·∫ßu. - C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML cho m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n t√≠ch ma tr·∫≠n c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu v·ªÅ kh·∫£ nƒÉng m·ªü r·ªông v√† t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a th·ªùi gian hu·∫•n luy·ªán. - D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Compute Engine v·ªõi A100 GPUs v√† tf.nn.embedding_lookup API c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªët nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u b·∫±ng TPU cho c√°c t√°c v·ª• TensorFlow l·ªõn.

Question 273 of 294
Question 274 (Single answer)

Question 274 of 294
Question 275 (Single answer)
You have trained an XGBoost model that you plan to deploy on Vertex AI for online prediction. You are now uploading your model to Vertex AI Model Registry, and you need to configure the explanation method that will serve online prediction requests to be returned with minimal latency. Question 275 of 294
Question 276 (Single answer)
You work at a gaming startup that has several terabytes of structured data in Cloud Storage. This data includes gameplay time data, user metadata, and game metadata. You want to build a model that recommends new games to users that requires the least amount of coding. What should you do?

  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu x√¢y d·ª±ng m·ªôt m√¥ h√¨nh g·ª£i √Ω game m·ªõi cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng v·ªõi l∆∞·ª£ng m√£ h√≥a √≠t nh·∫•t. C√≥ 4 l·ª±a ch·ªçn v√† ch·ªâ c√≥ 1 l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.

    • C·∫ßn m√¥ h√¨nh g·ª£i √Ω game m·ªõi cho ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng.

  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML v·ªõi Autoencoder kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho b√†i to√°n g·ª£i √Ω.
    • B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n t√≠ch ma tr·∫≠n (matrix factorization) l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p ph·ªï bi·∫øn cho b√†i to√°n g·ª£i √Ω v√† y√™u c·∫ßu √≠t m√£ h√≥a.
    • C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh two-tower y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu m√£ h√≥a h∆°n v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho b√†i to√°n n√†y.
    • D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng TensorFlow v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n t√≠ch ma tr·∫≠n y√™u c·∫ßu nhi·ªÅu m√£ h√≥a h∆°n so v·ªõi BigQuery ML.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

    • B: Cao
    • C: Th·∫•p
    • D: Th·∫•p
  5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† B v√¨ s·ª≠ d·ª•ng BigQuery ML v·ªõi m√¥ h√¨nh ph√¢n t√≠ch ma tr·∫≠n l√† ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p t·ªëi ∆∞u cho b√†i to√°n g·ª£i √Ω v·ªõi √≠t m√£ h√≥a nh·∫•t.
Question 276 of 294
Question 277 (Single answer)
You work for a large bank that serves customers through an application hosted in Google Cloud that is running in the US and Singapore. You have developed a PyTorch model to classify transactions as potentially fraudulent or not. The model is a three- layer perceptron that uses both numerical and categorical features as input, and hashing happens within the model.
You deployed the model to the us-central1 region on nl-highcpu-16 machines, and predictions are served in real time. The model's current median response latency is 40 ms. You want to reduce latency, especially in Singapore, where some customers are experiencing the longest delays. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m c√°ch gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ (latency) cho m√¥ h√¨nh d·ª± ƒëo√°n gian l·∫≠n, ƒë·∫∑c bi·ªát l√† ·ªü Singapore. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng gi·ªõi h·∫°n s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt ƒë√°p √°n ch√≠nh x√°c.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - M√¥ h√¨nh PyTorch ƒëang ch·∫°y tr√™n Google Cloud. - M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë∆∞·ª£c tri·ªÉn khai t·∫°i khu v·ª±c us-central1. - ƒê·ªô tr·ªÖ trung b√¨nh hi·ªán t·∫°i l√† 40 ms. - Kh√°ch h√†ng ·ªü Singapore g·∫∑p ph·∫£i ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ cao nh·∫•t.
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: G·∫Øn th√™m GPU NVIDIA T4 c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô x·ª≠ l√Ω, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ do kho·∫£ng c√°ch ƒë·ªãa l√Ω. - B: Thay ƒë·ªïi m√°y sang nl-highcpu-32 c√≥ th·ªÉ c·∫£i thi·ªán hi·ªáu su·∫•t, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ do kho·∫£ng c√°ch ƒë·ªãa l√Ω. - C: Tri·ªÉn khai m√¥ h√¨nh ƒë·∫øn c√°c ƒëi·ªÉm cu·ªëi ri√™ng c·ªßa Vertex AI ·ªü c·∫£ us-central1 v√† asia-southeast1 c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ cho Singapore. - D: T·∫°o m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÉm cu·ªëi Vertex AI kh√°c ·ªü khu v·ª±c asia-southeast1 v√† cho ph√©p ·ª©ng d·ª•ng ch·ªçn ƒëi·ªÉm cu·ªëi ph√π h·ª£p s·∫Ω gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ cho Singapore.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Kh√¥ng kh·∫£ thi v√¨ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ kho·∫£ng c√°ch ƒë·ªãa l√Ω. - B: Kh√¥ng kh·∫£ thi v√¨ kh√¥ng gi·∫£i quy·∫øt v·∫•n ƒë·ªÅ kho·∫£ng c√°ch ƒë·ªãa l√Ω. - C: Kh·∫£ thi v√¨ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ b·∫±ng c√°ch tri·ªÉn khai g·∫ßn h∆°n v·ªõi ng∆∞·ªùi d√πng Singapore. - D: Kh·∫£ thi v√† l√† gi·∫£i ph√°p ƒë∆°n gi·∫£n h∆°n C, v√¨ ch·ªâ c·∫ßn th√™m m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÉm cu·ªëi ·ªü khu v·ª±c g·∫ßn Singapore.

Question 277 of 294
Question 278 (Single answer)
You need to train an XGBoost model on a small dataset. Your training code requires custom dependencies. You want to minimize the startup time of your training job. How should you set up your Vertex AI custom training job?

Question 278 of 294
Question 279 (Single answer)
You are creating an ML pipeline for data processing, model training, and model deployment that uses different Google Cloud services. You have developed code for each individual task, and you expect a high frequency of new files. You now need to create an orchestration layer on top of these tasks. You only want this orchestration pipeline to run if new files are present in your dataset in a Cloud Storage bucket. You also want to minimize the compute node costs. What should you do?

Question 279 of 294
Question 280 (Single answer)
You are using Kubeflow Pipelines to develop an end-to-end PyTorch-based MLOps pipeline. The pipeline reads data from BigQuery, processes the data, conducts feature engineering, model training, model evaluation, and deploys the model as a binary file to Cloud Storage. You are writing code for several different versions of the feature engineering and model training steps, and running each new version in Vertex AI Pipelines. Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n

    • D: Th√™m GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng t·ªëc ƒë·ªô nh∆∞ng s·∫Ω ph√°t sinh th√™m chi ph√≠.

Question 280 of 294
Question 281 (Single answer)
You work at a large organization that recently decided to move their ML and data workloads to Google Cloud. The data engineering team has exported the structured data to a Cloud Storage bucket in Avro format. You need to propose a workflow that performs analytics, creates features, and hosts the features that your ML models use for online prediction. How should you configure the pipeline?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ƒë·ªÅ xu·∫•t m·ªôt quy tr√¨nh c√¥ng vi·ªác ƒë·ªÉ th·ª±c hi·ªán ph√¢n t√≠ch, t·∫°o ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng (features), v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng m√† m√¥ h√¨nh ML c·ªßa b·∫°n s·ª≠ d·ª•ng cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i kh√¥ng ch·ªâ r√µ s·ªë l∆∞·ª£ng l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng, nh∆∞ng th√¥ng th∆∞·ªùng ch·ªâ c√≥ m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch t√¨m ra c√°c key points quan tr·ªçng nh·∫•t trong ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:
    • D·ªØ li·ªáu ƒë∆∞·ª£c xu·∫•t ra d∆∞·ªõi ƒë·ªãnh d·∫°ng Avro v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ trong Cloud Storage.
    • C·∫ßn th·ª±c hi·ªán ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu v√† t·∫°o ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng.
    • C·∫ßn l∆∞u tr·ªØ c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: Cloud Spanner kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† l·ª±a ch·ªçn t·ªëi ∆∞u cho ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn, th∆∞·ªùng d√πng cho giao d·ªãch OLTP.
    • B: BigQuery l√† d·ªãch v·ª• ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn m·∫°nh m·∫Ω, ph√π h·ª£p cho ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu. Dataflow c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng ƒë·ªÉ x·ª≠ l√Ω v√† t·∫°o ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, v√† Vertex AI Feature Store l√† n∆°i l∆∞u tr·ªØ ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn.
    • C: T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± A, Cloud Spanner kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu l·ªõn.
    • D: BigQuery c√≥ th·ªÉ d√πng ƒë·ªÉ ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† t·∫°o ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i l√† n∆°i t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë·ªÉ l∆∞u tr·ªØ ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng cho d·ª± ƒëo√°n tr·ª±c tuy·∫øn.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:

Question 281 of 294
Question 282 (Single answer)
You work at an organization that maintains a cloud-based communication platform that integrates conventional chat, voice, and video conferencing into one platform. The audio recordings are stored in Cloud Storage. All recordings have an 8 kHz sample rate and are more than one minute long. You need to implement a new feature in the platform that will automatically transcribe voice
call recordings into a text for future applications, such as call summarization and sentiment analysis. How should you implement the voice call transcription feature following Google-recommended best practices?

Question 282 of 294

Question 283 of 294
Question 284 (Single answer)

Question 284 of 294
Question 285 (Single answer)

Question 285 of 294
Question 286 (Single answer)
You work for a company that builds bridges for cities around the world. To track the progress of projects at the construction sites, your company has set up cameras at each location.   3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • A: AutoML c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu chi ph√≠ ban ƒë·∫ßu cho vi·ªác hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh.
    • B: Cloud Vision API c√≥ th·ªÉ cung c·∫•p gi·∫£i ph√°p t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a v·ªõi chi ph√≠ ban ƒë·∫ßu th·∫•p v√¨ n√≥ l√† d·ªãch v·ª• c√≥ s·∫µn.
    • C: BigQuery ML ch·ªß y·∫øu d√πng cho ph√¢n lo·∫°i v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch d·ªØ li·ªáu, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p cho vi·ªác ƒë√°nh d·∫•u ƒë·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng trong h√¨nh ·∫£nh.
    • D: Vertex AI c√≥ th·ªÉ y√™u c·∫ßu chi ph√≠ ban ƒë·∫ßu cho vi·ªác thi·∫øt l·∫≠p v√† hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh.
  4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
    • A: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p do chi ph√≠ hu·∫•n luy·ªán m√¥ h√¨nh.
    • B: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng cao v√¨ ƒë√°p ·ª©ng y√™u c·∫ßu chi ph√≠ th·∫•p v√† t·ª± ƒë·ªông h√≥a.
    • C: Kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng th·∫•p v√¨ kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p v·ªõi y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë√°nh d·∫•u ƒë·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng.

Question 286 of 294
Question 287 (Single answer)
You are tasked with building an MLOps pipeline to retrain tree-based models in production. The pipeline will include components related to data ingestion, data processing, model training, model evaluation, and model deployment. Your organization primarily uses PySpark-based workloads for data preprocessing. You want to minimize infrastructure management effort. How should you set up the pipeline?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch v√† gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi

Question 287 of 294
Question 288 (Single answer)
You have developed an AutoML tabular classification model that identifies high-value customers who interact with your organization's website. You plan to deploy the model to a new Vertex AI endpoint that will integrate with your website application. You expect higher traffic to the website during nights and weekends. You need to configure the model endpoint's deployment
settings to minimize latency and cost. What should you do?
B∆∞·ªõc 1: X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i

B∆∞·ªõc 2: Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points
C√°c ƒëi·ªÉm quan tr·ªçng c·∫ßn ch√∫ √Ω l√†: gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ, gi·∫£m chi ph√≠, v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng truy c·∫≠p cao v√†o ban ƒë√™m v√† cu·ªëi tu·∫ßn.
B∆∞·ªõc 3: Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√°y n1-standard-32 c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh∆∞ng chi ph√≠ cao, kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m chi ph√≠.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√°y n1-standard-4 v·ªõi minReplicaCount l√† 1 v√† maxReplicaCount l√† 8 gi√∫p c√¢n b·∫±ng gi·ªØa chi ph√≠ v√† kh·∫£ nƒÉng x·ª≠ l√Ω l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng cao.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√°y n1-standard-4 v·ªõi GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh∆∞ng chi ph√≠ GPU th∆∞·ªùng cao h∆°n, v√† maxReplicaCount l√† 4 c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng ƒë·ªß cho l∆∞u l∆∞·ª£ng cao.
- L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m√°y n1-standard-8 v·ªõi GPU c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m ƒë·ªô tr·ªÖ nh∆∞ng chi ph√≠ cao h∆°n, kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u cho chi ph√≠.
B∆∞·ªõc 4: D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n

B∆∞·ªõc 5: Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi
C√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi ƒë√∫ng l√† B: "Configure the model deployment settings to use an n1-standard-4 machine type. Set the minReplicaCount value to 1 and the maxReplicaCount value to 8."
Question 288 of 294
Question 289 (Single answer)
You developed a BigQuery ML linear regressor model by using a training dataset stored in a BigQuery table. New data is added to the table every minute. You are using Cloud Scheduler and Vertex AI Pipelines to automate hourly model training, and use the model for direct inference. The feature preprocessing logic includes quantile bucketization and MinMax scaling on data received in the last hour. You want to minimize storage and computational overhead. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i:

- M√¥ h√¨nh ƒë∆∞·ª£c hu·∫•n luy·ªán t·ª± ƒë·ªông m·ªói gi·ªù b·∫±ng Cloud Scheduler v√† Vertex AI Pipelines.
- D·ªØ li·ªáu m·ªõi ƒë∆∞·ª£c th√™m v√†o m·ªói ph√∫t.
- X·ª≠ l√Ω d·ªØ li·ªáu bao g·ªìm ph√¢n lo·∫°i theo l∆∞·ª£ng t·ª≠ v√† chu·∫©n h√≥a MinMax tr√™n d·ªØ li·ªáu nh·∫≠n ƒë∆∞·ª£c trong gi·ªù qua.

- A: Ti·ªÅn x·ª≠ l√Ω v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ d·ªØ li·ªáu trong BigQuery tr∆∞·ªõc khi ƒë∆∞a v√†o m√¥ h√¨nh c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ l∆∞u tr·ªØ.
- B: S·ª≠ d·ª•ng m·ªánh ƒë·ªÅ TRANSFORM trong c√¢u l·ªánh CREATE MODEL ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n c√°c th·ªëng k√™ c·∫ßn thi·∫øt c√≥ th·ªÉ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠ l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† t√≠nh to√°n v√¨ x·ª≠ l√Ω tr·ª±c ti·∫øp trong qu√° tr√¨nh t·∫°o m√¥ h√¨nh.
- C: T·∫°o m·ªôt th√†nh ph·∫ßn trong DAG c·ªßa Vertex AI Pipelines ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n th·ªëng k√™ c√≥ th·ªÉ ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠.
- D: T·∫°o c√°c truy v·∫•n SQL ƒë·ªÉ t√≠nh to√°n v√† l∆∞u tr·ªØ th·ªëng k√™ trong c√°c b·∫£ng BigQuery ri√™ng bi·ªát c√≥ th·ªÉ tƒÉng chi ph√≠ l∆∞u tr·ªØ.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n:
- A: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do tƒÉng chi ph√≠ l∆∞u tr·ªØ.
- B: Ph√π h·ª£p v√¨ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu chi ph√≠ l∆∞u tr·ªØ v√† t√≠nh to√°n.
- C: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do ph·ª©c t·∫°p v√† c√≥ th·ªÉ kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u v·ªÅ chi ph√≠.
- D: Kh√¥ng ph√π h·ª£p do tƒÉng chi ph√≠ l∆∞u tr·ªØ.
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi:

Question 289 of 294
Question 290 (Single answer)
You developed a Python module by using Keras to train a regression model. You developed two model architectures, linear regression and deep neural network (DNN), within the same module. You are using the training_method argument to select one of the two methods, and you are using the learning_rate and num_hidden_layers arguments in the DNN. You plan to use Vertex AI's hypertuning service with a budget to perform 100 trials. You want to identify the model architecture and hyperparameter values that minimize training loss and maximize model performance. What should you do?
Ph√¢n t√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu t√¨m ra ki·∫øn tr√∫c m√¥ h√¨nh v√† gi√° tr·ªã si√™u tham s·ªë (hyperparameter) t·ªëi ∆∞u ƒë·ªÉ gi·∫£m thi·ªÉu m·∫•t m√°t hu·∫•n luy·ªán v√† t·ªëi ƒëa h√≥a hi·ªáu su·∫•t m√¥ h√¨nh. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt ph∆∞∆°ng √°n ƒë√∫ng.
2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points: - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng Keras ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t tri·ªÉn m√¥ h√¨nh h·ªìi quy. - C√≥ hai ki·∫øn tr√∫c m√¥ h√¨nh: h·ªìi quy tuy·∫øn t√≠nh v√† m·∫°ng n∆°-ron s√¢u (DNN). - S·ª≠ d·ª•ng d·ªãch v·ª• hypertuning c·ªßa Vertex AI v·ªõi ng√¢n s√°ch cho 100 l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám. - C√°c si√™u tham s·ªë: ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p hu·∫•n luy·ªán (training_method), t·ªëc ƒë·ªô h·ªçc (learning_rate), s·ªë l·ªõp ·∫©n (num_hidden_layers).
3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi: - A: Ch·∫°y m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác hypertuning v·ªõi 100 l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám, thi·∫øt l·∫≠p num_hidden_layers l√† si√™u tham s·ªë ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán d·ª±a tr√™n si√™u tham s·ªë cha training_method, v√† learning_rate l√† si√™u tham s·ªë kh√¥ng ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y h·ª£p l√Ω v√¨ n√≥ cho ph√©p t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a c·∫£ hai ki·∫øn tr√∫c trong c√πng m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác. - B: Ch·∫°y hai c√¥ng vi·ªác hypertuning ri√™ng bi·ªát, m·ªói c√¥ng vi·ªác 50 l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y kh√¥ng t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a ng√¢n s√°ch th·ª≠ nghi·ªám v√¨ chia nh·ªè s·ªë l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám cho t·ª´ng ki·∫øn tr√∫c. - C: Ch·∫°y m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác hypertuning v·ªõi training_method l√† si√™u tham s·ªë cho 50 l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám, sau ƒë√≥ ch·ªçn ki·∫øn tr√∫c c√≥ m·∫•t m√°t th·∫•p nh·∫•t ƒë·ªÉ ti·∫øp t·ª•c t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y kh√¥ng t·∫≠n d·ª•ng t·ªëi ƒëa ng√¢n s√°ch 100 l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám ban ƒë·∫ßu. - D: Ch·∫°y m·ªôt c√¥ng vi·ªác hypertuning v·ªõi 100 l·∫ßn th·ª≠ nghi·ªám, thi·∫øt l·∫≠p num_hidden_layers v√† learning_rate l√† si√™u tham s·ªë ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán d·ª±a tr√™n si√™u tham s·ªë cha training_method. Ph∆∞∆°ng √°n n√†y kh√¥ng h·ª£p l√Ω v√¨ c·∫£ hai si√™u tham s·ªë kh√¥ng n√™n ƒë·ªÅu l√† ƒëi·ªÅu ki·ªán c√πng m·ªôt l√∫c.
4. D·ª± ƒëo√°n kh·∫£ nƒÉng ƒë√∫ng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë√°p √°n: - A: Cao - B: Th·∫•p - C: Trung b√¨nh - D: Th·∫•p
5. Ch·ªçn ra c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi cho c√¢u h·ªèi: ƒê√°p √°n ƒë√∫ng l√† A.
Question 290 of 294
Question 291 (Single answer)
You work for a hospital. You received approval to collect the necessary patient data, and you trained a Vertex AI tabular AutoML model that calculates patients' risk score for hospital admission. You deployed the model. However, you're concerned that patient demographics might change over time and alter the feature interactions and impact prediction accuracy. You want to be alerted if feature interactions change, and you want to understand the importance of the features for the predictions. You want your alerting approach to minimize cost. What should you do?
Gi·∫£i th√≠ch c√¢u h·ªèi v√† ƒë√°p √°n
  1. X√°c ƒë·ªãnh y√™u c·∫ßu ƒë·ªÅ b√†i: ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu b·∫°n ch·ªçn ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p gi√°m s√°t ƒë·ªÉ ph√°t hi·ªán s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi trong t∆∞∆°ng t√°c c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng (feature interactions) v√† hi·ªÉu ƒë∆∞·ª£c t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng ƒë·ªëi v·ªõi d·ª± ƒëo√°n, ƒë·ªìng th·ªùi t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠. ƒê·ªÅ b√†i y√™u c·∫ßu ch·ªçn m·ªôt l·ª±a ch·ªçn ƒë√∫ng.
  2. Ph√¢n t√≠ch key points:
    • Gi√°m s√°t s·ª± thay ƒë·ªïi c·ªßa t∆∞∆°ng t√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng (feature drift).
    • Hi·ªÉu t·∫ßm quan tr·ªçng c·ªßa c√°c ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng (feature attribution).
    • T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a chi ph√≠ gi√°m s√°t.
  3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:
    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn A: Gi√°m s√°t drift c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v·ªõi t·∫ßn su·∫•t l·∫•y m·∫´u l√† 1 v√† t·∫ßn su·∫•t gi√°m s√°t h√†ng tu·∫ßn. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªën k√©m do t·∫ßn su·∫•t l·∫•y m·∫´u cao.
    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn B: Gi√°m s√°t drift c·ªßa ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v·ªõi t·∫ßn su·∫•t l·∫•y m·∫´u l√† 0.1 v√† t·∫ßn su·∫•t gi√°m s√°t h√†ng tu·∫ßn. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y gi·∫£m chi ph√≠ do t·∫ßn su·∫•t l·∫•y m·∫´u th·∫•p h∆°n.
    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn C: Gi√°m s√°t drift c·ªßa attribution ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v·ªõi t·∫ßn su·∫•t l·∫•y m·∫´u l√† 1 v√† t·∫ßn su·∫•t gi√°m s√°t h√†ng tu·∫ßn. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± A, c√≥ th·ªÉ t·ªën k√©m.
    • L·ª±a ch·ªçn D: Gi√°m s√°t drift c·ªßa attribution ƒë·∫∑c tr∆∞ng v·ªõi t·∫ßn su·∫•t l·∫•y m·∫´u l√† 0.1 v√† t·∫ßn su·∫•t gi√°m s√°t h√†ng tu·∫ßn. T∆∞∆°ng t·ª± B, gi·∫£m chi ph√≠.

Question 291 of 294
Question 292 (Single answer)
You are developing a TensorFlow Extended (TFX) pipeline with standard TFX components. The pipeline includes data preprocessing steps. After the pipeline is deployed to production, it will process up to 100 TB of data stored in BigQuery. You need the data preprocessing steps to scale efficiently, publish metrics and parameters to Vertex AI Experiments, and track artifacts by using Vertex ML Metadata. Question 292 of 294
Question 293 (Single answer)
You are developing a batch process that will train a custom model and perform predictions. You need to be able to show lineage for both your model and the batch predictions. What should you do?
H∆∞·ªõng d·∫´n gi·∫£i c√¢u h·ªèi

Question 293 of 294
Question 294 (Single answer)
You work for a company that sells corporate electronic products to thousands of businesses worldwide. Your company stores historical customer data in BigQuery. You need to build a model that predicts customer lifetime value over the next three years. You want to use the simplest approach to build the model. What should you do?

3. Ph√¢n t√≠ch ƒë√°nh gi√° s·ª± ph√π h·ª£p c·ªßa c√°c c√¢u tr·∫£ l·ªùi:

Question 294 of 294
